GIFT OF 




MASSACHUSETTS 



SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 



REVOLUTIONARY WAR. 



A COMPILATION FROM THE ARCHIVES, 

PREPARED AND PUBLISHED BT THE 

SECRETARY OF THE COMMONWEALTH 

IN ACCORDANCE WITH CHAPTER 100, RESOLVES 
OF 1891. 



BOSTON : 

WRIGHT & POTTER PRINTING CO., STATE PRINTERS, 

18 POST OFFICE SQUARE. 

1905. 






r 



MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

IN THE 

WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 



NOTE. All names are given exactly as they appear on the original records. The order of 
arrangement of the facts of service in each individual record given is the same, aa nearly as pos 
sible, as the original entries, and is as follows : The name; the place of residence, if given; the 
rank; the kind of document whereon the record appears; the enlistment and discharge, if 
given; the time of service ; remarks. 

A discrepancy will sometimes be noted between the service given and the actual service as 
figured between the dates of enlistment and discharge. The difference is accounted for by the 
practice of including, with service performed, a time allowance for travel on the basis of one 
day for every 20 miles out or home. As the same name may appear under various forms, each 
carrying some portion of a record of service, it is necessary in order to obtain the complete 
record, as far as preserved, of any given individual, to examine all the forms under which 
a name is stated to appear in the Record Index. 



T)EA, . [This name also appears under the form of Raa, Rae, Ray.] 

REA, , Ipswich. Corporal, Capt. Robert Dodge s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s 

regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance to camp and home, etc., sworn to Nov. 
29, 1776 ; said Rea credited with allowance for 2 days (42 miles) travel ; com 
pany drafted from Amesbury, Newbury, Rowley, Ipswich, Topsfield, Wenham, 
and Lynn. 

REA, ARCH., Danvers. Doctor, brigantine "Cutter" (privateer), commanded by 
Capt. Samuel Croel ; descriptive list of officers and crew, dated Salem, Aug. 15, 
1780; age, 23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; complexion, light; residence, Danvers. 

REA, ARCHELAUS, Jr., Danvers (probably). Private, Capt. Jeremiah Page s co. : 
service, 2 days, probably on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; also, 2d Lieutenant, 
Capt. Andrew Putnam s (7th) co., Col. Larkin Thorndike s (8th Essex Co.) 
regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers ; commissioned April 24, 1778. 

REA, ASA. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Carter s co., Col. Job Cushing s (Worcester 
Co.) regt. ; entered service Sept. 7, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 22, 1777 : service, 1 
mo. 24 days, at the Northward, including 8 days (160 miles) travel home. Roll 
dated Leominster. 

REA, BENJAMIN, Danvers. Capt. Asa Prince s co., Col. Mansfield s regt. ; order for 
advance pay, signed by said Rea and others, dated Cambridge, June 8, 1775 ; 
also, Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 
13, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 24 days ; also, Capt. Prince s co., Col. John Mansfield s 
(19th) regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutchinson ; company return 
dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for boiinty coat or its equivalent in money; 
memorandum on reverse of order states that money was paid to Capt. Prince 
Dec. 21 [1775].

KEA, BENJAMIN. Sergeant, Capt. William Tlmrlo s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s

REA, CALEB, Danvers. Capt. Thomas Barnes s co., Col. Mansfield s regt.; order 
for advance pay, signed by said Rea and others, dated Cambridge, June 27, 
1775; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted 
May 27, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 9 days ; also, Capt. Barnes s co., Col. John Mans 
field s (19th) regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutchinson ; company 
return dated Camp at Winter Hill, Oct. 5, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or 
its equivalent in money dated Winter Hill, Oct. 27, 1775. 

REA, CALEB. Company receipt for mileage, given to Capt. John Ford, dated 
Ticonderoga, Aug. 28, 1770; also, company receipt, given to Capt. John Ford, 
for wages to Oct. 1, 1770, dated Ticonderoga; company marched from Chelms- 
ford July 25, 1776, and was discharged at Albany Jan. 1, 1777. 

REA, EBENEZER. Capt. Jonathan Procter s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of guards ; 
enlisted Nov. 12, 1777 ; service to April 3, 1778, 4 mos. 22 days, at Charlestown 
and Cambridge. 

REA, GIDEON, Beverly. Private, Lieut. Peter Shaw s co. which inarched probably 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 2 days ; reported returned home ; also, 
Capt. Jonathan Procter s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of guards; enlisted 
Nov. 17, 1777; service to April 3, 1778, 4 mos. 17 days, at Charlestown and 
Cambridge. 

REA, ISAAC, Beverly. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Putnam s co.. Col. Nathaniel Wade s 
regt. ; engaged Aug. 12, 1778 ; service to Dec. 31, 1778, 4 mos. 24 days, at Rhode 
Island, including 4 days (75 miles) travel home ; also, same co. and regt. ; mus 
ter roll dated North Kingston, Nov. 0, 1778; also, same co. and regt. ; muster 
rolls dated East Greenwich, Sept. 17, Sept. 24, Oct. 14, and Nov. 13, 1778 ; enlist 
ment to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

REA, JOHN, Danvers. Private, Capt. John Putnam s (Alarm) co. of Danvers, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 2 days.

and Lynn. 

REA, JOHN. Private, Capt. Stephen Perkins s co., Col. Cogswell s regt. ; enlisted 
Sept. 22, 1770 ; discharged Nov. 10, 177(5 ; service, 2 mos. 7 days, including 12 
days (250 miles) travel home. Roll dated North Castle. 

REA, JOHN. Private, Capt. John Dodge s detachment of militia, Col. Gerrish s 
regt.; muster roll for Feb., 1778, dated Winter Hill ; service guarding Lieiit. 
Gen. Burgoyne s army; also, Capt. Dodge s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of 
guards; enlisted Nov. 21, 1777; service to April 3, 1778, 4 mos. 13 days, at

REA, JOSEPH, Beverly. Captain, Oth (Beverly) co., Col. Henry Herrick s (8th 
Essex Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers chosen in said regiment, dated 
Charlestown, March 29, 1770 ; ordered in Council April 2, 1770, that said officers 
be commissioned ; reported commissioned April 2, 177(5 ; also, Captain ; entered 
service July 25, 177(5 ; service, 3 mos. 3 days, in defence of seacoast ; company 
ordered to serve at the Lines at Beverly and discharged Oct. 28, 177(5: also, 
Captain, Col. Timothy Pickering, Jr. s regt. : return made to Maj. Gen. James 
Warren of officers of a regiment raised by Brig. Michael Farley from his bri 
gade and ordered to march to Danbury, Conn., via Providence, dated Ipswich, 
Dec. 24, 1779 ; company raised in Beverly and Lynn.

REA, JOSHUA, Boxford (probably) . Private, Capt. Jacob Gould s co. of militia, 
Col. Samuel Johnson s regt., which inarched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 4 days; reported returned home. 

REA, JOSHUA (also given JOSHUA, Jr.), Boxford. Private, Capt. William Perley s 
co., Col. James Frye s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service to April 25, 1775, 7 days ; reported enlisted Feb. 16, 1775 ; also, Capt. 
Perley s co., Col. Frye s regt.; return of men in canip at Cambridge, dated 
May 17, 1775 ; also, muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 26, 1775 ; 
service, 3 mo. 13 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge, Nov. 14, 1775. 

REA, JOSHUA, Boxford. Private, Capt. Jonathan Foster s co., Col. Nathaniel 
Wade s regt. ; enlisted July 3, 1778; company stationed at Middletown, R. I., 
for 6 months from July 1, 1778 ; also, Capt. Jonathan Evans s co., Col. Wade s 
regt. : enlisted July 3, 1778; discharged Jan. 1, 1779; service, 6 mos. 5 days, at 
North Kingston, R. I., including 6 days (115 miles) travel home ; also, same co. 
and regt. ; muster roll dated North Kingston, Nov. 6, 1778; also, same co. and 
regt. : muster rolls dated East Greenwich, Sept. 17, Sept. 22, Oct. 14, and Nov. 
13, 1778; enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

REA, ROGERS, Salem. Capt. Ebenezer Winship s co., Col. John Nixon s (5th) 
regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Rea and others, dated Cambridge, 
June 22, 1775 ; also, Sergeant, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 
1775; engaged May 3, 1775; service, 3 mos. 6 days; also, company return 
endorsed " Sep tr 30th 1775; " also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent hi 
money dated Dec. 22, 1775. 

REA, WILLIAM, Topsfield. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Col. Jonathan Cogswell s (3d Essex Co.) regt., as returned by Capt. 
Stephen Perkins and Capt. Nehemiah Herrick ; residence, Topsfield ; engaged 
for town of Topsfield; joined Capt. Page s co., Col. Francis s regt.; term, 3 
years; also, Private, Capt. Samuel Page s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt.; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 26, 1777, to Feb. 26, 1780; 
reported discharged Feb. 26, 1780; also, Capt. Page s co., Col. Ebenezer 
Francis s regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, Feb. 26 [1777], to 
time of arrival at Bennington ; credited with 27 days allowance ; the Captain 
and 1st Lieutenant to march April 1, 1777, the rest to march March 12, 1777. 

REA, WILLIAM. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for 
Suffolk Co., dated Boston, May 6, 1778; Col. Crane s regt.; also, Matross, 
Capt. Lillie sco., Col. John Crane s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for 
service from June 2, 1777, to June 2, 1778; reported as belonging to Connecti 
cut ; also reported deserted. 

REA, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Daniel Sullivan s co., Col. Benjamin Forster s (6th 
Lincoln Co.) regt. : entered service Oct. 27, 1780; discharged Nov. 2, 1780; ser 
vice, 7 days; company ordered on duty by Col. John Allen to protect the 
inhabitants of Frenchman s Bay. Roll sworn to at No. 4 and certified at 
Headquarters, Eastern Indian Department, Machias.

granted subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781; leave given said Reab by Gen. Washing 
ton to go from Windsor on a furlough from April 16, 1783, to May 1, 1783; re 
ported overstayed 4 days ; also, returns of effectives between May 2, 1783, and 
June 13, 1783 ; reported acting as Quarter Master. 

REABB, GEORGE. Ensign and Lieutenant, Col. Gamaliel Bradford s (14th) regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; 
reported as serving 3 mos. 15 days as Ensign, 8 mos. 15 days as Lieutenant; 
also, Ensign, Maj. John Wiley s (3d) co., Col. Bradford s regt. ; muster roll of 
field, staff, and commissioned officers for July, 1780, dated " Steenropie ; " 
appointed Oct. 8, 1779; reported on command at "Paramus;" also, Lieuten 
ant, same regt. ; list of officers promoted in the Continental Army and for whom 
warrants were made out; also, Lieutenant, Maj. Wiley s co., Col. Bradford s 
regt. ; muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned officers for Oct., Nov., and 
Dec., 1780, dated Huts near West Point; appointed April 16, 1780. 

REABE, GEORGE, Boston. Sergeant, 8th co., Col. Bradford s regt. ; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; credited to town of 
Roxbury; term, during war; also, Capt. Isaiah Stetson s co., Col. Bradford s 
regt. ; pay abstract for subsistence, dated Boston ; enlisted Jan. 1, 1777 ; marched 
April 15, 1777 ; credited with 100 days allowance ; reported joined Jan. 9, 1777 ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; return [year not given] ; residence, Boston; enlisted 
for town of Roxbury ; mustered by County and Continental Muster Masters ; 
also, list of officers recommended to fill vacancies in 14th Mass, regt., as returned 
by Col. Gamaliel Bradford ; said Reabe recommended for an Ensigncy, com 
mission to date from Oct. 8, 1779; ordered in Council Dec. 28, 1779, that said 
officers be commissioned.

READ, ABEL, Chelmsford. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co. to rein 
force the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, as returned 
by Brig. Gen. Eleazer Brooks to Maj. Hosmer, dated Lincoln, July 21, 1779; 
Capt. Minott s co., 7th Middlesex Co. regt.; age, 22 yrs. ; stature, 6 ft. 1 in. 
(also given 6 ft.) ; complexion, light ; residence, Chelmsford ; engaged for town 
of Chelmsford ; reported delivered to Ensign Clark.

days. 

READ, ABEL. Private, Capt. Joshua Parker s co.. Col. Robinson s regt.; enlisted 
Sept. 15, 1777; service to Jan. 1, 1778, at Rhode Island. 

READ, ABEL. Receipt dated Boston, May 31, 1782, for bounty paid said Read and 
others by Col. Zech. Wright, Chairman of Class No. 1 of the town of Westford, 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years ; also, Private, Col. 
Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from May 30, 1782, 7 mos. 2 days. 

READ, ABIJAH, Salem. Seaman, ship "Rhodes," commanded by Capt. Nehemiah 
Buffinton ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to Aug. 14, 1780 ; age, 26 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, light; residence, Salem. 

READ, ABIJAH, Westford. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, as 
returned by Capt. Zaccheus Wright and Capt. Pelatiah Fletcher, endorsed 
"Wesford Feb. 16 78;" residence, Westford; engaged for town of Ashby; 
joined Capt. Ballard s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; term, 3 years, to expire in 1780. 

READ, ABIJAH. Capt. Gideon Foster s co., Col. Mansfield s regt. ; receipt for advance 
pay, signed by said Read and others, dated Cambridge, July 4, 1775. 

READ, ABIJAH. Private, Capt. Jonathan Minott s co., Col. Baldwin s regt. ; pay 
abstract for mileage from home to headquarters and return, dated Cambridge, 
Jan. 12, 1776 ; mileage for 52 miles allowed said Read. 

READ, ABIJAH. Order on Deacon Jeffers, Paymaster to the Colony troops, payable 
to Col. Ephraim Jackson, dated Camp at Hull, July 10, 1776, signed by said 
Read and others belonging to Capt. Abishai Brown s co., Col. Whitney s regt., 
for advance pay, travel allowance, etc. ; also, petition dated Camp at Hull, 
Sept. 17, 1776, signed by said Read and others belonging to battalion stationed 
at Hull, asking for increase and payment of wages. 

READ, ABRAHAM, North Yarmouth. Descriptive list of men raised in Cumberland 
Co. to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months from the time 
of their arrival at camp, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, and mustered in 
from Gen. Thompson s brigade, certified in Cumberland Co., June 4, 1778, by 
Daniel Ilsley, Muster Master for said county, as mustered and delivered to Maj. 
James Johnston, Superintendent; Capt. Russell s co., Col. Mitchell s regt.; 
age, 29 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9| (also given 5 ft. 9) in. ; complexion, light : resi 
dence, North Yarmouth; engaged for town of North Yarmouth ; mustered May 
19, 1778 ; also, list of men returned as received of Maj. James Johnson, Superin 
tendent for Cumberland Co., by Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, at Fishkill, 
June 25, 1778 ; arrived at Fiskkill June 11, 1778 ; also, list of men returned as 
received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778.

Ide s (Attleborough) co., Col. Dagget s regt.; service, 10 days; company

READ, BAILEY, Freetown. Descriptive list of men raised in Bristol Co. for the term

Pope s regt. ; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, dark ; residence, Free 
town ; arrived at Fishkill June 18 [1778] ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised 
by the town of Freetown for service in the Continental Army during 1780; 
marched Sept. 18, 1780; discharged March 24, 1781; service, 6 mos. 15 days, 
including travel (180 miles) home; also, Private, Capt. Luke Day s co., Lieut. 
Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; muster roll for Feb. and March, 1781, dated 
West Point ; enlisted Sept. 25, 1780 ; discharged March 21, 1781 ; enlistment, 
6 months.

THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 



READ, BENJAMIN, Attleborough. Private, Capt. James Perry s co., Col. Paul Dud 
ley Sargent s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 12, 1775 ; enlisted July 2, 1775 ; 
service, 1 mo. 13 days; also, company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, list of 
men belonging to Capt. Richardson s co. of No. 12 Attleborough who engaged 
in the various campaigns subsequent to the Lexington alarm ; said Read re 
ported as having engaged in the 1st campaign, known as the 8 months cam 
paign; also, Capt. Stephen Richardson s 4th (2d Attleborough) co., Col. John 
Dagget s regt. ; said Read reported as having engaged in the service at Cam 
bridge for about 5 months in 1775 ; said service known as the 2d campaign ; 
also, copy of an order on Ephraim Newell, Town Treasurer of Attleborough, 
dated July 5, 1776, for wages due said Read and others for service on the alarm 
caused by the battle of Bunker Hill ; also, Capt. Stephen Richardson s 4th (2d 
Attleborough, also given Attleborough No. 12) co., Col. Daggett s regt. ; list 
of men hi the 12 months service in 1776, known as the 4th (also given 3d) 
campaign; also, Capt. Stephen Richardson s co. ; service, 25 days; company 
comprised one-fourth of the militia of the town of Attleborough, marched to 
Rhode Island April 21, 1777, to hold the Lines until men could be raised for 
that purpose for 2 months, and served until May 15, 1777. 

READ, BENJAMIN, Mendon. Private, Capt. Samuel Warren s co., Col. Joseph Read s 
(20th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 27, 1775 ; service, 
3 mos. 12 days; also, company return dated Sept. 26, 1775; also, order for 
bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury Camp, Dec. 26, 1775. 

READ, BENJAMIN, Rutland. Capt. Adam Wheeler s co., Col. Doolittle s regt. ; 
receipt for advance pay, signed by said Read and others, dated July 13, 1775. 

READ, BENJAMIN, Township No. 5. Private, Lieut. Joseph Warner s co. of Minute- 
men, which marched April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; 
service to April 27, 1775, 7 days; reported enlisted into the army; also, Capt. 
AbelThayer s co., Col. John Fellows s (8th) regt.; company return dated 
Dorchester, Oct. -, 1775. 

READ, BENJAMIN, Williamsburg (probably) . Corporal, Lieut. Abel Thayer s de

chester Camp, Nov. 22, 1775. 

READ, BENJAMIN. Private, Capt. Jonathan Wales s co., in a regiment commanded 
by Lieut. Col. Samuel Williams ; enlisted Dec. 20, 1776 ; discharged March 20, 
1777 ; service, 3 mos. 13 days, including 10 days (200 miles) travel home. Roll 
dated Morristown. 

READ, BENJAMIN. Private, Capt. Asa Laurance s co. of volunteers, Col. Jonathan 
Reed s regt. ; entered service Sept. 26, 1777; discharged Nov. 9, 1777; service, 
1 mo. 15 days, at the Northward ; company raised in Littleton and "Westford 
and marched to assist army under Gen. Gates. 

READ, BENJAMIN. Private, Capt. Phineas Walker s detachment of guards, 7th 
Worcester Co. regt.; entered service Oct. 3, 1779; discharged Oct. 20, 1779; 
service, 18 days; detachment stationed at Rutland.

READ, BRACKLEY. Descriptive return dated Boston, Jan. 5, 1781, made by Edward 
Procter, Colonel of Boston regt., of men who had enlisted to serve in the militia 
under Brig. Gen. John Fellows for the term of 3 months from the time of their 
arrival at place of rendezvous, unless sooner discharged, and who had received 
bounty and mileage due them of said Col. Procter; Capt. Loring s co. ; age, 
30 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, brown.

of Western; joined Capt. Fish s co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; term, during war.

(2d) regt.; entered service July 25, 1779; discharged April 25, 1780; term, 9 
months. 

READ, HEZEKIAH, Hatfield. Descriptive list of men raised in Hampshire Co. for the 
term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Fishkill ; Capt. Murray s 
co., Col. Chapen s regt.; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, dark; 
residence, Hatfield ; arrived at Fishkill June 16, 1778 ; also, descriptive list 
dated Hutts, three miles from West Point, Jan. 28, 1781 ; Capt. Edes s co., 9th 
Mass. regt. commanded by Col. H. Jackson : rank, Private ; age, 19 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, dark ; occupation, yeoman ; resi 
dence, Hatfield ; enlisted April 3 (also given Dec. 3) , 1779, by Capt. Watson ; 
enlistment, during war.

of Raynham; arrived at Springfield July 10, 1780; marched to camp July 11,

READ, JOSEPH, Acton. Order on Deacon Jeffrais, payable to Capt. Abishai Brown, 
dated Camp at Hull, Aug. 29, 1776, signed by said Read and otbers belonging 
to Capt. Brown s co., Col. Whitney s regt., for advance pay, travel allowance, 
etc. ; also, petition dated Camp at Hull, Sept. 17, 1776, signed by said Read and 
others belonging to battalion stationed at Hull, asking for increase and payment 
of wages. 

READ, JOSEPH, North Yarmouth. Subsistence roll of Capt. Daniel Merrill s co., 
Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, Jan. 
1, 1777, to March 17, 1777 ; credited with 92 days subsistence, including allow 
ance for travel (320 miles) on march from home to Bennington, the place of 
rendezvous. 

READ, JOSEPH, Uxbridge. Lieutenant Colonel, Col. Silas Wheelock s (7th Worces 
ter Co.) regt. ; service, 9 days ; regiment marched to Cambridge and Roxbury 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; also, Colonel ; regimental return dated Camp 
at Roxbury, May 18, 1775 ; commissions for officers of said Read s regiment 
received by him at Watertown May 24, 1775; also, returns of officers for pro 
visions, dated Roxbury, June 5, and June 25, 1775; also, Colonel; engaged 
April 24, 1775 ; service to Aug. 1, 1775, 3 mos. 15 days ; also, return of field and 
staff officers, dated Sept. 26, 1775 ; also, return of militia officers and men who 
joined said Read s regiment at Roxbury Camp Dec. 10, 1775, certified in Camp 
at Roxbury, Jan. 19, 1776 ; ordered in Council Feb. 9, 1776, that said officers be 
commissioned .

the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, returned as received

1779; Capt. Hunt s co., Col. Faulkner s regt. ; age, 40 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; 
complexion, dark ; engaged for town of Acton.

READ, REUBEN, Western (Warren) . Captain of a company of Minute-men and 
others, Col. Jonathan Warner s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in re 
sponse to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Roxbury ; service, 25 days; also, 1st 
Major, 4th Worcester Co. regt. ; list of field officers of regiments of Worcester 
Co. militia proposed by Legislature Jan. 12, 1776 ; regiment raised in Brook- 
field, Western, New Braintree, Hardwick, and Oakham ; also, list of officers 
chosen by the several companies in Col. James Converse s (4th Worcester Co.) 
regt. of Mass, militia, as returned by said Read, Major, and others, dated 
Brookfield, May 14, 1776 ; ordered in Council May 31, 1776, that said officers 
be commissioned; also, petition addressed to the General Court, signed by 
said Read and James Stone, stating that they had joined Col. Holman s regt. 
as volunteers, the former in the capacity of Major and the latter as Lieutenant 
Colonel, said regiment having been ordered out by Brig. Gen. Fellows ; that 
they had proceeded from Western to North river and were present at the cap- 
tiire of Gen. Burgoyne s army ; that they had gone out without expectation of 
recompense for their services, but inasmuch as others who had rendered similar 
service had been paid, asking allowance for their wages and subsistence ; peti 
tion reported as having been granted ; also, pay abstract for wages and rations 
of said Read and James Stone who joined Col. Holman s regt. which served 
at the Northward by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows at the time of taking Gen. 
Burgoyne ; wages and rations allowed said Read for 1 mo. 2 days ; warrant 
allowed in Council Oct. 9, 1778.

May 7, 1775 : service to Aug. 1, 1775, 3 mos. 2 days ; also, list of field and staff

gaged Sept. 20, 1777 : discharged Oct. 14, 1777 : service, 29 days, on expedition

before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently except on

6th Mass. regt. formerly commanded by Col. Ichabod Alden ; muster roll for 
March and April, 1779, dated Cherry Valley ; enlisted March 20, 1777 : enlist 
ment, 3 years ; also, Capt. Holden s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 20, 1780.

way credited with allowance for 2 days (48 miles) travel ; company drafted 
from Rehoboth, Attleborough, Norton, Mansfield, and Easton; also, Capt. 
Sylvanus Martin s co., Col. Williams s regt.; service from Sept. 29, 1777, to 
Oct. 30, 1777, at Tiverton ; roll dated Rehoboth.

ell s (3d Plymouth Co.) regt. ; residence, Boston (also given Bridgewater) ; 
engaged for town of Bridgewater; joined Capt. Warren s co., Col. Alden s 
regt.; term, 3 years; also, Private, 3d co., Col. Brooks s regt.; Continental

also, Capt. Warren s co., (late) Col. Alden s regt.; return of men who were 
in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently

dated Cambridge, June 27, 1775; also, Private, same co. and regt.; muster

marched to Cambridge ; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Cambridge, Dec. 25, 
1775. 

REED, BRACKLEY. Private, Capt. Alexander Hodgdon s co., Col. Ebenezer Thayer s 
regt. ; enlisted Aug. 11, 1780; discharged Oct. 30, 1780; service, 2 mos. 23 days, 
including 3 days (65 miles) travel home; regiment raised in Suffolk Co. to 
reinforce Continental Army for 3 months and stationed at Rhode Island.

1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Lebbeus Ball s co., Col. Shepard s regt.;

of ".Deaton ; " mustered by State and Continental Muster Masters ; also, same 
co. and regt. ; muster roll for July and Aug., 1778, dated Camp at Providence ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Oct., 1778; also, Maj. Ball s co., Col. 
Shepard s regt.; muster rolls for Nov., 1778, March and April, 1779, dated 
Camp at Providence; enlisted Dec. 25, 1777 [6] ; enlistment, during war; re 
ported under guard in Nov., 1778 ; also, Major s co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; 
residence, Dartmouth; also, Major s co., Col. William Shepard s (4th) regt.; 
return made up for the year 1780, dated West Point and endorsed "Capt. 
Fullers Comp y; " enlisted Dec. 7, 1776.

David Greene s (2d Middlesex Co.) regt., which marched probably on the

gent s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged April 24, 1775; service,

REED, HENRY. List of men belonging to the several transports employed on Penob- 
scot expedition, as per a roll made up agreeable to resolve of March 23, 1784, 
and attested by Joshua Davis, Agent ; said Reed reported as belonging to the 
sloop " Sally." 

REED, HEZEKIAH, Hatfield. Descriptive list of men raised for Continental service, 
as returned by Noah Goodman, Superintendent for Hampshire Co. [year not 
given] ; Capt. Murray s co. ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, 
black; engaged for town of Hatfield; arrived at Fishkill June 16, 1778; also, 
list of men raised in Hampshire Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of 
their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, returned as 
received of Jonathan "Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 
1778; also, list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by 
Capt. Joshua Woodbridge ; residence, Hatfield ; engaged for town of Hatfield ; 
joined Capt. Ward s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; term, 3 years; also, Private, 
Capt. William Wattson s co., Col. James Wesson s (9th) regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Dec. 20, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. 
J. Edes s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; term, during war; also, Capt. William 
Watson s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; return for clothing for the year 1780. 

REED, HEZEKIAH. Private, Capt. Nathan Alden s co., Col. Edward Mitchell s 
regt. ; service, 16 days; company marched to Rhode Island under command of 
Lieut. John Whitman on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776. 

REED, HOWARD (also given Hayward), Townsend. Capt. Edmund Longley s co.,

ing disposition of the forces about Boston and dividing the army into 3 grand 
divisions to consist of 2 brigades each ; said Reed, Colonel of a New Hampshire 
regt. assigned to a brigade to be commanded by Brig. Gen. Sullivan which was

to form part of left wing, or 2d division, of the army under Maj. Gen. Lee, and 
to be stationed at Winter Hill; also, general order dated Headquarters, Ticon- 
deroga, Aug. 25, 177(5, taken from Col. Wheelock s Orderly Book; said Reed, 
Colonel, appointed Brigadier General.

REED, JAMES. Private, Capt. Thomas Newcomb s co., Col. Ebenezer Thayer s 
regt. ; enlisted July 31, 1780; discharged Oct. 31, 1780; service, 3 mos. 4 days,

ordered part to West Point and part to Rhode Island ; regiment raised in 
Suffolk Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

lage: reported on command at Verplanck s Point; also, muster rolls for Oct.,

IX THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 



REED, JAMES. Boy, sloop " Winthrop," commanded by Capt. George Little; 
engaged Sept. 28, 1782; discharged Nov. 25, 1782; service, 1 mo. 27 days. 
Roll sworn to at Boston. 

REED, JASON. Sergeant, Capt. David Bent s co., Col. Xathan Sparhawk s regt.; 
travel out and home 226 miles; service at 20 miles per day, 11 days; company 
detached Aug. 20, 1777, and marched from Rutland to Bennington on an alarm ; 
also, Capt. John Boynton s co., Col. Nathan Sparhawk s regt. commanded by 
Major Jonas Wilder: entered service Sept. 27, 1777; discharged Oct. 18, 1777; 
service, 29 days, in Northern department, including 7 days (141 miles) travel 
home; company raised for 30 days service; also, Capt. Jotham Hough ton s 
co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. : service from July 31, 1778, to date of dis 
charge, Sept. 13, 1778, 1 mo. 14 days; company raised for 6 weeks service at 
Rhode Island ; roll dated Petersham. 

REED, JEREMIAH, Billerica. Private, Capt. Jonathan Stickney s co., Col. Bridge s 
regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
6 days; reported enlisted into the army ; also, Capt. Jonathan Stickney s co., 
Col. Ebenezer Bridge s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 
25, 1775; service, 1 mo. 1 day; also, company return dated Cambridge, Sept. 

25, 1775 : reported enlisted into the train May 24, 1775 : also, Sergeant, Capt. 
Samuel Trevett s co., Col. Richard Gridley s (Artillery) regt.; enlisted May 

26, 1775: service, 26 days. 

REED, JEREMIAH, Halifax. Corporal, Capt. John Wood s co., Col. Paul Dudley 
Sargent s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 : enlisted April 24, 1775 : ser 
vice, 3 mos. 15 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; reported on 
furlough. 

REED, JEREMIAH, Marblehead. Capt. William Hooper s co. ; company receipt 
for advance pay given to Daniel Hopkins, dated Salem, Sept. 26, 1775 ; 
also, Sergeant, same co. ; enlisted July 15, 1775; service to Dec. 31, 1775, 5 
mos. 30 clays, in defence of seacoast ; also, list of men raised to serve in the 
Continental Army from Col. Jonathan Glover s (5th Essex Co.) regt. ; resi 
dence, Marblehead; engaged for town of Marblehead; term, 3 years: also, 
Lieutenant, Col. Henry Jackson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for 
service from Jan. 1, 1777, to March 25, 1779; reported resigned; also, Lieuten 
ant, Capt. D. Van Home s co., Col. Jackson s regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. 
William S. Smith; pay rolls for Oct. and Nov., 1778: reported resigned Nov. 
15, 1778; also, return certified at Camp near Morristown, April 30, 1780, of 
officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s 
regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., 
who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry 
Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9, 1779 ; rank, Lieutenant ; 
residence, Marblehead: appointed Jan. 1, 1777; said Reed returned among 
officers belonging to Col. William R. Lee s regt. who were not included in 
the above arrangement ; reported resigned March 25, 1779. 

REED, JEREMIAH, Pembroke. Private, Capt. Samuel N. Nelson s co., Col. Aaron 
Willard s regt. ; pay abstract for mileage and travel allowance from home to 
Skeensborough, via No. 4 or Charlestown, dated Boston: 232 miles travel 
allowed said Reed ; also, same co. and regt. : pay abstract for mileage and 
travel allowance from Fort Edward to Plymouth and adjacent towns, via 
Albany, dated Plymouth, Dec. 20, 1776: 269 miles travel allowed said Reed.

REED, JESSE, Deerfield (also given Whately). Return of men raised to serve in 
the Continental Army from 5th Hampshire Co. regt., endorsed " Col o David 
Field s Return; " engaged for town of Deerfield; joined Capt. Day s co., Col. 
Oldiii s (Alden s) regt. ; term, 3 years; also, list of men raised by the town of 
Deerfield to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Capt. Nathan 
Frary, sworn to before Justin Ely, one of the commissioners to settle disputes 
between towns in Hampshire Co. concerning Continental soldiers ; residence, 
Deerfield; engaged for town of Deerfield; joined Capt. Flower s co., Col. 
Graton s regt.; term, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. Luke Day s co., Col. 
Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from April 29, 1777, 
to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Luke Day s co., Col. Ichabod Alden s (6th) regt. ; 
return dated Jan. 11,1778; residence, Whately ; enlisted for town of Williams- 
burgh ; mustered by Ruggles Woodbridge, Muster Master for Hampshire Co., 
and by a Continental Muster Master; reported on furlough; also, Capt. Day s 
co., (late) Col. Alden s regt. ; return of men who were in camp on or before 
Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, 
etc., certified at Cherry Valley, Feb. 24, 1779; also, same co. and regt. ; mus 
ter roll for March and April, 1779, dated Cherry Valley and sworn to in Quar 
ters at Fort Alden ; also, Capt. Reed s co., Col. Brooks s regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780 ; also, descrip 
tive list of men in Continental service; Capt. Luke Day s co., Lieut. Col. 
J. Brooks s (7th) regt. ; age, 23 (also given 22 and 24) yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 in. 
(also given 6 ft.) ; complexion, light; hair, light (also given brown) ; occupa 
tion, farmer; birthplace, Windsor, Conn, (also given Deerfield) ; residence, 
Deerfield ; engaged Feb. - (also given April -, 1777, by Capt. Reed) ; term, 
during war; also, Private, Capt. Luke Day s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s 
(7th) regt. ; muster rolls for Jan. and May, 1781, dated West Point ; reported 
on command at the Lines in Jan., 1781 ; also, muster rolls for July and Aug., 
1781 ; reported on command with the boats in July, 1781 ; also, muster roll for 
Sept., 1781, certified at Continental Village ; also, muster roll for Dec., 1781, 
dated York Hutts; reported furloughed Dec. 22, 1781, for 55 days; also, regis 
ter of furloughs granted subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; leave given said Reed by 
Col. Vose Feb. 17, 1782, to go from New Windsor to Deerfield for 57 days; 
reported overstayed 1 day ; also, list of men who died or were discharged 
subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; said Reed discharged June 8, 1783, by Gen. Wash 
ington, term of enlistment having expired. 

REED, JESSE, Wrentham. Private, Capt. Samuel Cowell s co., Col. L. Robinson s 
regt. ; enlisted Jan. 29, 1776 ; service, 2 mos. 4 days ; regiment raised in Suffolk 
and York counties. Roll dated Roxbury. 



THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 



HEED, JOB, Taunton. Private, Capt. Edward Blake s co. ; service, 32 days, at 
Rhode Island ; company marched from Taunton Sept. 29, 1777, under com 
mand of Col. George Williams on a secret expedition and was discharged Oct. 
29, 1777, by Gen. Spencer; also, returns of service rendered by men belonging 
to the company commanded by Capt. Edward Blake ; said Reed and Lewis 
McLouth credited with 15 and 5 respectively, probably in lieu of serA ice, 
although no particulars are given; the year "1778" and the word "Water- 
town" appear above the names; also, Capt. Daniel Drake s co., Col. Luke 
Drury s (Bristol Co.) regt. ; marched from home Aug. 30, 1781 ; arrived at 
camp Sept. 9, 1781; discharged Dec. 6, 1781; arrived home Dec. 16, 1781; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 17 days, at North river; regiment raised for 3 months.

for town of AVoburn ; joined Capt. Dix s co., Col. Wesson s regt.; term, 3

also, Private, Capt. Nathan Dix s co., Col. James Wesson s (9th) regt.; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from April 1, 1777, to April 1, 1780; 
reported discharged.

REED, JOEL. Private, Capt. David Bent s co., Col. Nathan Sparhawk s regt. ; travel

Master, dated Fishkill, Aug. 1, 1778 ; arrived at Fishkill July 11, 1778.

regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 29, 1775; service, 3 mos. 
4 days; also, company return dated Cambridge, Oct. 3, 1775; also, order for

list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Bennett s co., 
Col. Jonathan Read s (6th Middlesex Co.) regt., as returned to Brig. Gen. 
Prescott; residence, Ashby; joined Capt. Smith s co., Col. Biglow s regt.;

Bigelow s regt. ; muster roll for Jan.-Aug., 1777, dated Van Schaick s Island 
and sworn to in Camp at Stillwater ; enlisted May 15, 1777 ; enlistment to 
expire Jan. 10, 1778 ; reported sick at Sharon ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster 
roll for Nov., 1777, sworn to at Camp near "the Gulf; " also, same co. and 
regt. ; muster rolls for Dec., 1777, and Feb., 1778, dated Camp Valley Forge; 
reported discharged Jan. 10, 1778.

5 days, on an alarm at Rhode Island. Roll sworn to at Dartmouth.

descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to in Suffolk Co., Sept. 26, 1780; 
age, 27 years ; complexion, dark ; hair, black ; birthplace, Massachusetts.

REED, JOHN, Jr., Bedford. Private, Capt. John Moore s (Bedford) co. of militia, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 4 days ; also, list of 
men between the ages of sixteen and sixty who were liable to bear arms, as 
returned to Col. Green, dated Bedford, May 15, 1775.

signed by Capt. Benjamin Brown, of Col. Jackson s regt., certifying that said 
Reed, a soldier in his company, was transferred to the corps of invalids at 
Boston Feb. 12, 1779, and drew pay in his company up to that date ; memoran 
dum on certificate, signed by Col. Jackson, states that said Reed had leave to 
stay at his own home 15 days; also, Lieut. Osgood Carleton s co. of invalids 
stationed at Boston, Col. Lewis Nicola s regt. ; service from Feb. 12, 1779, to 
April 30, 1779, 2 mos. 19 days ; also, same co. and regt. : muster rolls dated 
Sept. 9, and Oct. 4, 1779; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Oct., 1779. 

REED, LEVI. Private, Capt. Caleb Richardson s co., Col. John Hathaway s regt. ; 
entered service March 25, 1779; service, 21 days, at Rhode Island. Roll dated 
Attleborough. 

REED, LEWIS. Private, Capt. Samuel Fisher s co., Col. Ephraim Wheelock s regt. : 
service, 8 days; company ordered to march to Warwick, R. I., on the alarm 
of Dec. 8, 1776. 

REED, LOVED, Dighton. Private, Capt. Ephraim Hathaway s co., Col. Pope s (Bris 
tol Co.) regt. ; service, 8 days, at Rhode Island on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; 
company marched to camp at Bristol and thence to Rowland s Ferry.

by the brig " Reprisal," commanded by said Reed, asking that he be exchanged

March 10, 1776 ; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co.

Edward Mitchell s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the

3 days; also, Capt. Nathan Snow s co. commanded by 2d Lieut. Christopher 
Dyer, Col. Edward Mitchel s regt., Gen. Cushing s brigade ; marched Dec. 9, 
1776 ; service, 2 weeks ; company marched to Bristol, R. I., on an alarm. 

REED, WILLIAM, Danvers. Capt. Gideon Foster s co., Col. John Mansfield s regt. ;

Wilkens s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt.; pay abstract for travel allowance, 
etc., from Albany home, sworn to Jan. 15, 1777; 215 miles travel allowed said 
Reed.

3 years or during war; reported received State bounty; also, Private, 6th co., 
Col. John Bailey s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
April 15, 1777, to June 26, 1777; reported deserted June 25, 1777; also, Capt.

by Ezra Badlam, Lieutenant Colonel Commandant ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 

II in.; complexion, light; hair, light; enlistment, 3 years; deserted June 15, 
1777.

Slead all the men in Swanzey were joined in one company under Capt. Peck, 
the other officers refusing to serve.

enemy s ship " Rainbow " 17 hours.

Eliphalet Gary s regt. ; marched July 30, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; ser 
vice, 11 days; company marched from Abington to Tiverton, R. I., on an 
alarm. 

REMINGTON, MESHACH, West Springfield. Private, Capt. Enoch Chapin s co. of 
Minute-men, which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April

son s regt.; company return dated Roxbury Camp, Oct. 6, 1775; also, list of

West Springfield ; term, 3 years or during war.

RENNELS, SAMUEL. Gunner, in an Artillery co. stationed at Machias for its defence ;

for service of sundry persons who continued in service for defence of Machias,

time he was probably employed in Indian affairs under Capt. John Prebble ;

ton s regt.; muster roll for March, 1782; also, 8th co., Col. Greaton s (3d) 
regt.; muster roll for May, 1782; also, Capt. Simon Jackson s (8th) co., Col. 
Greaton s regt.; muster roll for June, 1782; also, Capt. William Watson s 
((&gt;th) co., 3d Mass. regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Millen ; muster rolls for 
Jan. and Feb., 1783.

liams s regt. ; service between Dec. 7, 177(&gt;, and Jan. 1, 1777, 3 weeks 3 days,

RENUFF, CHARLES, Rehoboth. Corporal, Capt. Hastings s co., Col. Jackson s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 
31, 1780; reported as serving 9 mos. as Corporal, 3 mos. as Sergeant; also, 
return certified at Camp near Morristowri, April 30, 1780, of officers and 
men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts., and

of enlistment having expired.

28, 1776 ; reported commissioned Xov. 27 [ ?], 1776 ; regiment raised for defence

ported as having gone to Rhode Island; also, same regt.; service from Jan.

between Aug. 1, 1778, and Oct. 31, 1778, 2 mos. ; roll dated Boston ; also, same

the transports provided and act in accordance with the orders received from

tion; also, Council order endorsed "August 26th 1779," directing said Revere

RHIEDEL, HENRY. Communication addressed to Hon. Artemas Ward at Roxbury, 
dated April 15, 1778, signed hy Col. T. Crafts, stating that said Rhiedel, Ser 
geant in his regiment, had received State hounty, clothing, etc., suhsequent to 
joining the regiment and that his hehavior had heen such as to merit appro 
bation and that he had no objection to the discharge of said Rhiedel; also, 
Council order dated April 16, 1778, discharging said Rhiedel from further ser 
vice in Col. Thomas Crafts s regt. on condition that he deliver up to Col. Crafts 
his arms and accoutrements and pay to him 14, two-thirds of the hounty 
received by said Rhiedel from Col. , Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for 
Suffolk Co.

signed by said Rhoads and others belonging to Capt. Payson s co., Col. Read s 
regt., stating that while in service they had been stationed at Squantum and 
having been taken sick and no facilities for medical attendance being avail 
able there, they had gone to their respective homes and employed doctors and 
nurses at their own expense, and after recovery had returned to their duty, 
and requesting that expenses for medical attendance be allowed them ; peti 
tioners given leave to withdraw; also, Private, Capt. Josiah Pratt s (Stough 
tonham) co.. Col. Gill s regt. ; service, 5i days; company inarched to Roxbury 
March 4. 1776, on an alarm. 

RHOADS, JAMES, Wrentham. Private, Capt. Joseph Pettingill s co.. Lieut. Col. 
Loammi Baldwin s (late Col. Samuel Gerrish s) 38th regt. : company return 
dated Camp at Sewall s Point, Sept. 27, 1775. [See Samuel Rhoads.] 

RHOADS, JAMES. Private. Capt. Jeremiah Putnam s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s 
regt. : enlisted June 27, 1778: service to Dec. 31, 1778, (5 mos. 9 days, at Rhode 
Island, including 4 days (75 miles) travel home: also, same co. and regt.; 
muster rolls dated East Greenwich, Sept. 17, and Sept. 24, 1778: enlistment 
to expire Jan. 1, 1779; reported deserted Sept. 2, 1778.

rolls for Nov. and Dec., 1778, dated King s Ferry.

RICE, ARTEMAS, Charlemont. Private, Capt. Sylvanus Rice s co. of militia, which

RICE, JOHN. Petition dated Cambridge, Oct. 5, 1775, signed by said Rice, stating 
that he had engaged July 12, 1775, to serve in the army as Lieutenant in Capt. 
Samuel Gridley s co., Col. Richard Gridley s (Artillery) regt., but had not 
been commissioned, and asking that he be recommended to Gen. Washington 
for a commission ; ordered in Council Oct. 6, 1775, that said Rice be recom 
mended to Gen. Washington for a commission as 3d Lieutenant, Capt. Gridley s 
co., Col. Gridley s regt. ; also, recommendation addressed to Gen. Washington 
by the Council, dated Watertown, Oct. 7, 1775, recommending said Rice for a 
commission as Lieutenant in Capt. Samuel Gridley s co., Col. Richard Grid- 
ley s (Artillery) regt., he having been directed by Gen. Gates to make appli 
cation therefor.

RICE, JOHN, continued. 

of men drafted from Lieut. Col. Jabez Hatch s (Boston) regt., agreeable to

at and about Boston for the term of 5 weeks; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. John 
Hinkley s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Jabez Hatch s (Boston) regt. of Mass,

ordered in Council Aug. 11, 1777, that said officers be commissioned: ordered 
in Council Aug. 14, 1777, that previous order be reconsidered and that com 
missions be issued only to officers of the Light Infantry co. ; also, Town Major 
and Commandant of the troops in service at and about Boston ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from April 25, 1778, to Sept. 24, 1780 ; also, order 
dated Council Chamber, Oct. 2, 1779, directing the commanding officer at 
Castle Island to detach GO men from the militia under his command and forward 
them to said Rice, Major Commandant at Boston, who is likewise ordered to 
see that such a number as is necessary should be mounted, and to take especial 
care that sentries should be placed at the Laboratory and powder magazine 
near the Laboratory and at the powder magazine at West Boston; also, report 
made by a committee of the House of Representatives, dated March 17, 1780, 
showing staff officers in certain departments, their wages and ration allowances ; 
said Rice reported Town Major and Acting Adjutant General for the State.

Drury s regt. ; marched Aug. 20, 1781 ; joined regiment at West Point Aug.

(167 miles) home; residence, Ward ; engaged for town of Holden; regiment 
raised for 3 months.

engaged July 15, 1778 ; company stationed at Rhode Island for 6 months from 
July 1, 1778; also, account rendered by said Rice, Lieutenant, against the 
state of Massachusetts Bay, dated Boston, Oct. 20, 1778, for 3 mos. service at 
Rhode Island in Capt. Belcher s co., Col. Wade s regt., from July 14, 1778, to 
Oct. 13, 1778, and for subsistence money from July 14, 1778, to Oct. 13, 1778 ; 
credited with 91 days allowance ; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Nathaniel Heath s 
co. ; list of officers commissioned to command guards raised for service under 
Maj. Gen. Gates and Maj. Gen. Heath at and about Boston; commissioned 
Jan. 26, 1779; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Nathaniel Heath s co. : engaged 
Feb. 1, 1779; discharged May 12, 1779; service, 3 mos. 12 days, with guards 
under Maj. Gen. Gates at and about Boston ; also, same co. ; engaged May 13, 
1779; discharged Aug. 12, 1779; service, 3 mos.; also, 1st Lieutenant and 
Adjutant, same co. ; engaged Aug. 13, 1779 ; discharged Nov. 12, 1779: service, 
3 mos. ; also, Lieutenant, same co. ; engaged Nov. 13, 1779; discharged Feb. 12, 
1780; service, 3 mos.: also, same co. ; engaged Feb. 13, 1780; service, 2 mos. 
19 days ; also, same co. ; engaged May 1, 1780; service, 3 mos. ; also, same co. ; 
engaged Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Oct. 20, 1780; service, 2 mos. 20 days; above 
service from May 13, 1779, performed with guards at and about Boston under 
successive engagements of 3 months; also, council order dated Oct. 20, 1780, 
directing Capt. Caleb Champney to take command of the company formerly 
commanded by Maj. Heath serving at and about Boston, and dismissing said 
Rice from any further service.

Capt. Bullard s co., Col. Thayer s regt., at Rhode Island "the Summer past," 
and was for a considerable time sick with a nervous fever under the care of 
said Goddard, Surgeon of the regiment, and that he had not fully recovered 
when the regiment was dismissed.

wages for 2 mos. service in the winter of 1775-6, in Capt. Selah Heart s co., Col. 
Erastus "Woolcot s regt.

Haverhill ; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Wells, Muster Master for

RICHARDS, THOMAS, Ipswich. List of men raised for the 6 months service and re 
turned by Brig. Gen. Patersoii as having passed muster in a return dated Camp 
Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. [See Thomas Pickard.] 

RICHARDS, THOMAS, Stoughtonham. Sergeant, Capt. Edward Bridge Savel s (1st 
Stoughtonham) co. of militia, Col. Robinson s regt., which marched on the 
alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 7 days ; also, Capt. Edward Bridge Savell s 
(Stoughtonham) co., Col. Gill s regt.; service, 5 days; company marched to 
Dorchester Heights March 4, 1776, on an alarm. 

RICHARDS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. William Hooper s co. ; service from June 1, 
1776, to date of discharge, Nov. 15, 1776, 5 mos. 15 days. Rolls dated 
Marblehead. 

RICHARDS, THOMAS. Seaman, ship "Pliarne," Ebenezer Bradford, Master, bound 
on voyage to South Carolina and Nantes ; portage bill made up for advance 
pay, dated Boston, April 14, 1777 ; engaged Feb. 10, 1777. 

RICHARDS, THOMAS. Fifer, Capt. David Brewer s (10th) co., Col. Abner Perry s 
regt. ; engaged July 28, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 7, 1780 ; service, 14 days, 
including 3 days (70 miles) travel home ; company marched to Rhode Island 
on an alarm. Roll dated Framingham. 

RICHARDS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Staples Chamberlin s co., Col. Dean s regt. ; 
enlisted March 7, 1781 ; discharged March 14, 1781 ; service, 11 days, including 
travel (60 miles) home ; company marched to Rhode Island by order of His 
Excellency John Hancock to serve on a 40 days expedition. 

RICHARDS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. John Hayward s co., Col. Webb s regt.; en 
listed Aug. 21, 1781; discharged Dec. 1, 1781; service, 3 inos. 20 days, includ 
ing 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for 3 months. Roll sworn to in Middlesex Co. 

RICHARDS, TIMOTHY, Jr., Dedham. Private, Capt. Aaron Fuller s co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from 1st Parish in Dedham ; service, 
2 days. 

RICHARDS, WILL. Private, Capt. Samuel Holden s co., Col. Ebenezer Thayer s 
regt. ; enlisted July 27, 1780; discharged Oct. 30, 1780; service, 3 mos. 6 days; 
regiment raised in Suffolk Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM, Dedham. Private, Capt. Aaron Fuller s co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from 1st Parish in Dedham ; service, 6 days ; 
also, Corporal, Capt. Abel Richards s co., Col. Mclntash s (Mclntosh s) regt. ; 
inarched March 23, 1778 ; discharged April 6, 1778 ; service, 15 days, at Rox- 
bury and Boston. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM, Dorchester (also given Roxbury). Capt. Joel Fletcher s co., 
Col. Ephraim Doolittle s regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Richards 
and others, dated Camp near Charlestown Road, June 8, 1775; also, Private, 
same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 4, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 5 days; also, company return dated Camp at AVinter Hill, Charles- 
town, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated 
Winter Hill, Dec. 25, 1775. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM, Framingham. Private, Capt. Moses Harrington s co.. Col. 
Dike s regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777; enlisted Dec. 20, 1776; 
regiment raised to serve until March 1, 1777 ; also, Sergeant, Capt. Nathaniel 
Belcher s co. ; marched Sept. 8, 1779; discharged Oct. 18, 1779; service, 1 mo. 
12 days, under Maj. Gen. Hancock at Castle Island. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM, Hopkinton. Corporal, Capt. Amasa Cranston s co., Col. 
Samuel Denny s regt.; enlisted Oct. 28, 1779: discharged Nov. 23, 1779; ser 
vice, 1 mo. 6 days, at Claverack, including travel (200 miles) home ; regiment 
raised for 3 months.

RICHARDS, WILLIAM, Lynn. Private, Capt. William Farrington s (2d Lynn) co. of 
militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, towards Concord ; ser 
vice, 2 days; also, Matross, Capt. AVinthrop Gray s co., Col. Crafts s (Artil 
lery) regt. ; abstract for advance pay, etc., sworn to at Boston, June 8, 1776. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM, Marblehead. Capt. John Merrett s (7th) co., Col. John 
Glover s (21st) regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Richards and 
others, dated Cambridge, June 27, 1775 ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; mus 
ter roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 : enlisted May 24, 1775 ; service, 2| mos. 6 days ; com 
pany marched to Cambridge ; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; 
also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge, Dec. 
29, 1775. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Francis Brown s co., Col. Mclntosh s regt., 
Gen. LovelPs brigade; enlisted Aug. 1, 1778; discharged Sept. 11, 1778; ser 
vice, 1 mo. 14 days, on expedition to Rhode Island. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. David Goodwin s co., Col. Cogswell s regt.; 
entered service Sept. 30, 1778 ; discharged Dec. 31, 1778 ; service, 3 mos. 3 days ; 
company detached to guard and fortify posts at and about Boston. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Deputy Field Commissary of Military Stores, Field Commis 
sary s department ; appointed June 15, 1779 ; reported stationed at Litchfield ; 
also reported as belonging to Jersey. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Job Cushing s co., Lieut. Col. Samuel Pierce s 
regt. ; enlisted May 19, 1779; discharged July 1, 1779; service, 1 mo. 16 days, 
at Tiverton, R. I. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Sailmaker, ship " Vengeance," commanded by Capt. Thomas 
Thomas; engaged June 27, 1779; discharged Aug. 27, 1779; service, 2 mos., on 
Penobscot expedition ; vessel reported lost. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Letter from John Hancock to the Council, dated Castle Island, 
Oct. 20, 1779, stating that said Richards, who was one of the 75 men ordered to 
serve at Castle Island, had applied for a discharge from said service that he 
might join the army under Gen. Washington : ordered in Council Oct. 20, 1779, 
that Maj. Gen. Hancock be directed to discharge said Richards provided that 
he engage as one of the men ordered to be raised agreeable to resolve of Oct. 
9, 1779, and join the troops destined to reinforce the Continental Army under 
Gen. Washington. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Caleb Champney s co. ; enlisted May 25, 1780; 
service, 2 mos. 7 days, with guards at and about Boston. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Daniel Fisher, Jr. s (2d) co., Col. Mc 
lntosh s (1st Suffolk Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers ; commissioned 
Sept. 12, 1780. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship " Lion," com 
manded by Capt. Wingate Newman, sworn to at Boston, July 12, 1781 ; age, 
23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, dark. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Marine, Continental frigate " Deane," commanded by Capt. 
Samuel Nicholson ; engaged Nov. 20, 1781 ; term, 12 months ; reported " Run." 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM. Private ; pay roll of officers and men detached from Col. Gill s 
regt. for service under Capt. John Armstrong on a 40 days expedition to Rhode 
Island ; service, 27 (also given 23) days ; warrant allowed in Council Aug. 
-, 1782. 

RICHARDS, WILLIAM, Jr., Lynn. Private, Capt. William Farrington s (2d Lynn) 
co. of militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, towards Concord; 
service, 2 days.

RICHARDSON, AARON, Newton. Sergeant, Capt. Phineas Cook s co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to headquarters at Cambridge under command 
of Capt. Lieut. John Marean ; service, 6 days; also, Ensign, Capt. Phineas 
Cook s co., Lieut. Col. William Bond s (late Col. Thomas Gardner s) 37th 
regt. ; company return dated Oct. 6, 1775. 

RICHARDSON, ABEL, Ashby. List of men raised in Middlesex Co. for the term of 
9 months from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of 
April 20, 1778 ; Capt. Robb s co., Col. Reed s regt. ; residence, Ashby ; engaged 
for town of Ashby ; arrived at Fishkill June 22, 1778 ; also, list of men returned 
as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 
1778. 

RICHARDSON, ABEL, Ashby. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve of 
June 5, 1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for 
Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; also, descrip 
tive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 
6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin 
Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 10, 1780; 
age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Ashby ; 
arrived at Springfield July 9, 1780; marched to camp July 10, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Daniel Shays: also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a 
return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Ashby for service in the Continental Army during 1780; 
marched July 9, 1780; discharged Dec. 3, 1780; service, 5 mos. 5 days, travel 
(200 miles) included.

Nov. 9, 1777; service, 1 mo. 15 days; company raised in Townsend, Pepperell, 
and Ashby, and marched to assist army under Maj. Gen. Gates.

regt. ; engaged Oct. 19, 1779; discharged Nov. 23, 1779; service, 1 mo. 15 days, 
at Claverack, including 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; regiment raised for 
3 months. 

RICHARDSON, ABIATHAR, Attleborough. Sergeant, Capt. Stephen Richardson s 
(Attleborough) co. of Minute-men, which marched probably on the alarm of 
April 19, 1775 ; service, 9 days ; reported returned home ; also, copy of an order 
on Ephraim Newell, Town Treasurer of Attleborough, dated July 5, 1776, for 
wages due said Richardson and others for service on the alarm caused by the 
battle of Bunker Hill; also, Sergeant, Capt. Stephen Richardson s 4th (2d 
Attleborough, also given Attleborough No. 12) co., Col. Daggett s regt. ; list of 
men who were in the 2 months service at York in 1776; known as the 9th (also 
given 8th) campaign; said Richardson credited with J turn; also, Private, 
Capt. Elisha May s co. ; enlisted Sept. -, 1776 ; discharged Nov. -, 1776 : ser- 
A T ice, 2 mos.; company served on a 2 months campaign at New York; 0/50, 
Clerk, Capt. Alexander Foster s co., Col. Isaac Dean s regt.: marched July 
31, 1780; discharged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 10 days, including 2 days (36 miles) 
travel home; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of July 31, 
1780. 

RICHARDSON, ABIATHAR, Woolwich. Private, Capt. Israel Davis s co., Col. Joseph 
Fry s regt.; marched from home March 4, 1776: service to May 31, 1776, 2 
mos. 28 days, in defence of seacoast ; also, same co. ; service from June 1, 1776, 
to Dec. 5, 1776, 6 mos. 5 days, at Boothbay in defence of seacoast ; also, Lieut. 
Nathaniel Winslow s detachment; enlisted Dec. 5, 1776; discharged Dec. 31, 
1776 ; service, 26 days, at Boothbay in defence of seacoast ; also, Lieut. William 
Clark s detachment: enlisted Aug. 25, 1780; discharged Sept. 6, 1780: service, 
13 days, in Lincoln Co. by order of Brig. Gen. Peleg Wadsworth.

RICHARDSON, ABNER. Receipt dated Lincoln, April 2, 1781, for bounty paid said 
Richardson by a class of the town of Lincoln, of which Dr. Joshua Brooks and 
others were members, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 
years; also, descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to 
resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for 
said county; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, light; hair, dark; 
eyes, dark; occupation, farmer; engaged for town of Lincoln; engaged Feb. 
20, 1781; term, 3 years. 

RICHARDSON, ADDISON, Salem. List of captains in Col. John Mansfield s regt. ; 
ordered in [Provincial] Congress May 27, 1775, that said officers be commis 
sioned; also, Captain, Col. Mansfield s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; 
engaged May 9, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. ; also, Col. Mansfield s (19th) regt. com 
manded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutchinson; company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; 
also, Captain; memorandum of firelocks received of sundry officers and sol 
diers ; date of delivery, Feb. 23, 1776 ; said Richardson s firelocks delivered for 
Selectmen of Salem ; also, Captain, 5th co. ; list of men taken from the Orderly 
Book of Col. Israel Hutchinson, of the 27th regt., dated Fort Lee; reported 
taken prisoner at Fort Washington Nov. 16, 1776 ; also, Captain, Col. Hutchin- 
son s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to 
May 25, 1778; also, Captain, Col. Hutchinson s regt.; petition addressed to 
the Council, dated Boston, Aug. 16, 1777, signed by Col. Israel Hutchinson, 
representing that certain officers who belonged to his regiment in 1776 and 
other officers not of his regiment were prisoners at Long Island, and recom 
mending that advance pay for 1 month be sent to each officer ; also, draft of a 
letter of instructions from the Council to Capt. Thomas Randall, dated Nov. 
3, 1777, directing him to effect the exchange of said Richardson, Captain, and 
other prisoners at Long Island, for British prisoners to be forwarded to New 
York in a cartel; also, parole agreement dated Boston, Nov. 7, 1777, signed 
by British officers, prisoners at Boston, granted permission to proceed to New 
York, agreeing to return unless the Massachusetts officers specified for ex 
change were released ; Capt. Lawrence R t Campbell to be exchanged for said 
Richardson, Captain, a prisoner at Long Island ; also, list dated Feb. 24, 1778, 
of prisoners to be exchanged for British prisoners under parole to be returned 
by Col. Johonnott; also, list of officers appointed to command men detached 
from militia to reinforce the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of Oct. 
9, 1779; said Richardson, Captain, with others, detached from Suffolk and 
Essex Co. brigades; commissioned Oct. 23, 1779; also, Captain, Col. Jacob 
Gerrish s regt.; entered service Oct. 14, 1779; discharged Nov. 22, 1779; ser 
vice, 1 mo. 20 days, at Claverack, including travel (240 miles) home ; regiment 
detached from militia of Suffolk and Essex counties to reinforce army under 
Gen. Washington; also, Captain, Col. Wade s regt. ; entered service June 29, 
1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780: service, 3 mos. 24 days, including 12 days (240

KICHARDSON, ALFORD (also given ALFRED), Woburn. Private, Capt. Caleb 
B rooks s co., Col. Nicholas Dike s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, 
etc., to and from camp, dated Boston, Nov. 27, 1776, and endorsed " at Doehes- 
ter Heights; " 36 miles travel allowed said Richardson; also, same co. and 
regt.: muster roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777; enlisted Dec. 1, 1776; service 
guarding stores at Boston; regiment raised to serve until March 1, 1777 : also, 
Capt. Jesse Wyman s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; arrived at destination 
May 10, 1777 ; discharged July 10, 1777, at Point Judith ; service, 2 nios. 9 
days, at Rhode Island, including 3 days (55 miles) travel to place of destination 
and 5 days travel from place of discharge home ; company raised for 2 months ; 
also, Capt. Joshua Reed s co., Col. John Robinson s regt.: enlisted July 9, 
1777; service, 5 mos. 26 days, at Rhode Island; also, same co. and regt. ; mus 
ter rolls dated North Kingston, Dec. 18, 1777, and Jan. 1, 1778; enlistment, 6 
months from July 1, 1777; also, Capt. Edward Richardson s co., Col. Thomas 
Poor s regt. ; enlisted July 11, 1778, 3 days preceding march ; service, 3 mos. 
13 days, at North river, N. Y. ; reported died Oct. 24, 1778: also, same co. and 
regt. ; pay roll for Sept., 1778, dated West Point. 

RICHARDSON, ALLEN, Andover. Private, Capt. Samuel Flint s co., Col. Samuel 
Johnson s regt. ; pay abstract for mileage from Scarsdale, N. Y., home ; mile 
age for 260 miles allowed said Richardson ; warrant allowed in Council July 

27, 1778. 

RICHARDSON, ALLEN, Andover. Receipt dated Andover, April 20, 1781, for bounty 
paid said Richardson by Class No. 9 of the South District of Andover to serve 
in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 
1780; also, descriptive list of men in Continental service; Capt. Francis s co., 
Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; age, 37 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 3 in. ; hair, 
black ; occupation, fanner : residence, Andover ; engaged for town of Andover ; 
engaged March 27 (also given March 15), 1781; term, 3 years; reported a 
mulatto; also, Private, Capt. Nathaniel C. Allen s (8th) co., 7th Mass. regt. ; 
muster rolls for Dec., 1782-April, 1783; reported transferred from 9th Mass. 
regt.; also, Capt. Allen s co., 4th Mass, regt.: muster rolls for May-Sept., 
1783 ; balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 5 months ; reported on command 
at New Windsor in Sept., 1783. 

RICHARDSON, AMASA, Franklin. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John 
Glover, at Springfield, July 9, 1780; age, 18 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; com 
plexion, ruddy ; engaged for town of Franklin ; arrived at Springfield July 8, 
1780; marched to camp July 9, 1780, under command of Lieut. Jackson, of 
the artillery; also, pay roll for 6 months men belonging to the town of Frank 
lin raised for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched July 3, 
1780: discharged Dec. 23, 1780; service, 6 mos. 2 days, including travel (200 
miles) home; also, Private, Capt. John Lincoln s co., Col. Joseph Webb s 
regt.; marched to camp Aug. 20, 1781; discharged Nov. 29, 1781; service, 3 
mos. 22 days, including 3 days preceding march and travel (210 miles) from 
camp home ; regiment raised for 3 months.

regt. ; service from Sept. 30, 1777, to Oct. 31, 1777, 1 mo. 2 days, at Rhode

RICHARDSON, AMOS, Medway. Private, West co. in Medway commanded by 1st

Maj. J. Fuller; service, 3 days; also, Sergeant, Capt. Josiah Fuller s co.,Col. 
Wheelock s regt. ; service, 23 days; company marched from Medway to War 
wick, R. I., on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; also, list of men returned by a com 
mittee of the town of Medway April 3, 1778, as having rendered service at 
various times subsequent to April 19, 1775; also, Private, Capt. John Ellis s 
co., Col. Thomas Poor s regt. ; enlisted July 14, 1778; discharged Feb. 24, 1779; 
service, 7 mos. 21 days, including 11 days (225 miles) travel home ; regiment 
raised to fortify and secure passes of North river, N. Y. ; also, same co. and 
regt. : pay rolls for July, Aug., and Sept., 1778, dated Fort Clinton ; also, same 
co. and regt. ; pay rolls for Nov. and Dec., 1778, dated King s Ferry.

RICHARDSON, ANDREW, Andover. Private, Capt. Samuel Johnson s co., Col. Tit- 
comb s regt. ; arrived at place of rendezvous April 27, 1777 ; discharged June

vous and from place of discharge home ; company raised to serve for 2 months 
from time of arrival at Providence, R. I.; roll dated Bristol; also, Capt.

regt. ; entered service Sept. 27, 1778; discharged Dec. 31, 1778; service, 3 mos.

dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 20, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 17 days.

15, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 28 days, in Northern de 
partment, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; roll dated Dracut. 

RICHARDSON, DAVID. Private, Capt. Jotham Houghton s co. ; service from Nov. 3 
to Nov. 19, 1778, 17 days; company detached from Col. Nathan Sparhawk s 
(7th) regt., Gen. Warner s brigade, to reinforce guards at the barracks in Rut 
land under Col. Jacob Garrish (Gerrish) and to escort troops of Saratoga con 
vention to Enfield, Conn. Roll dated Petersham. 

RICHARDSON, DAVID. Private, Capt. Alexander Foster s co., Col. Isaac Dean s 
regt. ; marched Aug.4, 1780: discharged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 7 days, includ 
ing 2 days (3(5 miles) travel home; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on 
the alarm of July 31, 1780. Roll sworn to at Attleborough. 

RICHARDSON, EBENKZER, Billerica. Private, Lieut. Oliver Crosby s detachment

Jonathan Stickney s co., Col. Ebenezer Bridge s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug.

Brooks s regt. ; company return dated Oct. 31, 1776; also, same co. and regt. ;

RICHARDSON, JEDEDIAH, Attleborough. Fifer, Capt. Moses Willmarth s (9th) co., 
Col. John Daggett s (4th Bristol Co.) regt., which marched in response to the 
alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 7 days; also, Capt. Stephen Richardson s 4th 
(2d Attleborough, also given Attleborough Xo. 12) co., Col. John Daggett s

fought in battle near Bennington Aug. 16, 1777.

known as the " Silver Grays; " entered service Sept. 5, 1777; service, 28 days; 
company marched to Pawlet on an alarm.

days, at Fort No. 2, Cambridge, guarding troops of convention.

RICHARDSON, JOSEPH, Barre. Private, Capt. Benjamin Nye s co., Col. Nathan Spar- 
hawk s regt. : enlisted Aug. 21, 1777; discharged Aug. 25, 1777; service, 10 
days, including travel (96 miles) home ; company marched Aug. 21, 1777, to 
reinforce army under Gen. Stark at Bennington ; also, Capt. Benjamin Nye s 
co. : enlisted Sept. 26, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 18, 1777 ; service, 29 days, includ 
ing travel (128 miles) home ; company marched under command of Maj. Jonas 
Wilder to reinforce Northern army for 30 days ; also, receipt dated Worcester, 
May 29, 1782, for bounty paid said Richardson by Nathaniel Smith, Chairman 
of Class No. 1 of the town of Barre, to serve in the Continental Army for the 
term of 3 years.

nam, July 20, 1778.

so-called 6 weeks campaign at Roxbury in Dec., 1775 " & onward," known as

companies for the months of Oct. and Nov., 1776, and 12 days in Dec., 1776: 
also, Captain of a company comprising one-fourth of the militia of the town

RICHARDSON, STEPHEN, Royalston. List of men mustered to serve in the Continen 
tal Army for the term of 9 months ; said Richardson appears among men belong 
ing to Capt. Woodbury s co. and other companies in Col. Sparhawk s regt. ; 
engaged for town of Royalston ; mustered May 19 [year not given, probably

muster rolls for Jan. and March, 1779, dated West Point; enlisted June 7, 
1778 ; discharged March 7, 1779 ; enlistment, 9 months.

1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Maj. Peter Har- 
wood, of 6th Mass, regt., at Springfield, July 5, 1780; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 
ft. 3 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Brookfield ; arrived at 
Springfield July 5, 1780 ; marched to camp July 6, 1780, under command of 
Lieut. Taylor, of 2d Mass. regt. ; also, Private, Colonel s co. commanded by 
Capt. Lieut. Peter Clayes, Col. Thomas Nixon s (6th) regt. ; pay roll for July, 
1780; enlisted July 5, 1780; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service 
and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, Private, Colonel s co. commanded by Capt. 
Lieut. Benjamin Pike, Col. Nixon s (6th&gt; regt. ; payrolls for Aug.-Dec., 1780; 
also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Royalston for service in 
the Continental Army during 1780; marched June 30, 1780; discharged Jan. 5, 
1781 ; service, 6 mos. 15 days, including 9 days (180 miles) travel home. 

RICHARDSON, WILLIAM, Sutton. Private, Capt. Bartholomew Woodbury s co., 
Col. Lemad s (Learned s) regt.; pay abstract for billeting to and from camp; 
mileage for 50 miles allowed said Richardson ; company marched from Sutton, 
Douglas, and Northbridge, Dec. 9, 1775; also, Capt. Andrew Elliot s co., Col. 
Jonathan Holman s regt. ; service, 30 days, including travel (290 miles) from 
home and return ; company marched Sept. 26, 1777, to reinforce Northern army 
for 30 days at the time of taking Gen. Burgoyne ; also, Capt. David Batcheller s 
co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt.; arrived at camp June 21, 1778; discharged Jan. 
29, 1779; service, 7 mos. 29 days, at North river, including 3 days to prepare 
for camp and 1(5 days (320 miles) travel out and home; regiment raised for 
8 months; also, order on John Potter, Paymaster, payable to Preston Richard 
son, dated Sutton, Aug. -, 1779, signed by said Richardson, for wages for 
8 mos. service in Capt. Bachellor s co., Col. Wood s regt., in 1778; also, Pri 
vate, Capt. Abijah Burbank s co., Col. Jacob Davis s regt. ; marched to camp 
July 30, 1780: discharged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 13 days, on an alarm at Rhode 
Island, including 3^ days (75 miles) travel home.

to Massachusetts in Col, Henry Sherburne s regt., who were incorporated 
into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to 
the arrangement of April 9, 1779; Capt. North s co. ; rank, Sergeant; resi 
dence, Dighton ; engaged Sept. 10, 1777 ; term, during war ; also, Capt. William 
North s (1st) co.. Col. Henry Jackson s (16th) regt.; pay rolls for April- July, 
1780; also, descriptive list dated Hutts, three miles from West Point, Jan. 28, 
1781; Capt. Dow s co., 9th Mass. regt. commanded by Col. Henry Jackson; 
age, 26 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, light; hair, light; occupation, 
blacksmith; residence, Dighton; enlisted Jan. 1, 1780, by Col. Jackson: en 
listment, during war; also, list of men entitled to 820 or 200 acres of land, 
agreeable to resolve of March 5, 1801 ; 4th Mass. regt.

Bradford s (12th) regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of enlistment. March 7, 
1777, to June 1, 1777 ; credited with 85 days allowance ; reported joined June 
4, 1777 : also, same co. and regt. ; return dated Feb. 1, 1778 ; mustered by County 
and Continental Muster Masters; also, same co. and regt. ; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 6, 1780.

cers be commissioned ; reported commissioned April 20, 1776.

Gates at and about Boston; also, Capt. Champney s co., Maj. Nathaniel

service, 3 mos., at and about Boston; also, same co. and detachment; engaged 
Aug. 9, 1779; discharged Sept. 30, 1779; service, 1 mo. 23 days; detachment 
raised to serve at Boston until Oct. 1, 1779; also, same co. and detachment; 
engaged Oct. 1, 1779; discharged Jan. 11, 1780; service, 3 mos. 10 days, at and 
about Boston; also, same co. and detachment; engaged May 21, 1780; service 
to Aug. 1, 1780, 2 mos. 11 days; company detached from militia for service at 
and about Boston; also, same co. ; engaged Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Nov. 1, 
1780; service, 3 mos. ; company detached from militia for service at and about 
Boston; also, same co. ; engaged Nov. 1, 1780; discharged Jan. 31, 1781; com 
pany detached from militia at request of Gen. Heath for service at and about 
Boston guarding Continental stores; roll endorsed " Maj r Heath Detach t ; " 
also, same co. ; engaged Feb. 1, 1781 ; discharged April 1, 1781 ; service, 2 rnos. 
1 day, guarding Continental stores at and about Boston at request of Gen. 
Heath.

Maj. James Johnston, Superintendent; Capt. Cooinbs s co., Col. Mitchell s

RIDOUT, WILLIAM, Falmouth. Private, Capt. Smart s co., Col. Calvin Smith s 
(late Wiggiesworth s) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from

at Camp Providence; also, Capt. Blasdel s co., (late) Col. Wiggiesworth s 
regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Providence ; enlisted Feb. 
16, 1777 ; reported sick at home. 

RIDWAY, THOMAS CHENEY, Marlborough. Return of men raised to serve in the 
Continental Army from Capt. Morse s co., Col. Ezekiel How s (4th Middlesex 
Co.) regt. [year not given] ; residence, Marlborough ; engaged for town of 
Marlborough; joined Capt. Barnes s co., Col. Biglow s regt. ; term, 3 years. 

RIEDEL, JOHN HENRY. Petition addressed to the Provincial Congress, dated Rox- 
bury, June 21, 1775, signed by said Riedel and others who had enlisted to form 
an Artillery co., stating their unwillingness to serve under John Wiley 
as Captain owing to their belief in his incompetence ; also, Sergeant, Capt. 
Winthrop Gray s (3d) co., Col. Thomas Crafts s (Artillery) regt. ; service 
from time of enlistment to Aug. 1, 1777, 83 days ; also, communication ad 
dressed to the Council, dated Boston, April 13, 1778, signed by Col. Armand, 
Marquis de la Rouarie, stating that he had been commissioned as a Colonel in 
the Continental Army the latter part of May, 1777, and had commanded an 
Independent corps during the last campaign ; that he was in need of a Quarter 
master and two Lieutenants ; and requesting that said Riedel, Sergeant, Capt. 
Gray s co., Col. Crafts s (Artillery) regt., who had been highly recommended 
to him by the Earl of Mauroy, might be given a discharge so as to enable him 
to appoint the said Riedel to one of the offices mentioned ; ordered in Council 
that a committee be appointed to consider the communication and report 
thereon: also, Quartermaster and Ensign, Col. Armond s corps; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from April 1, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; also, account 
dated Boston, March 7, 1780, rendered by said Riedel, Ensign, against the 
Board of War, for 10 days expenses while procuring clothing for Col. Armand s 
corps. 

RIEDON, DANIEL. Capt. Jonathan Danforth s co., (late) Col. David Brewer s (9th) 
regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury Camp, 
Nov. 14, 1775. [See Daniel Rioden.]

RIELEY, JAMES, Boston. Private, Capt. Jonathan Maynard s (6th) co., 7th Mass,

1783; also, Capt. Allen s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s regt. ; list of men who 
died or were discharged subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781; said Rieley discharged 
June 10, 1783, by Gen. Washington, having procured a man to serve in his 
stead.

Island; enlisted Aug. 3, 1781; discharged Dec. 1, 1781; service, 4 mos. 2 days, 
including 5 days (100 miles) travel home. 

RIELEY, JOHN. Receipt dated May 14, 1783, for wages for service to May 10, 1783,

Oct. 29, 1777.

at Springfield, July 9, 1780; age, 17 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, 
light; engaged for town of Medway; arrived at Springfield July 8, 1780: 
marched to camp July 9, 1780, under command of Lieut. Jackson, of the artil 
lery ; also, pay roll for 6 months men belonging to the town of Medway raised 
for service in the Continental Army during 1780; engaged July 2, 1780; dis 
charged Dec. 31, 1780; service, 6 mos. 10 days, including 11 days (220 miles) 
travel home.

RIST, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Samuel Read s co., in a regiment commanded by 
Lieut. Col. Nathan Tyler; service, 22 days, at Providence, R. I.; company 
marched on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776, and served until Jan. 21, 1777. 

RIST, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Moses Adams s co., 4th Suffolk Co. regt. commanded

and he was accordingly certified, but it later appeared that he did not serve 
any time in 1780].
