Aug. 1,1775; enlisted May 18, 1775 ; service, 2^ mos. 5 days ; company marched 
to Cambridge ; also, 1st Corporal, same co. and regt. ; company return [proba 
bly Oct., 1775]. 

ROACH, JOHN. Private, Capt. Francis Felton s co. ; company receipt, given to Daniel 
Hopkins, dated Marblehead, Sept. 26, 1775, for advance pay for 1 month ; also, 
Capt. Francis Felton s (Marblehead) co. ; enlisted July 17, 1775 ; service to 
Dec. 31, 1775, 6 mos., in defence of seacoast; also, same co. ; enlisted Jan. 4, 
1776; service to Aug. 31, 1776, 7 mos. 28 days, in defence of seacoast. 

ROACH, JOHN. Petition dated Beverly, July 15, 1778, signed by Joseph Wood, 
Town Clerk, in behalf of the Selectmen, asking consideration on account of 
men who had moved into or from said town, or had died since return made 
under resolve of Dec. 9, 1776, or who were unable to contribute towards raising 
the town s quota ; said Roach reported as having moved from Marblehead into 
Beverly and later moved out of town. 

ROACH, JOHN. List of prisoners sent in the cartel " Swift " from Halifax to Boston 
Sept. 30, 1778, as returned by Thomas Baildon, Commissary of Prisoners; 
reported a Seaman. 

ROACH, JOHN. Sergeant, Capt. Mills s co., Col. Joseph Yose s regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to March 1, 1778; reported 
deserted ; also, Capt. Abraham Tuckerman s co., Col. Vose s regt. ; muster roll 
for Dec., 1777, sworn to at Camp near Valley Forge; engaged Jan. 1, 1777; 
term, during war; reported a prisoner with provost guard; also, descriptive 
list of deserters from Col. Joseph Vose s (1st) regt., dated Camp Highlands, 
July 13, 1780 ; age, 23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, brown ; 
birthplace, Ireland. 

ROACH, JOHN. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to resolve 
of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said county ; 
age, 19 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 4 in.; complexion, light; hair, light; eyes, gray;

ROACH, MICHAEL. Seaman, ship " Protector," commanded by Capt. John Foster 
Williams; engaged Oct. 11, 1780; service, 6 mos. 26 days; reported deserted.

return dated Camp at Ticonderoga, Aug. 27, 1776 ; age, 20 yrs. ; also, Capt.

to Oct. 30, 1777, 35 days, on a secret expedition. 

ROBBINS, EBENEZER. Private, Capt. William Adams s co., Col. Thatcher s regt.; 
service, 5 days ; company marched at request of Gen. Washington at the time 
of taking Dorchester Heights March 4, 1776.

13th cos. in said regiment; also, Capt. Fortunatus Eager s co., Col. Josiah

ROBBINS, JOHN, Lexington. Petition addressed to the General Court, dated Lexing 
ton, June 14, 1776, signed by said Robbins, stating that he had been grievously 
wounded by a musket ball 011 the 19th of April, 1775, which shattered his jaw 
bone and also rendered his right arm almost useless, so that he was unable to 
contribute anything to the support of his wife and five children, and as there 
was no encouragement for any improvement in his condition, requesting that 
some relief or assistance by pension or otherwise be granted him ; a grant of 
13 6s 8d yearly to commence from April 19, 1776, was allowed said Robbins 
by resolve of Nov. 1, 1776; similar petitions dated Lexington, June 4, 1777, 
and July 14, 1778, respectively, were presented on behalf of said Robbins.

98 days ; also, company return dated Cambridge, Sept. 28, 1775.

also, Capt. Jacob Allen s (3d) co., Col. John Bailey s regt. ; company return 
dated Camp Valley Forge, Jan. 24, 1778; also, Capt. Adams Bailey s (late 
Capt. Jacob Allen s) co., Col. John Bailey s (2d) regt.; muster roll made up 
from Jan. 1, 1777, to Jan. 1, 1780; enlisted May 15, 1777: also, same co. and 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 
15, 1780.

from Col. Jonathan Cogswell s (3d Essex Co.) regt., as returned by Capt.

dence, St. Georges; engaged for town of Topsfield; joined Capt. Burton s co., 
Col. Sherbum s regt. : term, 3 years. 

ROBEXS, RICHARD. Private, Capt. Thomas Xickerson s co., Maj. Zenas Winslow s 
regt. ; service, 2 days, on an alarm at Bedford and Falmouth in Sept., 1778. 
Roll sworn to in Barnstable Co. 

ROBEXS, SAMUEL. Private, in a detachment from Capt. Joseph Clift s 10th (Marsh- 
field) co., Col. John Cushing s (Plymouth Co.) regt.; marched Dec. 10, 1776; 
service, 14 days ; detachment marched to Rhode Island 011 an alarm. 

ROBEXS, THOMAS, Leominster. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from 8th Worcester Co. regt., as returned by Capt. John Joslin, Jr., sworn to 
Feb. 22, 1778; residence, Leominster; engaged for town of Leominster; joined 
Capt. Warner s co., Col. Marshal s regt.; term, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. 
Jonathan Sibley s co., Col. Luke Drury s regt. ; entered service July 29, 1781; 
marched Aug. 1, 1781 ; arrived at camp Aug. 11, 1781 : discharged Xov. 10, 1781 ; 
service, 3 mos. 23 days, including 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; residence, 
Leominster; engaged for town of Leominster; regiment raised for 3 months. 

ROBEXS, THOMAS. Captain, 4th (also given 5th) co., Col. Jonathan Buck s (5th 
Lincoln Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen in said regiment; 
ordered in Council July 23, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported 
commissioned July 23, 1776. 

ROBEXS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Xoah Lankton s co., Col. Mark Hopkins s (1st 
Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 15, 1776; discharged Aug. 4, 1776; 
service, 21 days ; mileage out and home (252 miles) allowed; company marched 
on expedition to the Highlands, X. Y., by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows; also, 
Capt. Xoah Lankton s co., Col. John Ashley s (1st Berkshire Co.) regt.; 
entered service July 8, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 14, 1777 ; service, 38 days ; com 
pany marched to Kingsbury by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows; roll dated 
Tyringham. 

ROBEXSOX, BARTLETT, Pelham. Private, Capt. Isaac Gray s co., Col. Jonathan 
Brewer s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1,1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 
3 mos. 8 days; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated 
Cambridge, Oct. 26, 1775. 

ROBEXSOX, DEXISOX. Captain, 5th co., 4th Worcester Co. regt. of Mass, militia; 
list of officers; commissioned June 11, 1778. 

ROBEXSOX, EBEXEZER, Raynham. Private, Capt. John King s co., Col. Timothy 
Walker s regt. : muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 3, 1775 ; service, 
3 mos. 5 days: also, company return dated Oct. 6, 1775. 

ROBEXSOX, EDWARD. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Richmond 
for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched July 6, 1780: dis 
charged Dec. 17, 1780; service, 5 mos. 17 days, including travel (100 miles) 
home.

1775 ; discharged Dec. 31, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 5 days, at Gloucester in defence

March 9, 1781 ; enlistment, 3 years ; reported a boatman.

HUBERTS, JOSEPH, continued. 

also, petition addressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 
25, 1777, signed by said Roberts and others, requesting that the objectionable 
part of their former petition, which was considered mutinous, be stricken out, 
and asking that the sergeants of the regiment confined on account of the peti 
tion be released ; also, Capt. Phillips s (8th) co. ; return of men belonging to 
the State train of artillery entitled to an additional bounty of 15, as returned 
by Col. T. Crafts, dated Boston, Jan. 12, 1778. 

ROBERTS, JOSEPH, Windham. Private, in a detachment from Capt. John Went- 
worth s co. ; pay abstract for billeting, sworn to Aug. 31, 1776, and endorsed 
" company at Dorchester Heights;" also, Capt. John Wentworth s co., Col. 
Aaron Willard s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., from home to 
Bennington, dated Boston, Jan. 6, 1777 ; 340 miles travel allowed said Roberts; 
also, same co. and regt.; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., home from 
place of discharge, Fort Edward, dated Boston, Jan. 15, 1777 ; 422 miles travel 
allowed said Roberts; also, Capt. Nathan Merrill s co. ; marched from home 
July 8, 1779; discharged Sept. 25, 1779; service, 2 mos. 17 days, with Col. 
Jonathan Mitchell s detachment ; company raised in Cumberland Co. for ser 
vice on Penobscot expedition; also, Capt. Merrill s co., Col. Mitchel s detach 
ment ; pay abstract for mileage, sworn to at North Yarmouth, Nov. 3, 1779 ; 
mileage for 10 miles allowed said Roberts. 

ROBERTS, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. John Dodge s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of 
guards; enlisted July 19, 1778; discharged Dec. 16, 1778; service, 4 mos. 28 
days, at Winter Hill. 

ROBERTS, JOSEPH. List of men who moved from the town of Cape Elizabeth sub 
sequent to 1776, dated Cape Elizabeth, Jan. 17, 1782, accompanying a petition 
of the Selectmen stating their inability to supply their quota. 

ROBERTS, JOSIAH, Hardwick. *Private, Capt. Simeon Hazeltine s co. of Minute-men, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 26 days ; reported en 
listed into the army ; also, Capt. Samuel Billings s co., Col. Ebenezer Learned s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 4, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 

4 days ; also, company return dated Oct. 7, 1775 ; also, company receipt for 
ammunition, given to Capt. Barnabas Sears, dated Dorchester Camp, Feb. 15, 
1776 ; also, return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. 
Timothy Paige s 2d (1st Hardwick) co., Col. James Converse s (4th Worcester 
Co.) regt. ; residence, Hardwick ; engaged for town of Hardwick ; joined Capt. 
Warren s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; term, 3 years; also, Drummer, 3d co., Col. 
Brooks s regt. : Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 8, 1777, 
to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Benjamin Warren s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; return 
dated Albany, Jan. 12, 1778; mustered by Capt. Newell, County Muster Master, 
and by a Continental Muster Master; also, Capt. Warren s co., (late) Col. 
Alden s regt. ; return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, 
and who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., certified 
at Cherry Valley, Feb. 24, 1779; also, Capt. Warren s co., 6th Mass. regt. 
formerly commanded by Col. Ichabod Alden; muster roll for March and 
April, 1779, dated Cherry Valley and sworn to in Garrison at Fort Alden ; 
also, Capt. Warren s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 8, 1780 ; reported as serving 2 mos. as 
Drummer, 2 mos. 8 days as Drum Major; also, descriptive list of men raised 
to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to re 
solve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by 
Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, Aug. 9, 1780: age, 26 yrs. ; stature, 

5 ft. 10 in.; complexion, dark: engaged for town of Hardwick; arrived at 
Springfield Aug. 8, 1780; marched to camp Aug. 9, 1780, under command 
of Capt. Daniel Lunt ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and re- 



410 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

ROBERTS, JOSIAH, continued. 

turned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed nrnster in a return dated Camp 
Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of 
Hardwick for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched July 29, 
1780; discharged Dec. 25, 1780; service, 5 mos. 4 days, in the state of New 
York, including 9 days (180 miles) travel home. 

ROBERTS, JOSIAH. Certificate dated Halifax Harbor, Oct. 7, 1778, signed by said 
Roberts, Master, and others, certifying that none of the American prisoners, 
of whom they formed a part and who were to be sent to Boston in the cartel 
" Silver Eel " to be exchanged for British subjects, had been compelled to pro 
ceed on board, but that all the convalescents went of their own free will and 
at their earnest desire ; also, list of prisoners sent in the cartel " Silver Eel " 
from Halifax to Boston Oct. 8, 1778, to be exchanged for British prisoners, as 
returned by Bat. Fox, Commissary of Prisoners ; said Roberts reported Master 
of an armed vessel. 

ROBERTS, LEMUEL, Charlemont. Private, Capt. Oliver Avery sco. of Minute-men, 
which marched April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 7 days; reported enlisted into the army under Capt. H. Maxwell April 

27, 1775; also, Corporal, Capt. Hugh Maxwell s co., Col. William Prescott s 
(10th) regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Private, Capt. 
Samuel Taylor s co., Col. Porter s regt.; enlisted July 10, 1777; discharged 
Aug. 12, 1777 ; service, 38 days, including travel (100 miles) home ; company 
marched from Charlemont July 10, 1777, to reinforce Northern army after the 
evacuation of Ticonderoga. 

ROBERTS, LOVE, Berwick (also given Somersworth) . Private, Capt. Ebenezer 
Sullivan s co., Col. James Scammon s (30th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 
1775; enlisted May 5, 1775; service, 3 mos. 3 days; also, company return 
[probably Oct., 1775], including abstract of pay to last of July, 1775; also, 
memorandum of firelocks received of sundry officers and soldiers; date of 
delivery, Jan. 27, 1776. 

ROBERTS, MOSES, Marlborough. Private, Capt. Daniel Barns s co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 7 days; reported enlisted into the 
army April 26, 1775; also, Capt. Daniel Barns s co., Col. Jonathan Ward s 
regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 26, 1775 ; service, 13 weeks 
6 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]. 

ROBERTS, MOSES. Private, Capt. John Gray s co., Col. Jonathan Mitchell s regt. ; 
enlisted July 7, 1779; discharged Sept. 25, 1779; service, 2 mos. 18 days, on 
Penobscot expedition. Roll dated North Yarmouth and sworn to in Cumber 
land Co. 

ROBERTS, MOSES. Lieutenant and Captain, Col. Bigelow s regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported as 
serving 18 mos. as Lieutenant, 18 mos. as Captain, promoted to Captain June 

28, 1778; also, 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Daniel Barns s co., Col. Timothy Bige 
low s regt. ; muster roll for Jan.-Aug., 1777, dated Van Schaick s Island and 
sworn to at Camp near Stillwater ; engaged Jan. 1, 1777 ; term, 3 years ; re 
ported on command at Albany ; also, same regt. ; return of officers for clothing, 
dated Boston, May 25, 1778; also, Adjutant, same regt.; payrolls for Dec., 
1778, March and April, 1779, dated Providence; reported promoted Dec. 1, 
1778: also, Lieutenant, (late) Capt. Munro s co., Col. Bigelow s (15th) regt.; 
muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned officers for Aug., 1779, dated Lower 
Salem ; engaged Jan. 1, 1777 ; reported on command acting as Adjutant ; also, 
Captain, 15th Mass. regt. ; list of settlements of rank of Continental officers, 
dated West Point, made by a Board held for the purpose and confirmed by 
Congress Sept. 6, 1779; commissioned March 2, 1779; also, Captain, Col. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 411 

ROBERTS, MOSES, continued. 

Timothy Bigelow s regt. ; list of officers promoted in the Continental Army 
and for whom warrants were made out; commissioned Nov. 26, 1779; also, 
Captain, same regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to Feb. 3, 1780; reported killed Feb. 3, 1780; note on account states that 
as said Roberts did not leave a widow or children, the usual seven years half 
pay allowed to widows and orphans of Continental officers who died in the ser 
vice should not be certified. 

ROBERTS, PETER. Treasury pay roll of officers and crew of the brigantine " Pallas," 
commanded by Capt. James Johnson, for service from July 3, 1779, to Aug. 20, 
1779, on Penobscot expedition. 

ROBERTS, PETER. Petition signed by said Roberts, in behalf of himself and others, 
asking that he be commissioned as commander of the schooner "Ranger" 
(privateer) ; ordered in Council Sept. 27, 1776, that a commission be issued ; 
also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 20, 1779, signed by Stephen Cross, in behalf 
of himself, Jonathan Titcomb, and others, of Newburyport, owners of the 
brigantine "Jupiter" (privateer), asking that said Roberts be commissioned 
as commander of said vessel ; ordered in Council Nov. 20, 1779, that a com 
mission be issued. 

ROBERTS, REUBEN. Private, Capt. Edward Slocum s co., Col. Christopher Greene s 
(1st Rhode Island) battalion; muster roll for July, 1779, dated East Green 
wich ; enlistment, during war. 

ROBERTS, RICHARD. Mate, State ship "Tartar," commanded by Capt. John Cath- 
cart; engaged May 12, 1782; discharged Nov. 21, 1782; service, 6 mos. 9 days. 
Roll sworn to at Boston. 

ROBERTS, SAMUEL, Cape Elizabeth (also given Falmouth) . List of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Moses Noyes, Chairman of 
Selectmen and Committee of Newbury ; residence, Cape Elizabeth ; engaged 
for town of Newbury; joined Capt. Paul Ellis s co., Col. Bigelow s regt.; 
term, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. Ellis s co., Col. Timothy Bigelow s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from April 13, 1777, to Dec. 31, 
1779 ; reported as serving 25 mos. 7 days as Private, 7 mos. 11 days as Corporal ; 
also, same co. and regt.; return dated Feb. 4, 1778; residence, Falmouth; 
engaged for town of Amesbury ; mustered by County and Continental Muster 
Masters; also, (late) Capt. Paul Ellis s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. : pay rolls for 
Jan., March, and April, 1779, sworn to at Providence; also, Corporal, Lieut. 
Colonel s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from Jan. 1, 1780, to Feb. 24, 1780. 

ROBERTS, SAMUEL, Waltham. Private, Capt. Abijah Child s co., Col. Thomas 
Gardner s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 6, 1775 : service, 
87 days; also, Capt. Child s co., Lieut. Col. William Bond s (late Col. Thomas 
Gardner s) 37th regt.; muster roll dated Camp Prospect Hill, Sept. 9, 1775; 
also, company return dated Camp Prospect Hill, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, receipt for

Robiarts.] 

ROBERTS, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Briant Morton s co. ; entered service Jan. 27,

ROBERTS, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Jedediah Goodwin s co., Col. Joseph Prime s

ROBERTS, SETH. Private, Capt. Moses Harvey s co., Col. Woodbridge s regt.; 
enlisted Aug. 22, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 17 days, at 
Saratoga, including 9 days (180 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to rein 
force Northern army until last of Nov., 1777; also, Capt. Elihu Lyman s co., 
Col. Elisha Porter s (Hampshire Co.) regt. ; enlisted July 25, 1779; discharged 
Aug. 31, 1779; service, 1 mo. 13 days, at New London, Conn., including 6 days 
(124 miles) travel home. 

ROBERTS, THOMAS, Ipswich. Capt. Benjamin Kimball s co., Col. Mansfield s regt. ; 
receipt for advance pay, signed by said Roberts and others, dated Cambridge, 
July 1, 1775 ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; 
enlisted June 12, 1775; service, 1 mo. 22 days; also, Capt. Kimball s co., Col. 
John Mansfield s (19th) regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutchinson; 
company return dated Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or 
its equivalent in money dated Winter Hill, Dec. 30, 1775. 

ROBERTS, THOMAS, Salem. Private, Capt. Joseph Killer s co., Col. Jonathan 
Titcomb s regt.; arrived at destination May 6, 1777; discharged July 6, 1777; 
service, 2 mos. 6 days, at Rhode Island, including 3 days (65 miles) travel 
home. Roll dated Providence. 

ROBERTS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Samuel Knight s co. ; enlisted July 9, 1775 ; 
service, 6 mos., 1 week, 1 day; company stationed at Falmouth, Cumberland 
Co., for defence of seacoast. 

ROBERTS, THOMAS. Treasury payroll of Maj. Thomas Thomas s (Artillery) co. for 
service on expedition to Rhode Island in 1778. 

ROBERTS, THOMAS. Boy, ship "Protector," commanded by Capt. John Foster 
Williams ; engaged March 13, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 17, 1780 ; service, 5 rnos. 
4 days.

U days.

ROBERTS, WILLIAM, Gloucester. Private, Capt. Barnabas Dodge s (6th) co., Lieut. 
Col. Loammi Baldwin s (late Col. Samuel Gerrish s) 38th regt. ; muster roll

ROBERTS, WILLIAM, Great Barrington. Private, Capt. William King s co. of 
Minute-men, Col. John Fellows s regt., which marched April 21, 1775, in 
response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 1 mo. 3 days.

Jones ; list of officers and men entitled to prize shares in the ship " Alexander," 
captured Sept. 20, 1776; also, Seaman, ship "Alfred," commanded by Capt. 
John Paul Jones ; list of officers and men entitled to prize shares in the ship 
" Mellish " and brig " Active " [year not given]. 

ROBERTS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Benjamin Smith s co. ; service between Sept. 1, 
1776, and Nov. 21, 1776, 2 mos. 10 days ; company stationed at Martha s Vine 
yard for defence of seacoast.

at Cape Elizabeth and Scarborough; also, Capt. Morton s co., Col. Mitchel s 
regt. ; service from Sept. 1, 1776, to date of discharge, Nov. 25, 1776, 2 mos. 25 
days ; company stationed on seacoast at Cape Elizabeth and Scarborough. 

ROBERTS, WILLIAM. Corporal, Capt. John Spoor s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service April 26 [1777] ; discharged May -20 
[1777] ; service, 25 days, at Saratoga by order of Maj. Gen. Gates. 

ROBERTS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Samuel Walcutt s co., Col. John Ashley s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Sept. 19, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 2, 1777 ; 
service, 14 days, under Brig. Gen. John Fellows ; company ordered out by Gen. 
Gates to reinforce Northern army. 

ROBERTS, WILLIAM. Seaman, brigantine " Massachusetts," commanded by Capt. 
John Lambert ; engaged Jan. 18, 1778. Roll made up for advance pay for 1 
month and sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

ROBERTS, WILLIAM. Capt. Mark Pool s detachment of militia, Col. Jacob Gerrish s

1778, dated Winter Hill ; also, same co. and regt. ; service from Feb. 3, 1778, 
to April 5, 1778, 2 mos. 2 days, at Cambridge. 

ROBERTS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Samuel Goodrich s co., Lieut. Col. Miles 
Powell s (Berkshire Co.) regt.; enlisted . July 18, 1779; discharged Aug. 22, 
1779; service, 1 mo. 10 days, at New Haven, Conn., including travel home. 

ROBERTS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Adam Kasson s co., Col. Israel Chapen s (3d) 
regt. ; enlisted Oct. 18, 1779; discharged Nov. 21, 1779; service, 1 mo. 8 days, 
at Claverack ; regiment raised for 3 months.

ROBERTSON, GEORGE. Return certified at Camp near Morristown, April 30, 1780, 
of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s 
regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., 
who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry 
Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9, 1779 ; rank, Private ; engaged 
March 17, 1778 ; said Robertson appears among men belonging to Col. William 
R. Lee s regt. who had been discharged from the rolls prior to above arrange 
ment ; reported deserted April 2, 1778.

bridge s regt. ; entered service Sept. 19, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29 (also given 
Nov. 30), 1777; service, 2 mos. 20 days, under Maj. Gen. Gates at the North 
ward, including 9 days (175 miles) travel home ; also, payroll for same service 
dated Greenwich.

Col. John Fellows s regt., which marched April 21, 1775, in response to the 
alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 17 days; reported enlisted into the army. 
[See James Robinson.] 

ROBERTSON, JAMES. List of men raised in Middlesex Co. for Continental service, 
agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superin 
tendent for said county, Nov. 24, 1779; engaged for town of Cambridge ; also, 
descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co. in 1779 to serve in the Con 
tinental Army ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for 
town of Cambridge ; delivered to Ensign T. White. 

ROBERTSON, JAMES. Private, Capt. Henry Tiebout s co., Col. Goose Van Schaick s

Levi Doane, bound on voyage from port of Boston ; descriptive list of officers 
and crew, dated Nov. 25, 1780; age, 26 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, 
light ; residence, Boston. 

ROBERTSON, JOHN, Georgetown. List of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army, as returned by Capt. Benjamin Evans, sworn to in Essex Co., Feb. 13, 
1778 ; residence, Georgetown ; engaged for town of Salisbury ; joined Capt. 
Baley s co., Col. M. Jackson s regt. ; term, 3 years. 

ROBERTSON, JOHN. Matross, Capt. John Callender s co. commanded by Capt. 
Lieut. William Perkins, Col. Richard Gridley s (Artillery) regt. ; muster roll 
dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted June 6, 1775; service, 2 mos. ; also, Capt. Lieut.

1775] ; reported deserted. 



416 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

ROBERTSON, JOHN. Orders of the day, dated Cambridge, May 18, and May 25, 
1775; said Robertson, Lieutenant Colonel, appointed field officer of the day 
for May 19, and May 26, 1775 ; also, general order dated June 13, 1775 ; said 
Robertson, Lieutenant Colonel, appointed officer of the main guard "to mor 
row morning; " also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representa 
tives, dated Jan. 23, 1776, for officers to command the six regiments to be raised 
to serve before Boston until April 1, 1776 ; said Robertson chosen Colonel of a 
regiment to be raised in Middlesex and Lincoln counties ; appointment con 
curred in by Council Jan. 23, 1776. [See Roberts and John Robinson.] 

ROBERTSON, JOHN. Mariner, ship "Vengeance," commanded by Capt. Thomas 
Thomas; engaged June 27, 1779; discharged Aug. 27, 1779; service, 2 mos., 
on Penobscot expedition ; vessel reported lost. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

ROBERTSON, JOHN. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for 
Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Jan. 19,1777; Maj. Eben Stevens s battalion; re 
ported received State bounty; also, Matross, Capt. "Winslow s co., Col. John 
Crane s (3d Artillery) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Jan. 6, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; credited to town of Rehoboth ; reported as serving 
11 mos. 25 days as Matross, 24 mos. as Bombardier; also, Bombardier, Capt. 
John Lillie s co., Col. Crane s regt. ; return of men who were in camp on or 
before Aug. 14, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently except on fur 
lough, etc. ; also, same co. and regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for ser 
vice from Jan. 1, 1780, to June 20, 1780. 

ROBERTSON, JOHN. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Natick for 
service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp Aug. 1, 1780 ; 
discharged Feb. 1, 1781 ; service, 6 mos. 10 days, including travel (200 miles) 
home. 

ROBERTSON, JOHN. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to 
resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for 
said county ; age, 35 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 3 in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, dark ; 
eyes, blue ; occupation, farmer ; engaged for town of Waltham ; engaged April 
28, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

ROBERTSON, JONATHAN, Sutton. Private, Capt. Arthur Dagget s co., Col. Learned s 
regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 3 mos., 
1 week, 1 day; also, list of men mustered by Thomas Newhall, Muster Master 
for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Martin s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. ; mustered June 18, 
1777 ; term, 3 years.

kill June 14, 1778.

days (223 miles) travel home ; roll dated North Castle ; also, Capt. John Wal 
ton s co.; enlisted Dec. 9, 1776; discharged Dec. 12, 1776; company detached 
for service at Noddle s Island. 

ROBINS, ELEAZER, Plympton. Private, Capt. John Bridgham s (Plympton) co., 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Marshfield and then returned 
by order of Col. Cotton ; service, 3 days. 

ROBINS, ELI, Sturbridge. List of men raised in Essex Co. for the term of 9 months 
from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, returned as mustered by Henry Rut 
gers, Jr., Deputy Muster Master, dated Fishkill, Aug. 1, 1778; residence, 
Sturbridge ; engaged for town of Sturbridge ; arrived at Fishkill June 7, 1778. 

ROBINS, ELIENAI. Private, Capt. Hezekiah Green s co., Col. Barns s regt. ; entered 
service Oct. 13, 1781 ; service, 11 days ; company marched from Windsor to 
Saratoga on an alarm at the Northward. 

ROBINS, ELIPHALET. Private, Capt. Simon Jackson s (8th) co., Col. John Grea- 
ton s (3d) regt.; muster roll for Oct., 1782; enlisted Aug. 26, 1782; reported 
joined; also, Capt. William Watson s (6th) co., 3d Mass. regt. commanded 
by Lieut. William Mellin; muster rolls for Jan. and Feb., 1783; also, Capt. 
James Tisdale s (4th) co., 3d Mass. regt. commanded by Col. Michael Jackson ; 
muster roll for Aug. and Sept., 1783; balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 
12 months 7 days. 

ROBINS, ELISHA, Newton. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Wiswall s co., which marched 
in response to the alann of April 19, 1775, to Lexington ; service, 3 days. 

ROBINS, EPHRAIM, Groton. Private, Capt. Henry Farwell s (1st) co., Col. William 
Prescott s (10th) regt.; company return [probably Oct., 1775]; enlisted April 
19, 1775. 

ROBINS, EPHRAIM, Warwick. Private, Capt. Job Alvord s co., Col. Shepard s 
regt.; return dated Jan. 31, 1778; residence, Warwick; enlisted for town of 
Warwick : enlistment, 8 months ; mustered by State and Continental Muster 
Masters; reported discharged Jan. 1, 1778. 

ROBINS, GEORGE, York. List of men raised for Continental service [year not given] ; 
residence, York. 

ROBINS, GEORGE. List of men returned as serving on picket guard under Maj. 
Baldwin, dated May 23, 1775 ; reported detailed under Capt. Reuben Dickinson. 

ROBINS, HENRY, Boston. Capt. John Popkin s co., Col. Richard Gridley s (Artil 
lery) regt. : receipt for advance pay, signed by said Robins and others, dated 
Winter Hill. July 14, 1775; also, company return dated Camp at Winter Hill, 
Sept. 27, 1775: also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated 
Winter Hill, Jan. 2, 1776.

Massachusetts, including 4 days (84 miles) travel home ; company raised to 
serve for G months from July 1, 1777, unless sooner discharged. 

ROBINS, HENRY. Private, Capt. Ephraim Stearns s -co., Col. John Rand s regt.; 
enlisted July 10, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 11 days, in

serve for 3 months ; also, order on Henry Gardner, Treasurer, payable to John 
Mann, dated Barre, May 1, 1782, signed by said Robins, for wages for service 
in Capt. Ephraim Stearns s co., Col. John Rand s regt., in 1780.

regt., at Rhode Island in 1778. [The foregoing appear among orders, returns, 
etc., taken from Capt. Benjamin Munroe s papers.]

comb s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; left place of ren 
dezvous April 24, 1775; service, 5 days .

Whtcomb s (Whitcomb s) regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm 
of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; returned home May 6, 1775 ; service, 19 days.

Whitney s regt. ; entered service June 28, 1776, 4 days preceding march ; ser

company drafted from militia and marched to join Continental Army at the 
Northward. , 

ROBINS, JAMES, Yarmouth. Private, Capt. Joseph Palmer s co., Col. Josiah Whit 
ney s regt. ; arrived at camp May 11, 1777; discharged July 11, 1777; service,

camp ; company raised for 2 months. Roll dated Camp at South Kingston. 

ROBINS, JAMES. Private, Capt. James Davis s co. ; enlisted July 10, 1775: service 
to Nov. 1, 1775, in defence of sea-coast. Roll sworn to in Barnstable Co.

ROBINS, ROBERT. Resolve dated Sept. 30, 1777, directing Jabez Hatch, Colonel of 
Boston regt., to arrest and confine said Robins and others who had refused to 
march as ordered, and have them later conveyed under guard to Rhode Island 
and there deliver them to the commanding officer of the detachment raised in 
Massachusetts for a secret expedition.

ROBINS, SOLOMON, Newton. Private, Capt. Jeremiah "VYiswall sco., which marched 
in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Lexington ; service, 1 day. 

ROBINS, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Samuel Healy s co., Col. John Jacobs s (Light 
Infantry) regt. ; enlisted Sept. 17, 1779 ; discharged Nov. 17 (also given Nov. 
16), 1779; service, 2 mos. 6 days, at Rhode Island, including travel to camp 
and home ; mileage allowed to Providence, and from place of discharge home 
(70 miles) ; company raised for 2 months ; also, Capt. Benjamin Allton s co., 
Col. John Rand s regt. ; entered service July 9, 1780, 3 days preceding march ; 
discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 11 days, including travel (180 miles) 
home ; regiment raised for 3 months service at West Point ; roll sworn to at 
Charlton. 

ROBINS, THADDEUS. Private, Capt. Stephen Churchill s co., Col. Theophilus Cot 
ton s regt. ; enlisted March 8, 1781 ; discharged March 12, 1781 ; service, 4 days, 
at Newport, R. I. ; company raised by order of His Excellency John Hancock 
to serve for 40 days, unless sooner discharged. 

ROBINS, THOMAS, Westford. Private, Capt. Abijah Wyman s co., Col. ^Yilliam 
Prescott s regt. ; company return dated Cambridge, Oct. 3, 1775.

ROBINS, TIMOTHY, Yarmouth. Private, Capt. Joseph Palmer s co., Col. Josiah 
"Whitney s regt.; arrived at camp May 11, 1777; discharged July 11, 1777;

to and from camp ; company raised for 2 months ; roll dated Camp at South

marched from home Sept. 27, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 4 days, on a secret expedition 
to Rhode Island.

ley s co.. Col. Mosley s (Hampshire Co.) regt. ; enlisted July 9, 1777 ; discharged

marched to reinforce Northern army.

ered to "William "Walker, Superintendent for said county; Capt. Ingersoll s 
co., Col. Ashley s regt. ; age, 30 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 in. ; complexion, dark; 
hair, dark; occupation, laborer; residence, Great Barrington; engaged for 
town of Great Barrington; term, during war; reported deserted. 

ROBINSON, JAMES, Lexington. Return dated Lexington, Aug. 14, 1777, made to 
Col. Brooks, of men raised from Capt. Francis Brown s co., being every sixth 
man from "Each list" [probably train band and alarm lists]; also, descrip 
tive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve 
of April 20, 1778; Capt. Bridge s co., Col. Brooks s regt.; age, 18 yrs.; stat 
ure, 5 ft. 9 in.; residence, Lexington; engaged for town of Lexington; also, 
. list of men raised in Middlesex Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of 
their arrival at Fishkill, returned as received of Jonathan AVarner, Commis 
sioner, by Col. R. Putnam July 20, 1778; arrived at Fishkill June 19, 1778; 
also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the 
term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of 
Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Col. Timothy Bigelow, at Springfield, Sept. 7, 
1780; age, 20 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, light; engaged for town of 
Lexington; arrived at Springfield Sept. 1, 1780; marched to camp Sept. 7, 
1780, under command of Ensign Simonds ; also, list of men raised for the 6 
months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster 
in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, receipt dated Lexington, 
May 1, 1782, for bounty paid said Robinson by Thomas Fessenden, on behalf 
of a class of the town of Lexington, of which Matthew Bridge was Chairman, 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years.

return [year not given] ; mustered by State and Continental Muster Masters; 
also, Fife Major, Colonel s co., Col. Shepard s (3d) regt. ; muster roll for March 
and April, 1779, dated Camp at Providence : appointed Jan. 1, 1778 : term, 
during w r ar; reported furloughed April 18, 1779, by Gen. Glover for 8 days; 
also, descriptive list of deserters from Col. Shepard s (4th) regt., made up 
from Jan. 1, 1777, to June 1, 1780; rank, Fife Major; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, light; hair, dark; residence, Kingston; enlistment, 
during war; deserted May 19, 1779; reported as having left regiment at 
Providence. 

ROBINSON, JOHN, Mendon. Private, Capt. Gershpm Nelson s co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge and Roxbury ; service, 9 days ; 
also, list of men belonging to Capt. Gershom Nelson s co., dated July 19, 1776 ; 
also, Private, Lieut. Seth Thayer s co., 3d Worcester Co. regt. ; entered ser 
vice Dec. 8, 1776; service, 1 mo. 15 days; company marched to Providence, 
R. I., under command of Lieut. Col. Nathan Tyler on the alarm of Dec. 8, 
1776; also, Sergeant, Capt. Ichabod Thayer s co., Col. Nathan Tyler s regt.; 
entered service July 28, 1780; discharged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 15 days, 
including 3 days (52 miles) travel home ; company ordered to march to Rhode 
Island on an alarm. 

ROBINSON, JOHN, Milton. Sergeant, Capt. Daniel Vose s co. of the train in Milton, 
Col. Robinson s regt., which marched to Roxbury ; service, 14 days, subsequent 
to battle at Concord and before completion of the standing army.

ROBINSON, JOHN, Westford. Lieutenant Colonel, Col. William. Prescott s regt. ; en 
tered service April 19, 1775; service, 3 mos. 20 days; also, Lieutenant Colonel, 
Col. Prescott s regt. ; return of officers, dated May 25, 1775 ; ordered in Provin 
cial Congress May 26, 1775, that said officers be commissioned ; also, Lieutenant 
Colonel, Col. Prescott s (10th) regt. ; list of field and staff officers appearing

to Col. Prescott s regt. who had served as commissioned officers from the 
formation of the army receive their commissions ; ordered in Council Oct. 31, 
1775, that said officers be recommended to Gen. Washington for commissions ; 
also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated May 7, 
1777 ; said Robinson chosen Colonel of a regiment to be raised for defence of 
Boston harbor; appointment concurred in by Council May 8, 1777: reported 
commissioned May 8, 1777 ; also, Colonel ; muster roll of field and staff officers, 
dated North Kingston, Dec. 18, 1777; commissioned June 27, 1777; term, 
6 months, to expire Jan. 1, 1778: also, Colonel, Col. David Mosely s (3d 
Hampshire Co.) regt.; entered service June 12, 1782; discharged June 14, 
1782: service, 3 days; horse rations allowed said Robinson; reported as not 
belonging to said regiment although serving with it ; regiment raised for sup 
port of the government at Northampton. [See Roberts, John Robertson, 

and Robinson.]

ROBINSON, JOSEPH, Salem. Master s Mate, brigantine " Massachusetts, " commanded 
by Capt. John Fisk ; abstract for advance wages for I month, dated Salem, 
March IT, 1777; engaged March 11 [1777] ; also, Master, same vessel and com 
mander ; engaged July 31, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 16, 1777 ; roll dated Boston ; 
also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 21, 1777, signed by Josiah Orrie & Co., of 
Salem, asking that said Kobinson be commissioned as commander of the 
brigantine " Pluto" (privateer) ; ordered in Council Nov. 21, 1777, that a com 
mission be issued; also, petition dated Boston, March 30, 1779, signed by 
Stephen Higginson, in behalf of Elias Hasket Derbey and Bartholomew Put 
nam, of Salem, asking that said Robinson be commissioned as commander of 
the brigantine "Franklin" (privateer) ; ordered in Council March 30, 1779, 
that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, Sept. 10, 1779, signed 
by said Robinson, in behalf of the owners of the ship " Franklin " (privateer) , 
asking that he be commissioned as commander of said vessel; ordered in 
Council Sept. 10, 1779, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated 
Boston, March 22, 1780, signed by Andrew Cabot, of Beverly, asking that 
said Robinson be commissioned as commander of the ship " Pilgrim " (pri 
vateer) ; ordered in Council March 24, 1780, that a commission be issued; 
also, Captain, ship "Pilgrim; " descriptive list of officers and crew, dated 
Aug. 2, 1780; age, 26yrs. ; stature, 6 ft. ; complexion, light; residence, Salem; 
also, petition dated Boston, April 14, 1781, signed by William Creed, in behalf 
of Jonathan Jackson and others, asking that said Robinson be commissioned 
as commander of the ship "Pilgrim" (privateer) ; advised in Council April 
14, 1781, that a commission be issued; also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 8, 
1781, signed by Job Prince, Jr., in behalf of William Leach and others, of 
Beverly, asking that said Robinson be commissioned as commander of the ship 
"Pilgrim" (privateer) ; advised in Council Nov. 20, 1781, that a commission 
be issued. [See Joseph Robertson.] 

ROBINSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Nathan Alden s co., Col. Edward Mitchell s 
regt. ; service, 16 days ; company marched to Rhode Island under command of 
Lieut. John Whitman on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776. 

ROBINSON, JOSEPH. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Feb. 6, 1776 ; said Robinson chosen 1st Lieutenant in Capt. Benjamin 
Plurnmer s co. to be stationed at St. Georges, Lincoln Co. ; appointment con 
curred in by Council Feb. 7, 1776; reported commissioned Feb. 7, 1776; also, 
1st Lieutenant, Capt. Plummer s co. ; entered service Feb. 6, 1776 ; discharged 
Dec. 10, 1776; company stationed at St. Georges for defence of seacoast. 

ROBINSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. James Harlow s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt. ; 
enlisted June 5, 1778 ; service, 8 mos. 8 days, including travel (480 miles) to 
and from camp ; regiment raised for 8 months to guard passes of North river. 

ROBINSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Daniel Gilbert s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt. ; service from Aug. 2, 1778, at Rhode Island ; reported deserted Aug. 29, 
1778. Roll sworn to in Worcester Co. 

ROBINSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Thomas Starret s detachment from Col. Mason 
Wheaton s regt. ; service from June 29, 1779, to July 2, 1779, 4 days, at Cam- 
den, Eastern department. 

ROBINSON, JOSEPH. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army

received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring 
field, July 8, 1780 ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged 
for town of Pembroke ; marched to camp July 8, 1780, under command of

ROBINSON, JOSIAH. Sergeant, Capt. Thomas Bussey s co. of Berkshire Co. militia, 
known as the " Silver Grays; " entered service Sept. 5, 1777 ; service, 28 days; 
company marched to Pawlet on an alarm.

cers to command the six regiments to be raised to serve before Boston until

seacoast at Cape Elizabeth and Scarborough ; also, list of men raised to serve 
in the Continental Army from 5th co., Col. Peter Noyes s (1st Cumberland Co.) 
regt., as returned by Capt. Daniel Strout ; residence, Cape Elizabeth ; engaged 
for town of Cape Elizabeth; joined Capt. Skiling s co., Col. Francis s regt.; 
term, 3 years; also, Drum Major, Capt. Clarke s co., Col. Tupper s regt. ; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; 
also, Capt. John Skillin s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; subsistence 
allowed from date of enlistment, Dec. 25 [1776], to time of arrival at Ben- 
nington ; credited with 86 days subsistence, including allowance for 336 miles 
travel; residence, Falmouth; also, Drummer, Capt. Samuel Thomes s co., 
Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; return dated Jan. 26, 1778; mustered by Maj. 
Ilsley, County Muster Master, and Col. Varrick, Continental Muster Master ; 
reported sick at Albany : also, Drum Major, Capt. Billy Porter s co., Col. Tup 
per s regt.; muster roll for Jan., 1779, dated West Point: enlisted Dec. 13, 
1776; also, Colonel s co., Col. Tupper s regt.; muster roll for March, 1779, 
dated West Point ; also, Sergeant ; account rendered against the United States 
by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts for amounts paid officers and men of 
Col. Tupper s regt. on account of depreciation of their wages for the first three 
years service in the Continental Army from 1777 to 1780.

ROBINSON, WINTHROP, Westford. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve

for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; also, 
descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term 
of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of Jime 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin 
Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 7, 1780; 
age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 3 in. ; complexion, dark ; engaged for town of West- 
ford ; arrived at Springfield July 6, 1780; marched to camp July 7, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Dix ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and 
returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, payroll for 6 months men raised by the 
town of Westford for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
July 2, 1780; discharged Dec. 8, 1780; service, 5 mos. 18 days, including travel 
(240 miles) home. 

ROBINSON, ZACHAKY (also given ZACCHEUS). Receipt dated Sudbury, April 1,

complexion, light; hair, brown ; eyes, blue ; occupation, farmer; engaged for 
town of Sudbury; engaged April 15, 1781; term, 3 years.

1777 ; discharged July 17, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 9 days, under Col. David Wells 
in Northern department ; roll dated Shelburne ; also, Capt. Abel Dinsmore s 
co., Col. Riiggles Woodbridge s regt.; enlisted Aug. 17 (also given Aug. 20), 
1777; discharged Nov. 29, 1777; service, 3 mos. 22 (also given 3 mos. 13) days, 
with Northern army, including 9 clays (185 miles) travel home.

Gen. John Fellows; also, certificate dated Kingsbury, July 21, 1777, signed by 
Col. John Brown, certifying that said Rockwood served in the Berkshire Co. 
regt. under his command and in the camps as a wagoner from July 1 to July 
21, 1777, and was allowed 5 days to return home, the distance being 100 miles.

into Col. Crane s (Artillery) regt. ; also, return dated Hingham, June 28, 1779, 
signed by Joseph Thaxter, Jr., of men raised by said town to serve in the Con 
tinental Army for the term of 3 years at the time the 9 months levy was ordered 
in 1778 : the men in question were raised over and above the one-seventh part 
of militia furnished as the town s quota of the Continental Army ; said Rodsfell 
enlisted into Col. Crane s regt. by Lieut. Dunnell.

latter had enlisted with Lieut. Ebenezer Field in Capt. Fissh s co., Col. Shepard s

Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779;

dence, Ashiield ; engaged for town of Ashfield ; mustered by State and Conti 
nental Muster Masters; also, same co. and regt.; muster roll for Oct., 1778; 
also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Provi 
dence ; enlisted Feb. 7 (also given Feb. 1) , 1777; also, statement of Continental 
balances, certified April 29, 1780 ; term, during war ; also, Capt. William Moor s 
co., Col. William Shepard s (4th) regt. ; muster roll for May, 1781, dated West 
Point ; also, muster rolls for June and July, 1781, sworn to in Camp at Phillips- 
burgh : reported on command at West Point; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, 
sworn to at Peekskill; also, muster roll for Sept., 1781, dated Camp Continen 
tal Village; also, muster roll for Oct. and Nov., 1781, dated York Hutts and 
sworn to at West Point ; reported deserted Dec. 1, 1781 ; also, account rendered 
against the United States by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts for amounts 
paid officers and men of Col. William Shepard s regt., on account of depre 
ciation of their wages for the first three years service in the Continental 
Army from 1777 to 1780.

Falmouth.

enlistment, 9 months; also, same co. and regt.; muster roll for Sept., 1778, 
dated Fredericksburgh ; reported sick in general hospital; also, nuister roll 
for Oct., 1778, dated Camp Roxbury ; reported sick in flying hospital Oct. 14, 
1778; also, same co. and regt.; muster rolls for Nov., 1778, and Jan., 1779, 
dated Camp Continental Village ; reported sick in general hospital in Nov., 
1778, deserted Jan. 30 [1779]. 

ROGERS, JONATHAN, Jr. Private, Capt. Joshua Higgins s co., Maj. Zenas Wins- 
low s regt. ; service between Sept. 6, and Sept. 13, 1778, 3 days, on alarms at 
Bedford and Falmouth. 

ROGERS, JOSEPH, Newbury. Private, Capt. Jacob Gerrish s co., Col. Moses Little s 
(17th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 1, 1775 ; service, 
3 mos. 8 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; age, 21 yrs. ; also, 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Dec. 27, 1775; also, 
Private, Capt. Joshua French s co., Col. Edward Wigglesworth s regt. ; pay 
abstract for travel allowance, etc., from Albany home ; 240 miles travel allowed 
said Rogers ; warrant allowed in Council Jan. 30, 1777.

ROGERS, JOSEPH, Yarmouth. Private, Capt. Joshua Gray s co., which marched

ROGERS, JOSHUA. Private, Capt. Stephen Jenkins s co., Col. Samuel Johnson s

amount of roll dated at Newburyport and signed by Capt. Jenkins. 

ROGERS, JOSHUA. Private, Capt. Joshua Higgins s co., Maj. Zenas Winslow s

Northern army and was discharged 110 miles from home.

panies in said regiment ; ordered in Council May 31, 1776, that said officers be 
commissioned; reported commissioned May 31, 1776; also, 2d Lieutenant, 
Capt. Solomon Kidder s (9th) co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt.; list of officers 
of a regiment drafted from Middlesex Co. militia and ordered to march to 
Horse Neck by Brig. Oliver Prescott Sept. 26, 1776 ; also, same co. and regt. ; 
engaged Sept. 27, 1776 ; discharged Nov. 16, 1776 ; service, 62 days, including 
11 days (227 miles) travel ; order for payment of amount of roll dated at North 
Castle and signed by Col. Brooks; also, Lieutenant, same co. and regt. ; return 
endorsed " 1776 " and probably made up at White Plains ; said Rogers reported 
as at White Plains and fit for duty. 

ROGERS, TIMOTHY. Agreement signed by said Rogers, " C. Mate," and others, 
engaging themselves to serve on board the sloop " Winthrop," commanded by 
Capt. George Little, for 6 months from time of sailing from Boston, unless 
sooner discharged ; engaged March 27 [year not given]. 

ROGERS, W., Stoughtonham. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Tisdale s (Stoughtonham) 
co., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775: service, 2 weeks 1 day.

ROGERS, WILLIAM, Newbury. Captain of a company of Minute-men, Col. Samuel 
Gerrish s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 5 days ; 
also, Captain, Col. Gerrish s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged 
April 24, 1775; service, 3 mos. 15 days; also, Captain, Col. Gerrish s regt. ; re 
turns of effectives between July 5, 1775, and Aug. 13, 1775, dated Chelsea and 
Maiden ; also, return made by said Rogers, Captain, of sheep taken to Pullen s 
Point, dated Chelsea, Aug. 19, 1775 ; also, receipt given to Lieut. Col. Loammi 
Baldwin, dated Chelsea, Sept. 9, 1775, signed by said Rogers, Captain, 38th 
regt., for wages for his company; also, Captain, 8th co. ; return of casualties 
of the several companies in the 38th regt. made by Lieut. Col. Loammi Bald 
win, dated Chelsea, Sept. -, 1775; also, Captain, Lieut. Col. Baldwin s (late 
Col. Gerrish s) 38th regt.; company return [probably Oct., 1775]; also, same 
regt. ; returns of effectives between Sept. 1, 1775, and Dec. 28, 1775, dated 
Chelsea ; also, account of rations allowed officers of the 38th regt., commanded 
by Lieut. Col. Baldwin, from July 1, 1775, to Dec. 31, 1775, dated Chelsea ; said 
Rogers credited with 184 days allowance; also, account dated Chelsea, Dec. 
31, 1775, of the appraisement made by appraisers appointed by Col. Baldwin of 
guns taken for public use from men belonging to the 38th regt. (old army) w r ho 
left the service Dec. 31, 1775, having been stationed at Chelsea and Medford ; 
also, return of the number of guns wanted in 26th regt., dated Cambridge, Jan. 
8, 1776; 20 guns reported as wanted in company of (late) Capt. Rogers; also, 
receipt dated Chelsea, Feb. 3, 1776, signed by said Rogers and others, for money 
received of Col. Loammi Baldwin " for Guns Stopt and Priz d by the Com 
mittee on the 31st Day of Decem last agreable to General Orders in the 26 
Regt ; " also, Captain of a company raised in Newbury, Salisbury, and Tops- 
field ; return made by Aaron Wood, Chairman of a committee appointed in 
Essex Co. by resolve of June 20, 1776, to raise men to reinforce Continental 
Army in Canada and New York; also, general order dated Headquarters, 
Ticonderoga, Sept. 5, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; 
said Rogers, Captain, promoted to Major, Col. Wiggles worth s regt., in the 
room of Maj. Roberts, promoted to Lieutenant Colonel; also, Major, Col. 
Edward Wigglesworth s regt. ; pay abstract of field and staff officers for travel 
allowance, etc., from Albany home ; 240 miles travel allowed said Rogers ; ser 
vice in Northern department on the " late Campaign; " warrant allowed in 
Council Jan. 28, 1777 ; also, copy of a company receipt, given to the Selectmen 
of Newbury, for wages for 1^ mos. service under said Rogers, Major, at Rhode 
Island, dated Newbury, Jan. 25, 1779; also, Major, Lieut. Col. Enoch Put 
nam s regt. ; detached Aug. 13, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 7, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 
8 days, including 13 days (260 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to reinforce 
Continental Army for 3 months and stationed at West Point.

return dated Oct. 6, 1775.

ROGERS, WILLIAM. Petition dated " Kingston," Guard-ship, Oct. 20, 1777, signed by 
James Reid, stating that he had been taken prisoner Sept. 3, 1777, while a 
passenger on board the transport " Jamieson and Peggy," commanded by Capt. 
James Paterson, bound from Cork to New York, by the privateer "General 
Washington," owned by Messrs. Seers and Smith, of Boston, and commanded 
by said Rogers, Captain, and placed on board the "Kingston," guard-ship, 
Sept. 27, 1777, and requesting liberty to go ashore in order to attend to his 
private affairs ; ordered in Council Oct. 25, 1777, that the Commissary of Pris 
oners be directed to permit the said James Reid to come ashore in accordance 
with his petition. 

ROGERS, WILLIAM. Descriptive return dated Boston, made by Edward Procter, 
Colonel of Boston regt., of men who had enlisted to serve in the militia under 
Brig. Gen. John Fellows for the term of 3 months from the time of arrival at 
place of rendezvous, unless sooner discharged, and who had received bounty 
and mileage due them of said Col. Procter ; Capt. Farrington s co. ; age, 33 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, light; also, Private, Capt. Samuel Holden s 
co., Col. Ebenezer Thayer s regt. ; enlisted July 27, 1780; discharged Oct. 30, 
1780 ; service, 3 mos. 6 days ; regiment raised in Suffolk Co. to reinforce Con 
tinental Army for 3 months. 

ROGERS, ZACCHEUS, Marshfield. Private, Capt. Joseph Cliffs co. of militia, Col.

also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Winter Hill, Dec. 
20, 1775.

ter rolls for Aug. and Oct., 1782 ; also, Capt. Nathaniel C. Allen s (8th) co., 4th 
Mass. regt. ; muster roll for Sept., 1783.

ROLF, MOSES. Sergeant, in a detachment under Lieut. John Bohannan belonging 
to Col. Foster s (Lincoln Co.) regt. ; entered service Dec. 19, 1778; discharged 
Dec. 21, 1778; service, 3 days; detachment called out by Lieiit. Col. Campbell 
in defence of State stores on board the " Merry Sheet," from Boston, bound to 
garrison at Machias. Roll dated Narraguagus. 

ROLF, RICHARD, Newbury. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, 
as returned by Moses Noyes, Chairman of Selectmen and Committee of New- 
bury ; residence, Newbury; engaged for town of Newbury; joined Capt. Cart- 
wright s co., Col. Jackson s regt. ; term, 3 years ; also, return certified at Camp 
near Morristown, April 30, 1780, of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, 
Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts 
in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., who were incorporated into a regiment under 
the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9, 
1779; rank, Sergeant; residence, Newbury; engaged May 24, 1777; term, 3 
years ; said Rolf appears among men belonging to Col. Henry Jackson s regt. 
who had been discharged from the rolls prior to above arrangement ; reported 
reduced to Private April 1, 1778, deserted to the enemy May 2, 1778. 

ROLF, TIMOTHY, Falmouth (also given Newbury and Newburyport; . List of men

French s co., Lieut. Col. Enoch Putnam s regt. ; engaged Aug. 20, 1781 ; dis 
charged Nov. 25, 1781 ; service, 3 inos. 28 days, near "West Point, including 13 
days (260 miles) travel home : regiment raised in Essex and Plymouth counties 
to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

muster roll for April, 1779, dated Pawtuxet; appointed April 1, 1778; also, 
same co. and regt. ; return dated Providence, July 9, 1779 ; residence, New 
bury; also, Capt. Thomas Hunt s (4th) co., Col. Jackson s regt. ; payroll for 
Oct., 1779, dated Camp near Providence: also, Capt. Hunt s co., Col. Jack 
son s regt. ; regimental return made up to Dec. 31, 1779, dated Camp at Provi 
dence; engaged June 1, 1777; term, 3 years. 

ROLSTON, JOHN. Report of guard detail and prisoners under confinement, dated 
Ticonderoga, Sept. 26, 1776, made to Maj. Gen. Gates, taken from Col. Ephraim 
Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Rolston confined by Adj. Johnson for selling 
rum to the soldiers and suffering them to be drunk at his tent after seasonable 
hours contrary to orders. 

ROMANS, PETER. Seaman, State sloop "Winthrop," commanded by Capt. George 
Little; engaged July 25, 1782; discharged Nov. 25, 1782; service, 4 mos. : roll 
sworn to at Boston; also, same vessel and commander: engaged Dec. 7. 1782; 
discharged Feb. 10, 1783 ; service, 2 mos. 4 days ; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

ROMARK, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Thomas Mighill s co.. Col. Loamnii Baldwin s 
(26th) regt. ; pay abstract for June, 1776, dated New York.

HOMER, JOHN. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from 7th "West- 
borough co., 6th regt., as returned by Capt. Nathan Fisher, dated June 10, 
1778 ; engaged for town of Westborough ; joined Capt. Robert Allen s co., Col. 
Ichabod Alden s regt. ; term, during war; reported as not belonging to any in 
corporated town. 

ROMERILL, EBENEZER, Springfield. Private, in a company of Minute-men, which 
marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, under com 
mand of Maj. Andrew Colton; service, 10 days; reported enlisted into the 
army April 29, 1775. 

ROMERS, THOMAS, Leominster. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from 8th Worcester Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Nathaniel Carter, sworn to 
Feb. 20, 1778; residence, Leominster; engaged for town of Leominster; term, 
3 years or during war. 

ROMERY, THOMAS. Captain, (late) Col. Storer s regt. ; entered service Aug. 14, 
1777; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 123 days, including travel (16 days) 
home ; company marched from York Co. to Manchester to join army under 
Gen. Gates. 

ROMMANT, JOSIAH. Return of sentences by a general court-martial, Col. Phinney, 
President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, 
Nov. 5, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim "Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Rom- 
mant, of Capt. Bliss s co., Col. Patterson s regt., tried on charge of sleeping at 
his post, found guilty, and sentenced to receive 20 lashes on the bare back, but 
upon a request of the court and a recommendation of the honesty and good 
behavior of the criminal, he was pardoned by the General and ordered to be 
released. 

ROMSDALE, JOSEPH, Belchertown. Private, Capt. Jonathan Bardwell s co. of 
Minute-men, Col. Jonathan "Warner s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in 
response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service, 14 days. 

RONALDS, ENOS, Boxford. List of men raised for the 6 months service and returned 
by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780. 

ROND, ""WHIFF." Private, Capt. Sylvanus Smith s co., Col. Timothy Bigelow s 
regt. ; muster roll for Jan., 1778, dated Camp at Valley Forge ; enlisted March

ROOT, AARON, Westfield. Receipt dated Westfield, July 11, 1780, signed by said 
Root and others, for amount of wages (12 each) received in advance from, the 
town of Westfield for service to be performed in the Continental Army for the 
term of 6 months " next ensuing," the wages to become due from the State for 
said service being relinquished to the town ; also, return of 3 and 6 months men 
raised in Hampshire Co. from (late) Col. Moseley s regt., by order of Brig. Gen. 
Danderson (Danielson) , dated Hampshire Co. ; said Root returned as among 
men belonging to Capt. Moseley s, Capt. Kelog s, and Lieut. Sait s [ ? ] cos. ; 
engaged for town of Westfield; term, 6 months; also, descriptive list of men 
raised to reinforce th e Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable 
to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, 
by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 12, 1780; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, freckled ; engaged for town of Westfield ; marched to 
camp July 12, 1780, under command of Ensign Gilbert ; also, list of men raised 
for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed 
muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780.

Berkshire Co.) regt.; appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 7, 1776; 
reported commissioned Feb. 7, 1176 ; also, list of officers chosen by the several

co. in Sheffield, Col. Hopkins s (1st Berkshire Co.) regt., as returned by said 
Root, Lieut. Colonel, and others, dated Sheffield, Sept. 23, 1776; ordered in 
Council Oct. 1, 1776, that said officers be commissioned.

ROOT, AARON, Jr., Sheffield. Certificate dated Sheffield, Sept. 10, 1781, signed by 
William Sheldon, Chairman of a class of the town of Sheffield, certifying that 
he had hired said Root to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years, 
and that he had been mustered and turned over to the Superintendent for 
Berkshire Co. and received bounty; also, descriptive list dated Lenox, Aug. 
20, 1781, of men raised in Berkshire Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, 
and delivered to William Walker, Superintendent for said county ; Capt. Down- 
ing s co., Col. Ashley s regt. ; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 6 ft.; complexion, dark; 
hair, brown; occupation, laborer; residence, Sheffield; engaged for town of 
Sheffield ; term, 3 years ; reported receipted for by Capt. Smith. 

ROOT, AARON, Jr. Receipt dated Springfield, June 19, 1782, for bounty paid said 
Root by Joseph Lopez, Chairman of Class No. 1 of the town of Leicester, to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years ; also, Private, Col. Ben 
jamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from July 1, 1782, to date of discharge, 
Oct. 1, 1782, 3 mos. 

ROOT, ABRAHAM, Sheffield. Private, Capt. William Bacon s co. of Minute-men, 
Col. Fellows s regt., which marched April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of 
April 19, 1775; service to May 7, 1775, 17 days; reported enlisted into the 
army; also, Capt. William Bacon s co., Col. John Fellows s regt. ; muster roll 
dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 8, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 1 day ; also, company 
return dated Dorchester, Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or its equiv 
alent in money dated Dorchester, Dec. 19, 1775 ; also, return of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army probably from Capt. Noble s co., Col. Ashley s 
regt. ; residence, Sheffield ; engaged for town of Sheffield ; joined Capt. Bart- 
lett s co., Col. Weston s (Wesson s) regt.; term, 3 years; also, list of men

Master for Berkshire Co. ; Capt. Bartlett s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; also, Cor 
poral, Lieut. Col. Millen s co., Col. James Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army

Samuel Bartlett s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; return of men who were in service

on furlough, etc. ; also, list of men who re-enlisted between Oct. 22, 1779, and

as returned by Joseph Pettengill, of 9th Mass. regt. ; also, Sergeant, Capt.

of men raised in Berkshire Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, and deliv

Col. Ashley s regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, light; hair,

1780; enlistment, 3 years; reported in smallpox hospital in Feb. and March, 
1781, died April 26, 1781.

ROOT, THADDEUS, Sheffield. Private, in a detachment from Capt. William Fellows s 
co. of matrosses commanded by Lieut. Paul Dewey, Brig. Gen. John Fellows s

1777; service, 28 days; detachment ordered out by Brig. Gen. Fellows to serve 
under Maj. Gen. Gates in Northern department ; also, Capt. William Fellows s 
co. of matrosses, Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire Co.) regt. ; enlisted Oct. 15, 
1780 ; discharged Oct. 17, 1780 ; service, 4 days ; company marched to the North 
ward on an alarm at the time Forts Ann and George were taken by the enemy ;

1781 and 1782 in said regiment.

BOOT, WILLIAM, Sheffield. Receipt dated Sheffield, March 14, 1781, for bounty paid 
said Root by Ephraim Kellogg, on behalf of a class of the town of Sheffield, to

dated Lenox, Aug. 20, 1781, of men raised in Berkshire Co., agreeable to resolve 
of Dec. 2, 1780, and delivered to William Walker, Superintendent for said 
county; Capt. Noble s co., Col. Ashley s regt. ; age, 16yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ;

reported as having been a prisoner at Halifax more than a year ; ordered in

Blandford and also at Westfield ; also, petition dated Granville, March 10, 1778, 
signed by said Rose, stating that he was drafted for 3 months service in Northern 
department ; that he joined Col. David Leonard s regt., inarched to Ticonderoga, 
and served in Capt. William Cannon s co. until the evacuation of Ticonderoga ; 
that he w r as captured by the enemy July 7, 1777, and remained a prisoner until 
Sept. 19, 1777, when he was released by the successful attack of Col. John Brown 
upon the borders of Ticonderoga : and asking that he be granted wages from the 
time of his captivity to the time of his return home ; also, Council warrant, dated 
Oct. 17, 1778, for 5 13s., drawn in favor of said Rose, for his wages from July 7 
[1777], the time he was taken prisoner at Ticonderoga, to Sept. 29 [1777], the 
time of his return home; also, Private, Capt. Samuel Sloper s co.. Col. Israel 
Chapin s (3d) regt.; enlisted Xov. 5, 1779; discharged Xov. 22, 1779; service, 
22 days, at Claverack, including 5 days (100 miles) travel home; regiment 
raised to reinforce Continental Army for 3 mouths. 



574 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AXD SAILORS 

ROSE, RANSFORD, Preston. Sergeant, Capt. Nathan Peters s co., Col. Timothy 
Danielson s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged April 26, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 2 days; also, company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for 
bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Roxbury, Nov. 20, 1775. 

ROSE, REUBEN, Scituate. Private, Capt. Galen Clapp s (2d Scituate) co. of militia, 
Col. Anthony Thomas s regt., which marched in response to the alarm of April 
19, 1775; entered service April 19, 1775; service, 5 days; also, Sergeant, Capt. 
Joseph Soper s co. ; engaged July 24, 1775; service to Dec. 31, 1775, 5 mos. 
21 days, under direction of field officers of 1st Plymouth Co. regt. ; company 
stationed on seacoast ; also, 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Thomas Collenier, Jr. s 7th 
(Scituate) co., 2d Plymouth Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen

and others, dated Hanover, May 8, 1776; ordered in Council May 10, 1776, that

in Scituate and Hanover; also, 2cl Lieutenant, Capt. Amos Turner s co., Col. 
John Cushing s regt. ; engaged Sept. 23, 1776 ; service, 1 mo. 28 days; company 
marched to Rhode Island ; roll dated Newport ; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Thomas 
Collamer s co., Col. John Cushing s (Plymouth Co.) regt.; service, 15 days; 
company assembled at Bristol, R. I., on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; also, Lieu

April 11, 1777, and marched to Tiverton, R. I. ; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Calvin 
Curtis s co., Col. John Jacobs s regt. ; engaged June 10, 1778; service, 6 rnos. 
20 (also given 6 mos. 25) days, at Rhode Island ; term to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

ROSE, RUFUS. Private, Capt. William Cooley s co., Col. John Mosley s (Hamp 
shire Co.) regt. ; enlisted Aug. 17, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 19, 1777 ; service, 
4 days ; company marched towards Bennington on an alarm. Roll sworn to 
at Granville.

Ross, . Petition addressed to the Council, dated Boston, Dec. 22, 1777, signed 

by John Forsyth, a prisoner in Boston, late Master of the brigantine " Nancy," 
taken by the brig "Reprisial," Paul Reed, Commander, stating that he was 
desirous of being exchanged for a person of equal rank, and asking permission 
to go to Newport on parole in order to be exchanged for said Ross, a prisoner 
at New York, who had been in the employ of Hon. Richard Derby, Jr., as 
Captain of a schooner bound from Charlestown to Salem ; ordered in Council 
Dec. 22, 1777, that said Forsyth be permitted to go to Newport to procure the 
liberation of said Capt. Ross ; also, list of prisoners dated Feb. 24, 1778, to be 
exchanged for British prisoners under parole to be returned by Col. Johonnott ; 
said Ross. Captain, to be exchanged for John Forsyth, Master of the brig 
" Nancy."

Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Jan. 8, 1777; Maj. Stevens s (Artillery)

co., Col. John Crane s (3d Artillery) regt.; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Dec. 20, 1776, to Dec. 31, 1780; reported as belonging to Eng 
land; also, descriptive list endorsed " 1777 to 1780 ;" Capt. John Lillie s co., 
Col. John Crane s (3d Artillery) regt. ; age, 63 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; com 
plexion, brown ; residence, Boston ; engaged for town of Boston ; engaged in 
1777 by Lieut. Tracy; term, during war: also, list of United States pensioners 
made up to Dec. 31, 1787, as returned by John Lucas, Commissary of Pensions ; 
Artillery regt. ; pensioned Sept. 1, 1782. 

Ross, ALEXANDER, Woburn (probably). Private, Capt. Joshua Walker s co., Col. 
David Greene s (2d Middlesex Co.) regt., which marched probably on the alarm 
of April 19, 1775 ; service, 7 days. 

Ross, ALEXANDER. Private, Capt. Joseph Fuller s co., Col. Samuel Bullard sregt. ;

Chief of Eastern Indian department ; entered service Sept. 12, 1779 ; discharged

service May 10, 1781 ; service to Oct. 18, 1781, 5 mos. 8 days ; reported deserted.

rated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to

the arrangement of April 9, 1770; Capt. Hastings s co. ; rank, Private; resi

ROUSEHORN, CHRISTIAN. Return signed "by Col. David Gushing and Selectmen of 
Hingham, of men raised by said town to serve in the Continental Army for 
3 years on the quota ordered to he raised for 9 months ; said Rousehom enlisted 
June -, 1778, into Col. Crane s ( Artillery ) t regt. ; also, return dated Hingham , 
June 28, 1779, signed by Joseph Thaxter, Jr., of men raised by said town 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years at the time the 
9 months levy was ordered in 1778; the men in question were raised over 
and above the one-seventh part of militia furnished as the town s quota of the 
Continental Army; said Rousehom enlisted into Col. Crane s regt. by Lieut. 
McLane. [See Christian Roushorn.] 

ROUSHA, JOHN. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship "Thorn," com 
manded by Capt. Richard Cowell, certified at Marblehead, Sept. 14, 1780, 
stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, dark. 

ROUSHORN, CHRISTIAN, Boston. List of men raised in Suffolk Co., agreeable to re 
solve of April 20, 1778, as returned by Stephen Badlam, Superintendent for 
said county, dated Dorchester; also, descriptive list of men raised by the town 
of Braintree to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, re 
turned as received of Maj. Stephen Badlam, Superintendent, by Capt. Thomas 
Jackson, of the artillery, at Boston, June 17, 1778, to be delivered to Gen. 
AVarner at Fishkill ; Capt. Wild s co., Col. Thayer s regt.; age, 23 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 63 in. ; hair, dark; eyes, gray; nationality, German; residence, 
Boston; Maj. Badlam certifies that the men borne on the descriptive list had 
enlisted into the artillery for 3 years although returned as 9 months men. [See 
Christian Rousehom.]

Langdon s co., Col. Jackson s regt.; term, during war; reported as belonging 
to France. 

ROUSSELLEE, " JALIER." Return of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster

ROUSTON, ANTHONY. Descriptive list of men detached from Boston regt. to serve

arrival at place of rendezvous, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, returned 
as received of Maj. Stephen Badlam, by Capt. Anthony Burk, at Roxbury, 
July 3, 1779, to be delivered to Justin Ely, Esq., at Springfield; age, 23 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 2^ (also given 5 ft. 2) in. ; hair, brown; eyes, gray; complexion, 
sandy ; reported detached from Capt. Kneeland s co. ; also, list of men returned

Commissioner, at Springfield, July 9, 1779, at the hands of Anthony Burk; 
also, list of men returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Lieut. 
Reuben Lilley, at Springfield, Aug. 15, 1779.

ROVARDIE, FERDINANDO. Deposition dated Dec. 2, 1779, signed by Thomas Drury,

ham to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, but said men 
entered Col. Grain s (Artillery) regt. for 3 years ; said Drury also declares of 
his personal knowledge that said men were in service at Rhode Island in 1778 
and that they continued in service during 1779, agreeable to statement made 
by Lieut. Dunells, of Capt. Allen s co., Col. Grain s regt. [See Ferdinando 
Revande.]

mandant, 8th Mass, regt., of officers of said regiment doing duty upon warrants ;

Island, Sept. 1, 1777 ; enlisted March 14, 1777 ; enlistment, 3 years ; reported

commissioned ; also, Captain, 15th (2d Richmond) co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s

be commissioned ; reported commissioned May 3 [ ? ] , 1776 ; commissions re 
ported dated June 1, 1776.

tenant, Capt. "William Greenleaf s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; entered

marched on an alarm at Bennington ; also. Captain, 1st co., Col. Josiah Whit 
ney s (2d Worcester Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers ; commissioned 
June 17, 1779.

HUPP, ADAM, continued. 

co. and regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Capt. Caleb Champ- 
ney s co. ; enlisted Feb. 3, 1779; discharged May 2, 1779; service, 3 mos., with 
guards under Maj. Gen. Gates at and about Boston; also, descriptive list of 
men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agree 
able to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commis 
sioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 17, 1780; age, 60 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, ruddy; engaged for town of Boston; marched 
to camp July 17, 1780, under command of Capt. Abner Howard ; also, Council 
order dated July 26, 1780, directing Col. Edward Proctor, of the Boston regt., 
to detach from said regiment two able-bodied men to serve in the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months in the room of said Rupp and Thomas Perkins, 
who had been sent forward as recruits but who had been rejected by Brig. Gen. 
John Glover, at Springfield; said Rupp reported as 62 years of age, deaf and 
very stiff in his limbs and joints ; also, Capt. Caleb Champney s co. of guards ; 
enlisted Aug. 22, 1780; discharged Nov. 1, 1780; service, 2 mos. 9 days; com 
pany detached from militia for service at and about Boston; also, same co. ;

Heath Detach t."

RUSSEL, STEPHEN. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., as returned by 
Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said county, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 
1780; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, light; hair, dark; eyes, 
gray ; occupation, farmer (also given laborer) ; engaged for town of Holliston ; 
engaged June 5, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

RUSSEL, STEPHEN. Private, 2d co., Col. Gideon Burt s (Hampshire Co.) regt.; en 
tered service June 12, 1782; service, 4 days; company marched to retake 
Samuel Ely who was rescued from Springfield jail June 12, 1782, and to oppose 
the rioters who assembled at Northampton June 16, 1782. 

RUSSEL, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Silas Fowler s co., Col. David Mosely s regt.; 
enlisted June 12, 1782 ; discharged June 17, 1782 ; service, 7 days, including 
2 days (28 miles) travel home ; company probably mounted and stationed at 
Springfield and Northampton for defence of the government. Roll sworn to at 
Westfield. 

RUSSEL, SYLVESTER. Private, Capt. Tompson J. Skinner s co., Col. Asa Banes s 
(Barnes s) Berkshire Co. regt. ; entered service Nov. 1, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 
10, 1781 ; service, 10 days ; company marched to Western frontiers by order of 
Gen. Stark on an alarm. 

RUSSEL, THADDEUS. List of men probably belonging to Capt. Richerson s (Rich 
ardson s) co. in June, 1775, appearing in an armorer s account. 

RUSSEL, THOMAS. Capt. Brown s co., Col. Mansfield s regt.; return of the main 
guard made by Abijah Brown, officer of the day, June 22, 1775; said Russel 
confined 1 night for abusing, cursing, and drawing his bayonet upon Samuel 

Russel. 

RUSSEL, URIAH, Andover. Private, Capt. Henry Abbot s co., which marched on 
the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 1| days ; reported returned home. 

RUSSEL, WILLIAM, Dartmouth. Private, Capt. Amasa Soper s co., Col. Thomas 
Marshall s regt. ; abstract for advance pay for 1 month, etc., sworn to at Boston, 
June 19, 1776; also, same co. and regt. ; service from Nov. 1, 1776, to Dec. 1, 
1776, 1 mo. 3 days, travel (60 miles) included. 

RUSSEL, WILLIAM, Salem. Cook, brigantine " General Wayne " (privateer), com 
manded by Capt. John Leech ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to 
June 17, 1780; age, 20 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 4 in.; complexion, dark; residence, 
Salem. 

RUSSEL, WILLIAM. Capt. Amos Upton s co. ; return for equipments made by Capt. 
Upton, dated Reading, April 21, 1775; John Flint reported Captain in room of 
said Upton ; also, list dated Reading, 2d Parish, May 15, 1775, of men who 
enlisted under Capt. Asa Prince, of Danvers, as returned by Capt. John Flint 
to Col. David Green, at Reading. 

RUSSEL, WILLIAM. 2d Lieutenant, brig " Rising Empire ; " list of officers of armed 
vessels ; commissioned June 22, 1776.

RUSSEL, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Hezekiah Green s co., Col. Barns s regt. ; entered 
service Oct. 13, 1781; service, 11 days; company marched from Windsor to 
Saratoga on an alarm at the Northward. 

RUSSEL, ZEPHAXIAH. Private, Capt. Benjamin Willcox s co., Col. Nathaniel Free 
man s regt.; enlisted Sept. 29, 1777: service, 1 mo., on a secret expedition to 
Rhode Island.
