ported as belonging to Squad No. 1. 

RUSSELL, ABEL, Watertown. Private, Capt. Stephen Dana s co., Col. Josiah Whit 
ney s regt. ; arrived at destination May 14, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 2 days, includ 
ing travel (6 days) to camp and from place of discharge home ; company raised 
to serve at Rhode Island for 2 months. Roll dated South Kingston. 

RUSSELL, ABEL, Westford. Private, Capt. John Minott s co., Col. Dike s regt.; 
muster roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777: enlisted Dec. 18, 1776: regiment raised 
to serve until March 1, 1777 ; also, descriptive list of men raised to serve in the 
Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778 ; 8th co., Col. Brooks s 
regt. ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; residence, Westford ; engaged for town 
of Westford. 

RUSSELL, ABNER, Springfield. Private, Capt. Gideon Burt s co., Col. Timothy Dan- 
ielson s regt. ; company return dated Roxbury Camp, Oct. 6, 1775 : also, order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Dec. 22, 1775: also, list of 
men raised in Hampshire Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of their 
arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778 ; residence, Springfield ; 
engaged for town of Springfield ; arrived at Fishkill July 14, 1778. 

RUSSELL, ABXER. Private, Capt. Joseph Fuller s co., Col. Samuel Bullard s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 20, 1777 : discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 22 days, at the 
Northward, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home. Roll sworn to in Mid 
dlesex Co. 

RUSSELL, ABSALOM. Surgeon s Mate, Col. Ephraim Doolittle s (24th) regt. : engaged 
June 21, 1775 ; service, 1 mo. 13 days ; also, list of surgeons and surgeons mates 
examined and approved by a committee appointed for that purpose, dated July 
7, 1775 ; said Russell reported as Surgeon s Mate to Surgeon Enoch Dole, of 
Col. Doolittle s regt. 

RUSSELL, AMASA. Private, Capt. Isaac Newton s co., Col. S. Murray s regt. : enlisted 
July 13, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 7 days, including 9 days 
(172 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Hampshire Co. to reinforce Conti 
nental Army for 3 months. 

RUSSELL, AMOS, Lexington. Capt. Benjamin Walker s co., Col. Ebenezer Bridge s 
(27th) regt. ; order for advance pay, signed by said Russell and others, dated 
Camp at Cambridge, June 6, 1775; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; company 
return, [probably Oct., 1775]: also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Cambridge, Nov. 30, 1775 ; also, Private, Capt. Edmund Munro s 
co., Col. Timothy Bigelow s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from March 20, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, same co. and regt. : return dated

ter: enlistment, 3 years; also, (late) Capt. Munro s co.. Col. Bigelow s regt.; 
payrolls for Feb., March, and April, 1779, dated Providence : also, Capt. Bow 
man s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from. 
Jan. 1, 1780, to March 20, 1780.

1st co., Col. Bailey s regt.; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
March 1, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported as having taken the place of Asa 
Heald; also, Capt. Hugh Maxwell s (1st) co., Col. John Bailey s regt. ; return 
of men who joined before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been absent subse 
quently except on furlough, etc. ; also, Capt. Thomas [Robert] Bradford s co., 
Col. Bailey s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to May 26, 1780; residence, Townsend.

agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780 ; engaged for town of Boston ; engaged July 
21, 1781.

service, 3 mos. 18 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]. 

RUSSELL, ASA. Capt. Isaac Powers s co., Col. Elisha Porter s regt. ; enlisted July

miles) home ; roll made up for a part of Capt. Powers s co., which marched to 
join Northern army under Gen. Schuyler on an alarm ; Capt. Powers reported 
as of Greenwich.

1775]. 

RUSSELL, BARNABAS. List of men mustered May 15 [year not given], by Thomas 
Newhall, Muster Master ; also, certificate dated Petersham, May 23, 1778, signed 
by Capt. Asa How and Capt. Wing Spooner, stating that said Russell and others 
had been engaged and mustered to serve in the Continental Army for the term

arrived at Fishkill June 18, 1778.

12, 1782, 4 rnos. 20 days.

Feb. 9, 1778; mustered by John Gushing, Esq.

RUSSELL, ELISHA. Private, Capt. Benjamin Willcox s co., which marched from 
Dartmouth to Rowland s Ferry, R. I., Dec. 8, 1776, on an alarm to repel the 
British forces that arrived at Newport Dec. 7, 1776; service, 20 days. 

RUSSELL, EPHRAIM, Groton. Private, Capt. Henry Farwell s co. of Minute-men, 
Col. William Prescott s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 6 days ; also, Capt. Henry Farwell s co., Col. William Prescott s regt. ; 
muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 25, 1775; service, 98 days; also,

Farwell s co., Col. Prescott s regt.

Reed s regt.; engaged Oct. 1, 1777; discharged Nov. 8, 1777; service, 1 mo. 8 
days, with Northern army ; company marched from Stow to join army under 
Gen. Gates.

regt. ; engaged Aug 1, 1777 ; service, 2 mos., at Rhode Island ; roll sworn to at 
Groton; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated North Kingston, Dec. 18, 
1777 ; term, 6 months, to expire Jan. 1, 1778.

tosh s regt., Gen. Lovel s brigade ; engaged July 30, 1778 ; discharged Sept. 12,

(80 miles) travel home. 

RUSSELL, GEORGE. List of men raised in Essex Co. for the term of 9 months from 
the time of their arrival at Fishkill, returned as received of Jonathan Warner, 
Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778 ; engaged for town of Rowley ; 
arrived at Fishkill June 15, 1778. 

RUSSELL, HENRY, Jr. Certificate dated Ipswich, Jan. 18, 1779, signed by Col. 
Nathaniel Wade, certifying that said Russell and others served in Capt. Simon 
(Simeon) Brown s co., Col. Wade s regt., at Providence until Jan. 1, 1779, to 
the credit of the town of Ipswich, agreeable to resolve of June 10, 1778. 

RUSSELL, HEZEKIAH, Windsor. Private, Capt. John Wright s co., Col. David Brew 
er s (9th) regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775]. 

RUSSELL, HEZEKIAH. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Oliver Lyman s 3d (3d Northampton) 
co., 2d Hampshire Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen by the 
several companies in said regiment, as returned by Seth Pomeroy and others, 
field officers, dated Northampton, March 22, 1776; ordered in Council April 8, 
1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned April 5, 1776 ; 
also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Jonathan Wailes s (Wales s) co., Col. Ezra May s 
regt. ; engaged Sept. 22, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 15, 1777 ; service, 28 days, on 
expedition to Stillwater and Saratoga, including travel (111 miles) home ; also, 
Captain, 2d co. of volunteers, 2d Hampshire Co. regt.; service against the 
insurgents at Springfield, June 12, at Hadley, June 13, and at Northampton, 
May 6, June 15, 16, and 17, 1782, 6 days, by order of Elisha Porter, Sheriff.

RUSSELL, STEPHEN, Danvers. Private, Capt. Enoch Putnam s co., Col. John Mans 
field s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 4, 1775 ; service, 3 
mos. 5 days; also, Capt. Putnam s co., Col. Israel Hutehmson s (19th) regt.; 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Winter Hill. 
Oct. 27, 1775. 

RUSSELL, STEPHEN, Dracut. Captain of a company of militia, Col. Green s regt., 
which inarched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 9 days ; also, Captain, 
Col. Samuel Bullard s regt., Gen. Warner s brigade; engaged Aug. 14, 1777; 
discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 29 days, at the Northward, including 
12 days (240 miles) travel home ; also, abstract of retained rations due officers 
and men belonging to Col. Samuel Bullard s regt. ; rations due said Russell 
from Aug. 14, 1777, to Dec. 11, 1777; also, returns, etc., of 2d Dracut co. ; list 
of persons who hired men to serve 9 months in the Continental Army, agree 
able to resolves passed in April, 1778; said Russell, Captain, reported as hav 
ing been paid 20 to hire part of the 9 months men. 

RUSSELL, STEPHEN, Middleborough. List of men mustered by James Hatch, Mus 
ter Master for Plymouth Co., to serve in the Continental Army for the term 
of 8 months, dated April 28, 1778 ; residence, Middleborough ; engaged for town 
of Middleborough; joined Capt. Wadsworth s co., Col. Bradford s regt. ; term 
to expire Jan. 10, 1778. 

RUSSELL, STEPHEN, Springfield. Private, Capt. Gideon Burt s co., Col. Timothy 
Danielson s regt. ; company return dated Roxbury, Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for 
bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Dec. 22, 1775. 

RUSSELL, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Job Peirce s co., Col. Theophilus Cotton s

RUSSELL, STEPHEN. Receipt dated Holliston, June 9, 1781, for bounties paid said 
Russell and others by a committee of i the town of Holliston to serve in the 
Continental Army for the term of 3 years; also, Private, Capt. John K. 
Smith s (3d) co. (formerly Capt. Peter Clayes s co.) , Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s 
(6th) regt. ; returns for wages for the years 1781 and 1782 ; wages allowed said 
Russell from April 18, 1781, to Dec. 31, 1782, 20 mos. 13 days; reported absent 
on command in March, 1782 ; also, order on Paymaster of 6th Mass, regt., dated 
Ashford, March 12, 1782, signed by said Russell, for wages for service in 6th 
Mass, regt.; also, discharge dated Dec. 24, 1783, signed by Maj. Gen. Knox, 
granting an honorable discharge to said Russell, he having served 3 years in 2d 
Mass. regt. 

RUSSELL, THADDEUS, Sudbury. Lieutenant, Capt. Nathaniel Cudworth s co. of Min

de-Camp to Gen. Stark from Dec. 1, 1779, to Oct. 20, 1780.

this service be properly recognized.

RUST, HENRY. Return showing number of prisoners, comprising officers and crews

Oct. 6, 1775; reported with Col. Arnold.

RUST, JOHN. Boy, ship " Protector," commanded by Capt. John Foster Williams;

wages, etc. 

RUST, JUSTIN. Private, Capt. John Carpenter s co. of guards ; joined at Springfield

from time of joining and stationed at Springfield ; also, same co. ; enlisted Aug. 
30, 1780; discharged Jan. 30, 1781 ; service, 5 mos. ; company raised in 1780 to 
serve for 8 months and stationed at Springfield.

subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, March 13, 1777, to date of march 
ing to Bennington, April 8, 1777 ; credited with 39 days subsistence, including 
allowance for 240 miles travel on march to Bennington ; also, Private, Capt. 
Samuel Page s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; return dated Jan. 25, 1778; 
residence, Marblehead ; enlisted for town of Marblehead ; mustered by Esq. 
Gushing, County Muster Master ; reported deserted. 

RYAN, JOHN. Private, Capt. Caleb Turner s co. ; entered service March 26, 1776; 
service to Sept. 10, 1776, 5 mos. 15 days, in defence of seacoast ; rolls dated 
Bristol; also, same co. ; service from Sept. 10, 1776, to Dec. 7, 1776, 2 mos. 27 
days ; company stationed at Boothbay. 

RYAN, JOHN. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk

RYAN. JOHN. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army [year not given] ;

RYAN, MATTHEW. Return of sentences by a general court-martial, Brig. St. Clair, 
President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Oct. 
16, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Ryan, Lieu 
tenant, charged with deserting his post on Onion river without being attacked 
or forced by the enemy; found guilty and sentenced to be cashiered, to forfeit 
all his pay, and declared incapable of ever holding any military commission in 
the service of the United States. [Name appears as Matthew Lyon in the same 
general order.] 

RYAN, MICHAEL. Receipt given to Benjamin Heywood, Paymaster, 4th regt., signed 
by said Ryan and others belonging to Capt. McFarland s co., for wages, etc., 
due prior to Jan. 1, 1776.

Major of the regiments to be commanded by Col. Anthony Wayne, which were 
to complete the garrison at Ticonderoga and Mt. Independence. 

RYAN, MICHAEL. Corporal, Capt. Benjamin Plunier s co. ; entered service March 
5, 1776 ; discharged Dec. 10, 1776 ; company stationed at St. Georges for defence 
of seacoast. 

RYAN, RICHARD, Boston. Private and Drummer, Capt. Mills s co., Col. Vose s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Feb. 28, 
1779; reported deserted but returned and was discharged Jan. 7, 1783, as per 
certificate of J. Lucas, Commissary of Pensions; also, Drummer, Capt. Abra 
ham Tuckerman s co., Col. Joseph Vose s regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1777, 
sworn to at Camp near Valley Forge ; appointed March 10, 1777 ; term, during 
war; reported sick in general hospital; also,, Drum Major, same regt.; regi 
mental pay abstracts for Sept. and Nov., 1778, approved at Providence; also, 
certificate dated Boston, Sept. 25, 1780, signed by John Rice, Town Major, 
certifying that said Ryan, with others, had been apprehended by Ensign Edward 
Phelon as deserters and placed in jail ; Col. Vose s regt. ; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 3 in. ; complexion, light; occupation, mariner; also, list of deserters from

yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, brown ; birthplace, England ; 
also, Drummer, Capt. Francis Green s co., Col. Vose s regt.; muster roll for 
July, 1781 ; joined from desertion Jiily 1, 1781 ; also, muster rolls for Aug. and

States pensioners made up to Dec. 31, 1787, as returned by John Lucas, Com 
missary of Pensions ; 1st Mass. regt. ; age, 26 yrs. ; residence, Boston ; reported 
disabled by a rupture ; pensioned Jan. 10, 1783 ; also reported discharged Sept. 
23, 1786, at his own request.

from home July 8, 1779; discharged Sept. 25, 1779; service, 2 mos. 17 days, 
with Col. Jonathan Mitchell s detachment; company raised in Cumberland 
Co. for service on Penobscot expedition ; roll sworn to at North Yarmouth ; 
also, Capt. Merrill s co., Col. Jonathan MitchePs detachment; pay abstract 
for mileage, sworn to at North Yarmouth, Nov. 3, 1779; mileage for 25 miles 
allowed said Ryon ; reported as having first drawn rations at Falmouth and as 
discharged at Falmouth. 

RYON, FRANCIS, Falmouth. Sergeant, Capt. White s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 
1779 : also, Capt. George White s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; subsistence 
allowed from date of enlistment, Dec. 13, 1776, to time of arrival at Bennington ; 
credited with 99^ days allowance ; 368 miles travel allowed said Ryon ; also, 
Capt. White s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt.; return dated Jan. -, 1778; 
mustered by County Muster Master Ilsley and Col. Varrick, Continental Mus 
ter Master: also, same co. and regt.; muster roll for March, 1779, dated West 
Point ; enlistment, 3 years. 

RYON, FRANCIS. Sergeant, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from June 
18, 1781, 6 mos. 12 clays ; reported reduced to Private Oct. 1, 1781 ; also, Private, 
same regt. ; service from Jan. 1, 1782, 12 mos. ; reported promoted to Sergeant 
March 22, 1782. 

RYON, JAMES, Gorham (also given Windham) . Private, Capt. Mayberry s co., Col.

from Jan. 1, 1777, to July 7, 1777; residence, Gorham; reported taken prisoner 
July 7, 1777 ; also, Capt. Richard Maybery s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; 
subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, Jan. 5, 1777, to time of arrival at 
Bennington ; credited with 75 days allowance ; 346 miles travel allowed said 
Ryon: also, Capt. Mayberry s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; return dated 
Jan 25, 1778 ; residence, Windham ; engaged for town of Windham ; mustered

Israel Thorndike who was absent at sea, the schooner being fitted out for a 

4 months cruise and intended to join the fleet under Capt. Manley ; ordered in 
Council April 30, 1777, that a commission be issued.

Northward.

Robinson ; descriptive list of officers and crew, dated Aug. 2, 1780 ; age, 16 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. ; complexion, black; residence, Boston.

regt.; enlisted Aug. 1, 1778; service, 4 mos., at Rhode Island; reported dis

SACKET, ASHER. Private, Capt. Daniel Sacket s co., Col. John Mosley s (Hamp 
shire Co.) regt.; enlisted Oct. 21, 1776; returned Nov. 17, 1776; service, 28 
days ; company marched under command of Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson to 
reinforce Northern army. Roll dated Westfield. 

SACKET, DANIEL. Captain, 7th co., Col. John Mosely s (3d Hampshire Co.) regt. 
of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen by the several companies in said regi 
ment, endorsed "April 26 1776; " reported commissioned April 26, 1776; also, 
Captain, Col. John Mosley s (Hampshire Co.) regt.; engaged Oct. 21, 1776; 
returned Nov. 17, 1776; service, 28 days; company marched to Ticonderoga 
Oct. 21, 1776, under command of Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson to reinforce 
Northern army by order of Gen. Schuyler; roll dated Westfield ; also, Captain, 
Col. Benjamin Ruggles Woodbridge s regt. ; engaged Aug. 18, 1777 ; discharged 
Nov. 29, 1777; service, 3 mos. 20 days, in Northern department, including 
8 days (152 miles) travel home ; also, same regt. ; pay abstract of officers for 
rations, dated Camp at Scarsdale, Dec. 7, 1777 ; rations allowed said Sacket 
from Aug. 25, 1777, to Nov. 29, 1777; credited with 206 rations; also, same 
regt. ; pay abstract for mileage home ; warrant allowed in Council July 9, 1778 ; 
also, resignation dated Westfield, Nov. 17, 1779, signed by said Sacket, resign 
ing his commission as Captain, 7th co., Col. John Mosely s (3d Hampshire Co.) 
regt., on the ground that he was unable to give the proper time and attention 
to the duties of his office ; ordered in Council Nov. 24, 1779, that the resignation 
be accepted.

(9th) regt. ; company return dated Oct. 7, 1775.

given 3 mos. 10) days, in Northern department.

lows on an alarm at the Northward.

by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 13, 1780; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 2 in. ; complexion, light; engaged for town of Marlborough; marched to 
camp July 13, 1780, under command of Capt. Thomas Pritchard. - 

SALE, EPHRAIM, Chelsea. List of men raised for the 6 months service and returned 
by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of 
Chelsea for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; passed muster at 
Springfield July 16, 1780; discharged Jan. 16, 1781; service, 6 mos. 18 days, 
including 8 days travel to Springfield and 10 days travel home from place of 
discharge, West Point.

SALSBURY, SAMUEL. Lieutenant, Capt. Enos Parker s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
regt. ; engaged Sept. 3, 1777; discharged Sept. 27, 1777; service, 27 days; regi 
ment detached from Berkshire Co. militia to reinforce Continental Army at 
Bennington.

SALT, VINCENT, Boston. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, as

cers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts.,

were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry Jackson,

ton; engaged June 3, 1777; term, 3 years; said Salt appears among men be

prior to above arrangement ; reported deserted Oct. 27, 1777.

SALTONSTALL, . Deposition sworn to Nov. 11, 1779, signed by Thomas Wait Fos

dentally referring to said Saltonstall, Captain, as having applied to him for 
wads for Col. Revere, and later as having directed him to supply grape shot to 
Col. Revere.

to Kingston from March 2 to March 15, 1783 ; reported overstayed 1 day ; leave 
also given said Sampson May 20, 1783, by Gen. Washington to go from Wind 
sor for 60 days; also, returns of effectives, dated May 23, and May 30, 1783; 
reported on furlough in Massachusetts from May 20, 1783; also, return of 
effectives, dated June 13, 1783; reported retired on furlough by leave of Gen. 
Washington.

IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 763 

SAMPSON, SIMEON. Commander of an armed brig ; list of officers of the State Navy ; 
commissioned June 1, 1776; also, Commander of the brigantine "Hazard;" 
list of officers of the State Navy; commissioned Nov. 15, 1777; also, official 
record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated June 16, 1779 ; said 
Sampson chosen Commander of the ship " Protector " being built at Newbury- 
port for the state of Massachusetts ; appointment concurred in by Council June 
22, 1779. 

SAMPSON, SOUTHARD. Capt. George Lewis s co., Col. Freeman s regt. ; service, 8 
days, on the alarm at Bedford, Dartmouth, and Falmouth, Sept. 6, 1778. 

SAMPSON, STEPHEN, Georgetown. Private, Capt. Samuel McCobb s co. of Minute- 
men ; service, 7 days, probably on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; enlisted April 
24, 1775. 

SAMPSON, STEPHEN. Receipt given to Capt. William Hudson Ballard, dated Aug. 
12, 1775, signed by said Sampson, a soldier in Col. James Frye s regt., for 2 
advance pay for 1 month. 

SAMPSON, STEPHEN. List of prisoners sent in the cartel " Swift " from Halifax to 
Boston Sept. 30, 1778, as returned by Thomas Baildon, Commissary of Prison 
ers ; reported a Seaman. 

SAMPSON, STUDLEY, Duxbury. Sailor, brigantine "Dolphin," commanded by Capt. 
David Ingersoll ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to May 25, 1780 ; 
age, 22 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, dark; residence, Duxbury; said 
Sampson rated 1 share. 

SAMPSON, THOMAS. Subaltern, Capt. John Bradford s co. ; list of officers of Col. 
Cotton s regt. stationed at Roxbury ; resolved in Provincial Congress May 26, 
1775, that said officers be commissioned. 

SAMPSON, WILLIAM, Barnstable. Fifer, Capt. Micah Hamlen s co., Col. Thomas 
Marshall s regt. ; enlisted June 6, 1776; service to Aug. 1, 1776, 1 mo. 26 days; 
roll dated Castle Island ; also, Capt. George Lewis s co., Col. Freeman s regt. ; 
service, 2 days, on the alarm at Dartmouth, Bedford, and Falmouth, Sept. 6, 
1778; also, Capt. Nathaniel Lothrop s co., Col. Freeman s regt.; service, 2 
days, probably in Nov., 1778, guarding prisoners belonging to [British] ship 
" Somerset " from Barnstable to Plymouth ; roll dated Barnstable, Nov. 9, 1778. 

SAMPSON, WILLIAM, Gloucester. Private, Capt. Samuel Sprague s (9th) co., Lieut. 
Col. Loammi Baldwin s (late Col. Samuel Gerrish s) 37th (also given 38th) 
regt. : pay abstract for Aug., 1775, dated Chelsea; also, company return dated 
Chelsea, Oct. 2, 1775. 

SAMPSON, WILLIAM, Plympton. List of men raised for the 6 months service and 
returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. 

SAMPSON, WILLIAM, Shirley. Private, Capt. Henry Haskell sco., Col. James Pres- 
cott s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 7 days; 
reported enlisted into the army April 26, 1775 ; also, order dated Camp at Cam 
bridge, June 19, 1775, signed by Capt. Robert Longley, for cartridge boxes, of 
which said Sampson and others in his company, Col. Whitcomb s regt., were 
in need and for which said Longley promised to be accountable; also, list of

SAMS, . [This name also appears under the form of Salms, Sam, Sames, Samrns,

SAMS, CATO. Private, Capt. William Spinney s co., Col. Cogswell s regt. ; entered 
service Oct. 8, 1778 ; discharged Dec. 31, 1778 ; service, 2 mos. 28 days, including 
travel (80 miles) home ; company detached to guard and fortify port of Boston. 

SAMS, EDWARD, Kittery. Capt. Samuel Leighton s co. ; pay abstract for mileage 
from home to Dorchester Heights in Aug., 1776 ; mileage for 85 miles allowed 
said Sams; also, Private, Capt. Samuel Grant s co., Col. Titcomb s regt. ; ser 
vice, 2 mos. 12 days, including travel (248 miles) to and from camp at Rhode 
Island; warrant for pay allowed in Council July 21, 1777; also, pay roll for 
6 months men raised by the town of Kittery for service in the Continental Army 
during 1780; inarched July 19, 1780; discharged Dec. 4, 1780; service, 5 mos. ; 
also, Capt. Sylvanus Smith s co., Col. Timothy Bigelow s (15th) regt. ; muster 
rolls for Aug., Sept., and Oct., 1780 ; enlisted Aug., 4, 1780 ; enlistment, 6 months ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Nov. and Dec., 1780, dated Garrison 
West Point; reported discharged Dec. 4, 1780; also, receipt dated Berwick, 
Dec. 20, 1781, signed by Ichabod Goodwin, Superintendent, stating that he had 
received said Sams, a soldier raised agreeable to resolve of Oct. 24, 1781, by the 
class of the town of Kittery of which Capt. William Holbrook was Chairman, 
and ordered him to march to Boston. 

SAMS, JAMES. Return of men belonging to the State regiment of artillery entitled 
to an additional bounty of 15, as returned by Col. T. Crafts, dated Boston, 
Jan. 12, 1778; Capt. Balch s (1st) co. ; also, Matross, Capt. Warner s co., Col. 
Revere s (Artillery) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Dec. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, (late) Capt. Jonathan Warner s (3d) co., 
corps of artillery formerly commanded by Lieut. Col. Paul Revere ; service 
between Jan. 1, 1780, and May 8, 1780, 2 mos. 17 days ; also, descriptive list 
dated Camp New Windsor, Jan. 12, 1780 [81] ; Capt. Thomas Seward s co., 3d 
Artillery regt. ; rank, Matross ; age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, 
light; engaged March 23, 1780, by Capt. Seward; term, during war; reported 
received State and Continental bounties.

(6th) regt. ; return for wages for the year 1781 ; wages allowed said Samsdill 
for 12 months. [See Saul Ramsdell.]

(Plymouth Co.) regt. ; enlisted March 5, 1781 ; discharged March 20, 1781 ; ser

SAMSON, BARNABAS, Middlehorough. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Wood s co., Col. 
Simon Gary s regt. ; service, 6 days ; roll dated Roxbury, April 1, 1776 ; also, 
Capt. Joshua White s co., Col. John Cushing s regt.; drafted Sept. 20, 1776; 
service, 60 days, at Rhode Island ; roll dated Newport ; also, 2d Middleborough 
co. commanded by Lieut. John Barrows, Col. Ebenezer Sprout s regt. ; service, 
12 days; company marched from Middleborough to Rowland s Ferry, R. I.,

Cotten s regt. ; service, 31 days, on a secret expedition to Rhode Island in 
Sept. and Oct., 1777; also, Capt. Aimer Bourn s co., Col. Ebenezer White s 
regt.; marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; com 
pany inarched to Rhode Island on the alarm of Aug. 1, 1780. 

SAMSON, BENJAMIN, Bridgewater. Private, Capt. Nathan Mitchell s co. of Minute- 
men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 11 days; also, 
Capt. James Allen s co., Col. John Bailey s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 
1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 3 mos., 1 week, 1 day; also, Capt. Allen s 
co., Gen. John Thomas s regt. ; company return dated Roxbury, Oct. 6, 1775; 
also, certificate dated Roxbury, Dec. 22, 1775, signed by Capt. Allen, certifying 
that said Samson, a soldier in his company, Col. Bayley s regt., was entitled 
to a bounty coat. 

SAMSON, BENJAMIN, Kingston. Private, Capt. Joseph Stetson s co., Col. Dyke s 
regt. ; pay abstract for rations to and from camp and travel allowance home, 
dated Boston, Nov. -, 1776, and endorsed "Regiment at Dochester Height; " 
76 miles travel allowed said Samson.

Gerrish s regt. ; order for advance pay, signed by said Samson and others,

regt. ; return of the sick and absent, dated Medford, Aug. 10, 1775 ; also, same 
co. ; return of casualties of the several companies in the 38th regt. made by 
Lieut. Col. Loammi Baldwin, dated Chelsea, Sept. -, 1775 ; said Samson re 
ported sick, absent 42 days by permission of the Captain ; also, Private, Capt. 
Wood s co., Lieut. Col. Baldwin s (late Col. Gerrish s) 38th regt. ; abstract for 
wages for Sept., 1775: receipt for amount of above abstract, dated Chelsea, 
Oct. 30, 1775, and signed by Capt. Wood ; also, company return [probably Oct., 
1775] ; also, list of men belonging to Capt. Wood s co. who declined to serve 
the month of Jan. [1776], endorsed "Medford Dec br ye 22 1775." 

SAMSON, BENJAMIN. Private, Capt. Jesse Sturtevant s co., Col. John Jacobs s regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 12, 1780; discharged Nov. 1, 1780; service, 1 mo. 18 days; regi 
ment detached from militia to reinforce Continental Army at Rhode Island for 
3 months.

SAMSOX, SIMEON, Plymouth. Captain, brigantine "Independence," at Kingston; 
list of officers of armed vessels; commissioned April 17, 1776; also, Captain, 
same vessel; engaged April 17, 1776; service to Sept. 22, 1776, 5 mos. 5 days; 
also, Captain, same vessel; engaged Sept. 23, 1776: service to Jan. 1, 1777, 3 
mos. 8 days; also, Captain, same vessel ; engaged Jan. 1, 1777; service to July 
5, 1777, 6 mos. 5 days ; also, list of prisoners sent from port of Halifax by order 
of Sir George Collier June 28, 1777, to be exchanged for British prisoners, as 
returned by John Emerson, Commissary; said Samson, Captain, reported as 
having been taken in the privateer " Independence ; " also, official record of a 
ballet by the House of Representatives, dated Aug. 9, 1777 ; said Samson chosen 
Commander of an armed vessel in process of building for the State ; appoint 
ment concurred in by Council Aug. 9, 1777; also, Captain, brigantine "Haz 
ard ; " engaged Aug. 15, 1777 ; discharged May 20, 1778 ; service, 9 mos. 5 days ; 
also, Captain; memorandum of shoes taken from the prize ship "Live Oak" 
and delivered to officers and men belonging to the brigantine " Hazard " [year 
not given] ; also, resignation dated Boston, June 10, 1778, signed by said Sam 
son, resigning the command of his vessel, upon the advice of his physicians 
and friends, because of the state of his health, he having had for a long time 
symptoms of a threatening disorder which were increased by a rigorous con 
finement with the enemy; resignation accepted in Council June 11, 1778; also, 
petition signed by officers of the ship "Mars," commanded by said Samson, 
intended to call at a port in France during her cruise, complaining of the rat 
ing of prize shares as established by the Council, and requesting that the same 
be altered in order that the vessel might be manned effectively ; referred to a 
committee in Council July 6, 1780, and their report allowing to the seamen of 
the "Mars" one-half of all prizes captured was accepted July 7, 1780; also, 
Commander, ship "Mars:" list of officers of the State Navy: commissioned 
July 21, 1780 ; also, Captain, ship " Mars ; " engaged May 11, 1780 ; discharged 
March 12, 1781 ; service, 10 mos. 1 day : reported as having received wages on 
account in France; also reported as entitled to share in the brig " Tryall" if 
made a prize.

1775; service to Dec. 31, 1775, in defence of seacoast ; roll sworn to at Barn- 
stable ; also, order on David Jeffries, Paymaster, payable to Lieut. Matthias 
Tobey, dated Boston, June 16, 1776, signed by said Samson and others belonging 
to Capt. Micah Hamlen s co., Col. Thomas Marshal s regt., for advance pay for 
1 month, etc. ; also, Fifer, Capt. Hamlen s co., Col. Marshall s regt. ; abstract 
for advance pay for 1 month, etc., dated Boston, June 15, 1776; also, same co. 
and regt.; service from Aug. 1, 1776, to Nov. 1, 1776, 3 mos.: also, same co. 
and regt.; pay roll for Nov., 1776; also, Private, Capt. Elislia Hedge s co. ; 
marched Sept. 13,1779; discharged Sept. 18,1779; service, 5 days ; company 
detached from militia for service at Falmouth on an alarm.

against Majorbagaduce in 1779 and was unable to recover the same.

Army from 1st, 2d, 3d, and 8th cos., 1st Hampshire Co. regt., as returned by

for town of Springfield ; joined Capt. Charles Colton s co., Col. Greaton s regt. ; 
term, 3 years, to expire Jan. -, 1780; reported as belonging to 1st co. ; also, 
Private, (late) Capt. Colton s co., Col. John Graton s (2d) regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, same 
co. and regt. ; retiirn [year not given] ; mustered by County Muster Master 
Woodbridge; also, Capt. Joseph Williams s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Grea 
ton s (3d) regt. ; muster roll for Oct. and Nov., 1779; also, Capt. Job Simmer s 
co., Col. John Greaton s regt.; muster roll for Oct., 1780; enlisted July 11, 
1780; enlistment, 6 months; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the

(120 miles) home [see Hamasiah Sanders] ; also, Private, Capt. Abel King s 
co., Col. Sears s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 20, 1781 ; service to Nov. 20, 1781, 3 mos., 
at Saratoga.

30 days expedition.

town of Ipswich for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched 
Sept. 18, 1780 ; discharged April 1, 1781 ; service, 6 mos. 25 days, including 
travel (240 miles) home.

tioned at Hull, asking for increase and payment of wages.

SARGEANT, PAUL DUDLEY. Report of a committee of the Council appointed to 
consider the matter of the appointment by Gen. Washington of said Sargeant 
as Colonel, stating that if said Sargeant has filled up his regiment agreeable to 
the suggestion of the committee of the Provincial Congress June 22, 1775, he 



812 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

SARGEANT, PAUL DUDLEY, continued. 

and his officers should receive commissions to date from time of entering ser 
vice ; report read and accepted in Council Sept. 11, 1775, and ordered that said 
Sargeant and officers of his regiment be recommended to Gen. Washington for 
commissions ; also, account showing sums of money to be paid from the public 
treasury to sundry persons for losses sustained at battles of Lexington and 
Bunker Hill ; amounts allowed in Council June 27, 1776.

marched April 19, and April 20, 1775, to Medford and Cambridge, under com 
mand of Capt. Caleb Pilsberry; service, 4 days. 

SARGENT, PAUL DUDLEY, Amherst, N. H. Petition addressed to the Provincial Con 
gress, at Watertown, dated June 17, 1775, signed by said Sargent, stating that 
upon the alarm of April 19, 1775, while at Amherst, N. H., he had raised 109 men 
and inarched with them to Concord, and was there chosen by the officers of 
seven companies from Hillsborough Co., N. H., as their commanding officer; 
that on April 21, 1775, he was ordered by Gen. Ward to march to Cambridge 
with the troops then at Concord ; that on April 25, 1775, he had received orders 
from the Committee of Safety for raising a regiment, which if not taken into 
the service of New Hampshire was to be in the pay of Massachusetts until dis 
charged : that on May 25, 1775, he had nine companies completed, three of 
which had been in camp continuously from April 1, 1775 ; that finding he could 
not be taken into the service of New Hampshire, he had made application to 
the Committee of Safety for a commission, who had referred him to the Pro 
vincial Congress ; and requesting that his case might be acted upon and that 
he and his men might be placed under a proper establishment or discharged ; 
also, Colonel, 16th regt.; engaged April 20, 1775; service to July 31, 1775, 3 



818 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

SARGENT, PAUL DUDLEY, continued. 

mos. 18 days; roll dated Boston; also, Colonel, 28th regt. ; list of officers [year 
not given, probably 1775] ; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Repre 
sentatives, dated Sept. 26, 1778; said Sargent chosen Colonel, 1st Essex Co. 
regt. of Mass, militia; appointment concurred in by Council Sept. 2(5, 1778; 
also, commission dated Boston, Sept. 26, 1778, appointing said Sargent Colonel 
of 1st Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; also, communication addressed to the 
General Court, dated Salem, June 5, 1779, signed by said Sargent, resigning his 
commission as Colonel of 1st Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia on account of per 
sonal affairs obliging him to leave the State for a time ; resignation accepted 
by resolve of June 8, 1779.

SARGENT, SAMUEL. Petition addressed to the General Court, dated Leicester, March 
19, 1779, signed by said Sargent and Baly Bond, stating that they had marched 
to Koxbury with Capt. Herrington to serve for the term of 3 months, but as it 
became known that both of them had previously had the smallpox, they were 
drafted out of Capt. Herrington s co. and sent in to Boston to do duty there, 
but had never received pay for their services owing to the fact that they were 
not made up in any muster roll because of the transfer from one company to 
another referred to above, and requesting that their wages might be allowed 
them. 

SARGENT, SAMUEL, Jr. Return of men raised in Suffolk Co. for Continental service, 
agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780; engaged for town of Chelsea; engaged 
April 19, 1781 ; term, 3 years.

cott and Lieut. Col. John Robinson, asking that certain officers belonging to 
Col. Prescott s (10th) regt. who had served as commissioned officers from the

in Council Oct. 31, 1775, that said officers be recommended to Gen. Washing

Sandisfield; engaged for town of Sandisfield; mustered by Capt. Wheeler; re 
ported mustered oiit by Col. Varrick. 

SAVAGE, JOEL, Sandisfield. List of men raised for the 6 months service and returned 
by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Sandis 
field for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp July 
2, 1780; discharged Dec. 18, 1780; service, 5 mos. 20 days, including travel (75 
miles) home. 

SAVAGE, JOHN, Beverly. Seaman, ship "Resource," commanded by Capt. Richard 
Ober ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to Sept. 11, 1780 ; age, 18 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 2 in. ; complexion, light ; residence, Beverly.

commissioned; reported commissioned Jan. 30, 1777; also, 2d Lieutenant, 
Capt. Wallcut s co., Col. Marshall s regt.; subsistence allowed from date of 
engagement, Dec. 3, 1776, to Feb. 5, 1777; credited with 65 days allowance; 
subsistence also allowed for 11 days (220 miles) travel on march from Boston 
to Bennington ; residence, " near Concord."

SAVELL, EDWARD BRIDGE, continued. 

ham to Braintree March 22, 177(5; also, petition dated Stoughtonham, Nov. 2, 
1778, signed by said Savell, stating that he had served as Captain of the 1st co. 
of militia in the town of Stoughtonham for nearly seven years, hut as a number 
of men belonging to the 2d co. had been set off with others to the town of Fox- 
borough, and it was desirable that all the militia of Stoughtonham should be 
incorporated into one company and authorized to choose their officers, request 
ing that his resignation might be accepted ; ordered in Council Nov. 6, .1778, 
that the resignation be accepted.

miles ; service at 20 miles per day, 9 days ; company marched on an alarm at 
Bennington Aug. 22, 1777, under command of Maj. Ebenezer Bridge, by order 
of Gen. Stark and Col. Warner, and was dismissed by Gen. Lincoln after pro 
ceeding 90 miles. Roll sworn to in Worcester Co.

travel home; regiment raised to fortify passes of North river, N. Y. ; also, 3d 
Corporal, Capt. Asa Lawrence s co., Col. Poor s regt. ; pay rolls for June, July, 
and Aug., dated Fort Clinton ; also, Corporal, (late) Capt. Lawrence s co. com 
manded by Lieut. John Flint, Col. Poor s regt. ; pay roll for Sept., 1778, dated 
West Point ; also, Lieut. John Flint s co., Col. Poor s regt. ; pay roll for Nov., 
1778, dated West Point.

June 25, 1777 ; reported received State bounty: also, Private, Maj. Allen s co.,

March 9, 1779; also, Capt. Nathan Goodale s co., Col, Putnam s regt. : return 
dated Albany, Feb. 9, 1J78 : mustered by Capt. Newhall; residence, Lan 
caster : enlisted for town of Lancaster.

in the Continental Army, agreeable to resolves passed in April, 1778; said 
Sawyer, with others, hired Ebenezer Sawyer, and is reported as having paid 
10 toward his hire. 

SAWYER, REUBEX, Dracut. Enlistment agreement dated June 27, 1780, signed by 
said Sawyer and others, engaging themselves to serve in the Continental Army 
for the term of 3 months from the time of their arrival at Claverack, or such 
place of rendezvous as should be ordered ; also, receipt dated Dracut, July 17, 
1780, for bounties paid said Sawyer and others by the committee of Dracut to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 months to the credit of said

regt. and ordered part to Rhode Island and part to Fishkill : regiment raised 
to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

co.. Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt.; residence, Shrewsbury; reported received

SCAMMAN, JAMES. Order of the day, dated May 31, 1775; said Scamman, Colonel, 
appointed field officer of the day for June 1, 1775 ; also, order of the day, dated 
June 8, 1775; said Scamman, Colonel, appointed officer of the picket "to 
Night ; " also, petition addressed to the General Court, dated Pepperell 
borough, Nov. 14, 1776, signed by said Scamman, stating that as his conduct 
in connection with the battle of Bunker Hill in June, 1775, had been called in 
question, he was desirous of showing his readiness to risk his life and fortune 
in defence of his country, and as proof thereof requesting that a commission be 
issued him for the purpose of raising a regiment for the Continental service.

outh counties to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

SCAMMON, JAMES. Order of the day, dated Cambridge, May 19, 1775 ; said Scammon 
appointed field officer of the main guard for May 20, 1775; also, Colonel; 
general order dated Headquarters, Cambridge, July 22, 1775, making disposition 
of the forces about Boston and dividing the army into three grand divisions to 
consist of two brigades each ; said Scammon s regt., of Massachusetts, assigned 
to a brigade to be commanded by Brig. Gen. Heath, which, with another brigade 
and a reserve corps for defence of the several posts north of Roxbury, were to be 
commanded by Maj. Gen. Putnam ; also, Colonel ; list of field and staff officers 
appearing on a return of Capt. Philip Hubbard s co., Col. James Scammon s 
(30th) regt. [probably Oct., 1775]. 

SCAMMON, JAMES, Jr., Pepperellborough. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Hill s co., Col. 
James Scamman s (30th) regt. : company return dated Sept. 27, 1775, including 
abstract of pay to Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 3, 1775.

Nov. 2, 1782, by regimental court-martial, Capt. King, President, on charge of 
stealing leather or secreting it ; sentenced to receive 39 lashes ; sentence re 
ported remitted ; also, Capt. Nathaniel C. Allen s (8th) co., 4th Mass, regt.; 
muster rolls for May- Aug., 1783; balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 20 
months; also, list of men who died or were discharged subsequent to Jan. 1, 
1781 ; said Scanning discharged June 9, 1783, by Gen. Washington, term of 
enlistment having expired.

co. ; engaged May 17, 1777 : discharged July 22, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 5 days ;

engaged July 23, 1777 ; discharged Dec. 13, 1777 ; service, 4 mos. 21 days ; com 
pany raised for expedition against Nova Scotia and continued in service at

jamin Foster s regt. ; service, 4 days: company served at Machias from Dec. 5 
to Dec. 25, 1778; also, Lieutenant, Capt. John Hall s co., Col. Benjamin Fos 
ter s (Lincoln Co.) regt. ; service from Aug. 7, 1779, to Sept. 7, 1779, 1 mo. ;

Nov. 20, 1779, 2 mos., at Machias ; roll sworn to at Machias and endorsed " Ser 
vice at Penobscot."

SCOTT, JOHN. Return of sentences by a general court-martial, Lieut. Col. Craig, 
President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Nov. 
2, 1770, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book: said Scott, Cap 
tain, tried on charge of defrauding the United States by presenting a false pay 
roll for payment and receiving same, "for ungentleman like Behavour " in 
entering exorbitant prices for purchases made for his men, and for discharging 
men without the Colonel s permission : found guilty, and sentenced to be 
cashiered and to repay the overplus money of the pay roll.

field officers and he was the oldest Captain in the regiment and unable to

SEARGENT, BENJAMIN. Private, (late) Capt. B. Dodge s co. commanded by Lieut. 
Joseph Cheever, Col. L. Baldwin s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, 
etc., for the year 1776; reported discharged 360 miles from home. 

SEARGENT [PAUL DUDLEY]. General order dated Headquarters, Cambridge, July 
22, 1775, making disposition of the forces about Boston and dividing the army 
into 3 grand divisions to consist of 2 brigades each ; said Seargeut, Colonel of 
a regiment which, with other regiments, was to be formed into a brigade under 
the command of the senior officer, until the pleasure of the Continental Con 
gress should be known, and with another brigade and a reserve corps, were to 
be under the command of Maj. Gen. Putnam. 

SEARGENT, WILLIAM. Return dated Leicester, Dec. 18, 1778, signed by Lieut. 
James Whittemore, stating that said Seargent and others had been raised agree 
able to a resolve of April 20, 1778, and mustered and delivered to Maj. Wash- 
born, Superintendent for Worcester Co. 

SEARJENT, EPHRAIM. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned 
as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring 
field, July 11, 1780; age, 23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, ruddy; en 
gaged for town of Amesbury ; arrived at Springfield July 10, 1780 ; marched 
to camp July 11, 1780, under command of Capt. George Webb. 

SEARJKNT, SAMUEL. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned 
as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Maj. Peter Harwood, of 6th Mass. 
regt., at Springfield, July 2, 1780 ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, 
light; engaged for town of Haverhill : arrived at Springfield July 1, 1780; 
marched to camp July 2, 1780, under command of Capt. Phineas Parker.

Smith s co., Col. Timothy Bigelow s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for 
service from March 3, 1777, to May 3, 1778 ; residence, Lunenburg ; credited to 
town of Lunenburg ; reported deceased ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll 
for Jan .-Aug., 1777, dated Van Schaick s Island and sworn to in Camp at 
Stillwater ; enlisted March 3 (also given March 2) , 1777 ; enlistment, 3 years ; 
also, same co. and regt.; muster roll for Nov., 1777, sworn to at Camp near 
" the Gulf ; " also, same co. and regt. ; return dated Feb. 2, 1778 ; mustered by 
Middlesex Co. Muster Master; also, same co. arid regt. ; muster rolls for Dec., 
1777-May, 1778, dated Valley Forge ; reported sick and absent in March, 1778, 
sick in general hospital in April, 1778, died May 3, 1778.

SEARLS, LEMUEL, Southampton (probably). Private, Capt. Lemuel Pomeroy s co.,

raised to reinforce the army until April 1, 1776.

Cape; roll sworn to Jan. 12, 1779.

SEAVER, DAXIEL, Hopkinton. Private, Capt. John Homes s (Hopkiiiton) co. of 
militia, Col. Samuel Bullard s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 
1775, to Roxbury ; service, 12 days ; also, receipt dated Hopkinton, July 2, 1778, 
signed by said Seaver, given to Capt. Daniel Eames, for 100 received of him 
as a bounty to serve with reinforcements to the Continental Army at Provi 
dence or elsewhere from the date above given to Jan. 1, 1779, and in con 
sideration of the sum received, giving said Eames full power to draw the 
mileage money for 30 miles due him, the said Seaver, and all other monies that 
may become due him for .such service from the State or from the town of Hop 
kinton ; also, Private, Capt. Joseph Griffith s co., Col. John Jacobs s regt.; 
engaged June 27. 1778; service, 6 mos. 7 days: enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 
1779: also, Sergeant, Capt. Thomas Mellen s co., Col. Abner Perry s regt.; 
entered service July 28, 1780; discharged Aug. 10, 1780; service, 14 days, on 
an alarm at Rhode Island.

served therein until Dec. 6, 1780, when he was turned over to Lieut. Joseph 
McLallen to do duty until the term of his enlistment had expired.

a^so, Private, Col. Sheldon s regt. of dragoons ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from May 1, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1779; term, 3 years; also, returns of 
officers and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Elisha Sheldon s (2d) regt. 
of light dragoons, certified at Durham, April 22, 1779, and at Fishkill, June 18, 
1779; rank, Private; engaged for town of Stockbridge; engaged May 1, 1778; 
term, during war; also, return dated Jan. 28, 1781, of officers and men belong 
ing to Massachusetts in Col. Sheldon s (2d) regt. of light dragoons, made by

May -, 1778, by Lieut. Bull ; enlistment, during war.

SERJANT, EBENEZER. Private, Capt. John Davis s co. of Minute-men, Col. Fry s 
regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 7 days; reported 
enlisted Feb. 14, 1775. 

SERJANT, EBENEZER. Private, Capt. Samuel Johnson s co., Col. Johnson s regt.; 
enlisted Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 4 mos., with Northern 
army, including 13 days (265 miles) travel home. Roll sworn to at Andover. 

SERJANT, JOHN, Haverhill. Private, Capt. Daniel Hills s co. of militia, Col. John 
son s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, under command of 
Lieut. Samuel Clements to Cambridge; service, 5 days. 

SERJANT, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Putnam s co., Col. Nathan Tyler s 
regt. ; enlisted July 1, 1779; service to Dec. i, 1779, 5 mos., at Rhode Island. 

SERJANT, JONATHAN, Jr., Leicester. Private, Capt. Thomas Newhall s co. of 
militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service, 
7-3 days; reported returned home. 

SERJANT, JOSEPH. List of field officers of regiments of "Worcester Co. militia pro 
posed by Legislature Jan. 12, 1776 ; said Serjant reported as belonging to 2d 
Worcester Co. regt. raised in Lancaster, Harvard, Bolton, and Princeton. 
[Name crossed out on list.] 

SERJANT, JOSHUA. List of men raised in Essex Co. for the term of 9 months from 
the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, re 
turned as mustered by Henry Rutgers, Jr., Deputy Muster Master, dated Fish- 
kill, Aug. 1, 1778; engaged for town of Methuen; arrived at Fishkill June 18, 

1778. 

SERJANT, PAUL DUDLEY. Report of a committee of the Provincial Congress, dated 
Watertown, June 22, 1775, upon the petition of said Serjant, Colonel, setting 
forth that he marched from New Hampshire to Concord soon after the battle 
of Lexington with a body of New Hampshire militia which later comprised 
nine companies ; that he was ordered from Concord to Cambridge, where six 
of his companies disbanded themselves, but the remaining three companies 
continued in camp under said Serjant; that on April 25, 1775, the Committee 
of Safety had desired him to enlist ten companies of New Hampshire men 
which were to be in the service and under pay of Massachusetts until they 
were discharged or taken into the service of New Hampshire ; and recommend 
ing that said Serjant be commissioned by the Provincial Congress on condition 
that he should complete and fill up his regiment within 20 days from date of 
report; report accepted. 

SERJANT, ROBERT, Boston. Landsman, ship " Essex" (privateer), commanded by 
Capt. John Cathcart ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to in Suffolk 
Co., June 12, 1780; age, 22 yrs. ; residence, Boston. 

SERJANT, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. David Prouty s co., Col. Job Cushing s (Worces 
ter Co.) regt. ; marched Jiily 27, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 28, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 
8 days, including 6 days (118 miles) travel home ; company marched to rein 
force Northern army by order of Gen. Worner (Warner) . Roll dated Spencer. 

SERJANT, SAMUEL. Fifer, Capt. Caleb Brooks s co., Col. Brooks s regt. of guards; 
joined Nov. 3, 1777; service to Feb. 3, 1778, 3 mos., at Cambridge. 

SERJANT, SAMUEL. List of men raised in Suffolk Co. for the term of 9 months from 
the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, re-

Smith s (6th) regt.; return for wages for the year 1782; wages allowed said 
Serjeant for June-Dec., 1782, 7 mos. ; reported sick in Nov., 1782.

regt. ; service from Sept. 5, 1777, to date of discharge, Dec. 9 (also given Nov. 
29) , 1777, 3 mos. 5 days, in Northern department. 

SERJEANT, EBENEZER. Certificate dated Cambridge, June 19, 1775, signed by Capt. 
John Currier, stating that said Serjeant and others in his company, Col. Frye s 
regt., were in need of pouches and that each had received one, for which said 
Currier promised to be accountable. 

SERJEANT, EBENEZER. Receipt given to Benjamin Heywood, Paymaster, 4th regt., 
signed by said Serjeant and others belonging to Capt. Gilman s co., for wages 
for Dec., 1776: also, Private, Lieut. Col. Nixon s (4th) regt.; return of men 
who engaged to serve the month of Jan., 1777, dated Springfield.

SERJEANT, JOHN. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army

statvire, 5 ft. 11 in. ; complexion, fresh ; engaged for town of Leicester ; arrived 
at Springfield July 5, 1780 ; marched to camp July 5, 1780, under command of 
Capt. Froth in gham, of the artillery. 

SERJEANT, JONATHAN, Boston. Gunner, Capt. Thomas Wait Foster s co., Col. 
Richard Gridley s (Artillery) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted 
May 19, 1775 ; service, 2 rnos. 7 days ; also, Sdrgeant, Capt. Moses McFarland s 
(7th) co., Lieut. Col. Thomas Nixon s (4th) regt. ; regimental return dated

and Dec., 1776, as Sergeants in said regiment. 

SERJEANT, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Adams Bailey s (late Capt. Jacob Allen s) co., 
Col. John Bailey s (2d) regt. ; muster roll made up from Jan. 1, 1777, to Jan. 1, 
1780; enlisted Jan. 1, 1777; enlistment, during war; reported deserted March 
10, 1777.

regt., were in need of pouches and that each had received one, for which said 
Currier promised to be accountable. 

SERJEANT, MOSES. Private, Capt. Oliver Titcomb s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. 
of guards ; enlisted Nov. 10, 1777 ; service to April 2, 1778, 4 mos. 24 days, at 
Charlestown and Cambridge ; regiment raised to guard Lieut. Gen. Burgoyne s 
army after his surrender. Rolls dated Winter Hill. 

SERJEANT, NATHANIEL, Rutland. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John 
Glover, at Springfield, July 7, 1780; age, 18 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; com 
plexion, light ; engaged for town of Rutland ; marched to camp July 7, 1780, 
under command of Capt. Dix ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service 
and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. 

SERJEANT, NATHANIEL. Comnmnication addressed to the General Court, dated 
Camp at Sewall s Point, March 28, 1776, signed by Col. William Prescott, 
stating that said Sergeant had acted as a Lieutenant in Capt. Jonathan Minot s 
co., said Prescott s regt., during Dec., 1775, and Jan., 1776, and requesting that 
a warrant might be issued to him in the capacity named : also, Lieutenant, 
Capt. Joshua Lealand s co. of guards; engaged Oct. 7, 1779; discharged Nov. 
10, 1779; service, 1 mo. 4 (also given 1 mo. 3) days; company detached from 
militia by order of Gen. Hancock to man forts at and about Boston until Nov. 
10, 1779, and stationed at Boston under Maj. Nathaniel Heath.

SERJENT, DIAMOND, Frenchman s Bay. Private, Capt. Henry Dyer s co. of rangers ; 
enlisted March 17, 1780; discharged May 1, 1780; service, 1 mo. 14 days; com 
pany raised for defence of eastern Massachusetts by order of Col. John Allan, 
commanding officer at Machias and Superintendent of Eastern Indian depart 
ment ; also, same co. ; roll made up for rations and sworn to at Boston ; said 
Serjent credited with 44 rations; company raised in No. 4, Gouldsborough, 
Frenchman s Bay, Pleasant River, and Narraguagus.

Manchester.

SERLS, JOSEPH, Beverly. Private, Lieut. Peter Shaw s co., which marched probably 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 2 days ; also, list of men raised to serve 
in the Continental Army from 1st, 2d, and 3d cos. in Beverly, as returned by 
Capt. Larkin Thorndike, Capt. John Woodbery, and Capt. Joseph R[ae], dated 
Feb. 13, 1778 ; residence, Beverly ; engaged for town of Beverly ; joined Capt. 
William Porter s co., Col. Francis s regt. ; term, 3 years ; reported as belonging 
to 2d Beverly co. 

SERLS, JOSHUA, Montague. Private, Capt. Thomas Grover s co., Col. Williams s 
regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 

10 days; also, Capt. Robert Oliver s co., Col. Ephraim Doolittle s (24th) regt. ; 
receipt for advance pay, signed by said Serls and others, dated Charlestown, 
June 27, 1775. 

SERLS, SAMUEL. Drummer, Capt. Joshua Benson s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Rufus 
Putnam s (5th) regt. ; muster roll for Jan., 1781, dated Garrison West Point. 

SERMUG, JETHRO, Falmouth, Barnstable Co. Private, 6th co., Col. Gamaliel Brad 
ford s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 15, 1777, to 
June 5, 1778; reported deceased; also, Capt. John Russell s co., Col. Brad 
ford s regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of entering service, Feb. 15 [1777], 
to March 31 [1777] ; credited with 46 days subsistence, including allowance for 

11 days (220 miles) travel on march from Boston to Bemiington ; also, same co. 
and regt. ; muster roll for Dec., 1777; reported on command with Col. Hay at 
Albany; also, same co. and regt.; return [year not given]; residence, Fal 
mouth; enlisted for town of Falmouth; enlisted Jan. 1, 1777; joined April 6, 
1777 ; mustered by County and Continental Muster Masters ; reported on com 
mand with Lieut. Col. Hay at Albany. 

SEROTE, JOHN. Corporal, Capt. Archibald McAllister s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s 
regt. ; enlisted July 11, 1779; service to Sept. 24, 1779, 2 mos. 13 days, on expe 
dition against Majorbagaduce. [Name appears as John Serale on a duplicate

marched from Sutton to Providence, R. I., Dec. 10, 1776, on an alarm; also, 
Capt. Bartholomew Woodbury s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt. ; enlisted Aug.

Worcester Co. Aug. 16, 1777.

SESSIONS, ALEXANDER. Lieutenant, Capt. John Sherman s co., Col. Gideon Burt s 
regt.; entered service June 16, 1782; se rvice, 6 days; mileage to and from 
Northampton (90 miles) allowed said Sessions ; company marched to Spring 
field and Northampton in support of the government and was allowed horse 
rations.

in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, returned as received of Justin 
Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. James Cooper, at Springfield, July 19, 1779 ; Capt. 
Robertson s co., Col. Johnson s regt.; age, 20 yrs ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; hair, 
light ; engaged for town of Boxford. 

SESSIONS, SAMUEL, Andover. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Lovejoy s (Andover) co. 
commanded by Lieut. John Adams, Col. Samuel Johnson s regt., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge, via Billerica ; service, 
87; days; reported returned home.

made up of men from Concord, Weston, Lexington, Acton, and Lincoln.

Camp Totoway Oct. 25, 1780.

Mitchell s regt. ; age, 31 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 3 in. ; complexion, light ; residence,

ered said Sever and others belonging to Capt. James Mellen s co., Col. Jonathan 
Ward s regt. ; also, Private, Capt. Mellen s co., Col. Ward s regt. ; company 
return [probably Oct., 1775].

at Rhode Island ; company marched from Taunton Sept. 29, 1777, under com 
mand of Col. George Williams on a secret expedition and was discharged Oct. 
29, 1777, by Gen. Spencer.

SEVER, ISAAC. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as re 
ceived of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Maj. Peter Harwood, of 6th Mass, 
regt., at Springfield, July 6, 1780 ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; complexion, 
light ; engaged for town of "Westminster ; arrived at Springfield July 5, 1780 ;

regt.; also, Private, Capt. Joseph Fox s (3d) co., 16th Mass, regt.; pay roll 
for June and July, 1780; service, 26 days; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Westminster for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched July 3, 1780; discharged Jan. 6, 1781; service, 6 mos. 14 days, 
travel (200 miles) included. 

SEVER. JAMES. Ensign, Capt. Rufus Lincoln s (4th) co., Lieut. Col. JohnBrooks s 
(7th) regt. ; muster roll for June, 1781 ; commissioned Feb. 1, 1781 ; also, re 
turns of effectives, dated West Point, June 15, and Peekskill, June 29, 1781 ; 
reported 011 furlough in Massachusetts ; also, return of effectives, dated Phillips- 
burgh, Aug. 17, 1781 ; reported on the rear guard ; also reported at Chatterton [ ?] 
Bridge ; also, return of effectives, dated Peekskill, Aug. 25, 1781 ; reported on 
picket duty in camp; also, muster rolls for July, Aug., and Sept., 1781; re 
ported on command with Col. Swift in Sept., 1781; also, returns of effectives, 
dated Pejekskill, Oct. 5, and Oct. 12, 1781; reported on duty with Col. Swift; 
also, returns of effectives, dated Oct. 19, and Peekskill, Oct. 25, 1781 ; reported 
on picket duty in camp; also, return of effectives, dated Peekskill, Nov. 9, 
1781; reported detached on fatigue duty; also, Capt. Lincoln s (3d) co., Lieut.

Oct. and Nov., 1781, dated York Huts ; also, return of effectives, dated Jan. 18,

tives between March 8, 1782, and April 26, 1782, dated Hutts and West Point ; 
reported 011 command at the Lines ; also, return of effectives, dated May 3, 1782 ; 
reported on command at the Lines; also, return of effectives, dated May 9, 
1782 ; reported on fatigue duty in garrison ; also, return of effectives, dated 
Huts, May 10, 1782 ; reported on fatigue duty ; also, returns of effectives be 
tween June 14, 1782, and Aug. 9, 1782, dated West Point ; reported on duty at 
the Lines; also, returns of effectives between Aug. 13, 1782, and Dec. 6, 1782, 
dated Verplanck s Point, West Point, and New Windsor ; reported on duty with 
light infantry ; also, returns of effectives between Dec. 20, 1782, and Feb. 13, 1783, 
dated Camp New Windsor; also, returns of effectives between Feb. 14, 1783, 
and Feb. 28, 1783 ; reported on furlough in Massachusetts from Dec. 20, 1782, by 
leave of Gen. Gates; also, register of furloughs granted subsequent to Jan. 1, 
1781 ; leave given said Sever by Gen. Gates to go from New Windsor to Kings 
ton Dec. 20, 1782, to remain until March -, 1783.

co., Col. John Greaton s (2d) regt.; return [year not given]; residence, Ken 
nebec ; mustered by County Muster Master Barber; reported deserted.

23 days, under Brig. Gen. "Wadsworth at the Eastward, travel (6 clays) included ; 
company reported as having marched to Thomaston. Roll sworn to at York. 

SEWART, ABRAHAM. Private, Capt. Zebulon Norten s co., Col. John Ashley s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 27, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 14, 1777 ; 
service, 23 days, at the Northward. Roll dated Equivalent. 

SEWEL, ELIAS, Bridgewater. Private, Capt. Josiah Hayden s co., Col. Bailey s 
regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
12 days. 

SEWEL, ELIAS. Private, Capt. Nathan Snow s co., Col. Hawes s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 
24, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 9 days, at Rhode Island on a secret expedition. Roll 
sworn to in Plymouth Co. 

SEWELL, . Report of guard detail and prisoners under confinement, dated Ticon- 

deroga, Sept. 26, 1776, made to Maj. Gen. Gates, taken from Col. Ephraim 
"Wheelock s Orderly Book; said Sewell, Corporal, of Capt. Pratt s co.. Col. 
"Wind s regt., together with Neal O Neil, of Capt. Howell s co., Col. Wind s 
regt., confined 9 nights on charge of theft; also, return of sentences by a gen 
eral court-martial, Maj. Morris, President, appearing in a general order dated 
Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Oct. 3, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim "SVheelock s 
Orderly Book; said Sewell and Neal O Niel, of [Col.] Wayn s regt., tried on 
charge of theft but found not guilty. 

SEWELL, . List of prisoners taken by Lieut. Gen. Burgoyne to be exchanged for 

British prisoners taken by Maj. Gen. Gates, dated Albany, Oct. 24, 1777; said 
Sewell, 1st Lieutenant, to be exchanged for Lieut. Dowling, of the 29th regt. 



1022 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

SEWELL, DUMMER. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Feb. 14, 1776 ; said Sewell chosen Lieutenant Colonel, 1st Lincoln Co. 
regt., in the room of Samuel Harnden, who was elected Brigadier ; appointment 
concurred in by Council Feb. 14, 1776; reported commissioned Feb. 14, 1776; 
also, Lieutenant Colonel, Col. Joseph North s regt. ; list of officers appointed 
to command various companies raised in the year 1776 in accordance with an 
act passed to raise one-fourth part of the men in Lincoln Co., as returned by 
Samuel Harnden to Maj. Gen. James Warren. 

SEWELL, ELIAS. Private, Capt. Josiah Hayden s co., Gen. John Thomas s regt.; 
muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 3 mos., 1 week, 
1 day; also, muster roll for Sept. and Oct., 1775, dated Camp at Roxbury ; re 
ported enlisted April 19, 1775 ; also reported a negro. 

SEWELL, HENRY. Captain, Col. Sprout s (12th) regt. ; Continental Army pay ac 
counts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, Captain, 12th Mass. 
regt. ; return of officers in actual service, certified at Boston, July 13, 1780. 

SEWELL, MOSES. Captain, 5th co., 1st York Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers 
[year not given]. 

SEWELL, STEPHEN, Marblehead. Captain, Col. Henry Jackson s regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from March 1, 1777, to July 1, 1778 ; reported 
resigned July 1, 1778 ; also, return certified at Camp near Morristown, April 30, 
1780, of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jack 
son s regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s 
regt., who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry 
Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9, 1779 ; rank, Captain ; resi 
dence, Marblehead ; appointed March 1, 1777 ; said Sewell returned among 
officers belonging to Col. William R. Lee s regt. who were not included in the 
above arrangement ; reported resigned ; family of said Sewell reported as at 
Marblehead . 

SEWELL, THOMAS. Capt. Edward Burbeck s co., Col. Gridley s (Artillery) regt.; 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money endorsed " Jany 6th 1776." 

SEWYEB, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. William Pearson s (3d) co. ; service between 
June 1, 1776, and Aug. 31, 1776, 12 days; company stationed at Gloucester for 
defence of seacoast. 

SEXTON, . [This name also appears under the form of Saxton.] 

SEXTON, ABNER. Private, Capt. David Mosley s co., Col. John Mosley s (Hamp 
shire Co.) regt. ; enlisted Oct. 21, 1776 ; discharged Nov. 17, 1776 ; service, 28 
days ; company marched under command of Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson to 
reinforce Northern army; roll dated Westfield ; also, descriptive list of men 
raised in Hampshire Co. to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 
months, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, as returned by Noah Goodman, 
Superintendent ; Capt. Moseley s co., Col. Moseley s regt. ; age, 27 yrs. ; stat 
ure, 5 ft. 6 in. ; hair, black ; engaged for town of Westfield ; reported delivered 
to Capt. J. Cooper; also, list of men returned as received of Noah Goodman, 
Superintendent for Hampshire Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated 
Springfield. 

SEXTON, ASHER. Capt. Sylvanus Willcox s co., Col. John Brown s regt.; entered 
service Feb. 22, 1777; discharged April 8, 1777; service, 45 days, at Mt. Inde 
pendence ; also, descriptive list of men raised in Berkshire Co. to serve in the 
Continental Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 
1779, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. Christopher 
Marshall, at Springfield, July 16, 1779; Capt. Noble s co., Col. Ashley s regt. ; 
age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of 
Sheffield. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 1023 

SEXTON, BENJAMIN. Private, Capt. David Mosely s co., Col. John Mosly s regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 21, 1777; discharged Sept. 30, 1777; service, 15 days, on expe 
dition to Saratoga, including travel home. 

SKXTON, DAVID (also given DAVID, Jr.). Musician, Capt. Enoch Chapin s co., Col. 
Jacob Gerrish s regt. of guards; engaged July 1(5, 1778; discharged Dec. 31, 
1778; service, 5 nios. 18 days; company detached from Hampshire Co. militia 
to guard stores at Springfield and Brookfield for (5 months from July 1, 1778; 
roll dated Springfield; also, Fifer, Capt. Abel Dinsmor s co., Col. Elisha Por 
ter s (Hampshire Co.) regt.; enlisted July 24, 1779; discharged Aug. 31, 1779; 
service, 1 mo. 13 days, at New London, Conn., including 5 days (102 miles) 
travel home ; also, descriptive list dated Deerfield, July 24, 1780, of men de 
tached from Hampshire Co. militia, agreeable to resolve of June 22, 1780, and 
returned by Maj. David Dickinson as mustered by him by order of Lieut. Col. 
David Wells; 1st or 9th co., 5th Hampshire Co. regt.; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 4 in.; complexion, light; hair, light; eyes, light; engaged for town of 
Deerfield ; term, 3 months. 

SEXTON, FREDERICK. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Hickok s co., Lieut. Col. Sears s 
regt.; enlisted Aug. 6, 1781; discharged Nov. 8, 1781; service, 3 mos. 7 days, 
including travel (4 days) home ; regiment raised in Berkshire Co. to serve for 
3 months. Roll endorsed " Col Elisha Porters Reg t." 

SEXTON, JASPER. Bombardier, Capt. Thomas Seward s co., Col. John Crane s 
(Artillery) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 1, 
1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; reported as serving 11 mos. as Bombardier, 24 nios. as 
Matross ; also reported as belonging to Massachusetts ; also, Corporal, same co. 
and regt. ; muster rolls for Sept., Nov., and Dec., 1777 ; also, same co. and regt. ; 
muster roll for May, 1778, dated Camp Valley Forge ; also, Matross, same co. 
and regt. ; return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 1, 1777, and 
who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., approved Dec. 
29, 1779 ; also, same co. and regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for ser 
vice from Jan. 1, 1780, to Feb. 1, 1780; also, descriptive list dated Camp New 
Windsor, Jan. 12, 1780 [81]; Capt. Thomas Seward s co., 3d Artillery regt. ; 
rank, Matross ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, dark ; engaged 
Feb. 1, 1777, by Capt. Seward; term, 3 years; reported discharged Feb. 1, 1780. 
[See Joseph Saxton.] 

SEXTON, JESSE. Capt. Samuel Clark s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s (Berkshire Co.) 
regt. ; entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 21, 1777 ; service, 8 days ; 
company took part in battle of Wallumsick near Bennington Aug. 16, 1777, 
and later convoyed provisions to Pittsfield ; roll certified at Williamstown ; 
also, Private, sameco. and regt.; entered service Sept. 7, 1777; discharged 
Sept. 30, 1777 ; service, 24 days ; company marched to Pawlet by order of Maj. 
Gen. Lincoln to serve for 20 days from time of joining at headquarters and was 
discharged at Pawlet, 60 miles from home ; roll certified at Williamstown. 

SEXTON, JOHN. Private, Capt. John King s co., Col. Ashely s (Berkshire Co.) 
regt. ; entered service July 21, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 15, 1777 ; service, 25 days. 

SEXTON, JOSEPH. Sergeant, Capt. James Shaw s co. ; entered service Sept. 24. 1777 ; 
discharged Oct. 18, 1777; service, 32 days, with Northern army, travel (140 
miles) included; company detached from Col. Charles Pynchion s regt. and 
ordered to join army under Gen. Gates to serve for 30 days, unless sooner 
discharged. 

SEXTON, NOAH. Private, Capt. Gideon Stebbens s co., 4th Hampshire Co. regt. ; 
service, 3 days; company marched to Northampton in June, 1782, to suppress 
the mob. Roll dated Belchertown. 

SEXTON, OLIVER. Private, Capt. John Morgan s co. ; enlisted Jan. 3, 1778: dis 
charged July 1, 1778; service, 5 mos. 28 days; company detached from militia

of Hampshire and Worcester counties to guard stores and magazines at Brook-

SEXTON, PHINEAS, Westfield. Private, in a Westfield co. of Minute-men com 
manded by Lieut. John Shephard, which marched April 20, 1775, in response 
to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 1 week 1 day ; reported enlisted into 
the army April 28, 1775; also, Capt. Warham Parks s co., Col. Timothy Dan- 
ielson sregt. ; company return dated Roxbury [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Roxbury, Dec. 23, 
1775; also, Private, Capt. Nathan Rowle s co., Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson s 
detachment of Hampshire Co. militia; entered service Jan. 9, 1777; service to 
April 3, 1777, 83 days, at Ticonderoga ; mileage home (180 miles) allowed ; 
also, Capt. Daniel Sacket s co., Col. Ruggles Woodbridge s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 
20, 1777 ; discharged Nov 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 18 days, in Northern depart 
ment, including 8 days (152 miles) travel home. 

SEXTON, SAMUEL. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. James Shaw s co. of matrosses, Col. Charles 
Pynchon s (1st Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen in 
said company, dated Wilbraham, Aug. 7, 1776; ordered in Council Sept. 11, 

1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned Sept. 11, 1776. 

SEXTON, WILLIAM, Sheffield. Descriptive list dated Lenox, Aug. 20, 1781, of men 
raised in Berkshire Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, and delivered to 
William Walker, Superintendent for said comity; Capt. Spoor s co., Col. Ash 
ley s regt. ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, dark; hair, black; 
occupation, laborer ; residence, Sheffield ; engaged for town of Sheffield ; term, 
3 years ; reported receipted for by Capt. Smith. 

SEYMOAR, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Joseph Barns s co., Col. Benjamin Symonds s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service April 26, 1777 ; discharged May 19, 1777 ; 
service, 24 days; company called out by order of Maj. Gen. Gates and ordered 
to march to Saratoga. Roll sworn to at Laiiesborough. 

SEYMOR, THOMAS. Matross, Capt. Amos Lincoln s co. of matrosses; service from 
Nov. 1, 1782, to date of discharge, July 18, 1783, 8 mos. 18 days. Roll dated 
Boston. 

SEYMOR, WILLIAM. Sergeant, Capt. Enoch Noble s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt. ; en 
tered service May 20, 1778; discharged Feb. 7, 1779; service, 8 mos. 19 days, at 
North river ; regiment raised for 8 months from time of arrival at Peekskill. 
Roll sworn to in Berkshire Co. 

SEYMORE, JOHN. Matross, Capt. John Calender s co., Col. Richard Gridley s (Ar 
tillery) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted June 6, 1775; service, 
2 mos. ; also, Capt. Lieut. William Perkins s co., Col. Gridley s regt. ; company 
return [probably Oct., 1775] ; reported "Regular Deserter." 

SEYMORE, THOMAS, Maiden. Matross, Capt. Joseph Balch s (2d) co., Col. Thomas

listed April 16, 1781 ; service to Nov. 1, 1782, 18 mos. 15 days.
